loans.name: Rose Namubiru's Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 50 years old and married with 8 children between 30 and 12 years of age. Six of them are in school. The community she resides in and works in is semi-urban, within a slum and low-lying area that is vulnerable to floods.

Rose has been operating her small food shop for 20 years. She sells her food mostly to families that live in the area. Rose’s main challenges are the thieves in the area and stiff competition.

Rose plans to use this loan to buy sugar, salt, rice and maize flour. By increasing her stock, Rose hopes to keep her customers coming back. In addition, buying these raw materials in bulk will decrease her transportation costs.

Through her loans and the profits from her business, Rose has been able to contribute to the running of the home and to paying the school fees of her children.

Rose has successfully paid back more than 20 loans since working with MCDT. She hopes one day she can afford to build a house and buy a big refrigerator.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
This is Sallay C.; she sells palm oil here in Makeni town. Sallay, a widow with 2 children, is 55. For the past 25 years now, Sallay has been able to make ends meet through the selling of palm oil. Since she joined SMT, Sallay has experienced a great improvement in her life. Her stock of palm oil increases and ultimately, she realises greater profit than she used to before joining SMT.

Sallay has finished repayment successfully and without any hiccups. She is asking now for another loan of US$ 300.

loans.use: Buy more gallons of palm oil to increase the size of her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ya Kaday Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ya Kaday. Its members include: Regina K. who sells cooked rice; Yeabu B. who sells ready-to-wear clothes, and Yeabu M. who sells palm oil. The three are asking for a loan of US$ 1050. This group has been with SMT for 2 years now. They always repay their loans on time and then ask again for a new loan to further increase their businesses.

Regina is the leader of Ya Kaday group. She was born in Rolakoh 40 years ago. She now lives with her motor-driver husband with whom she has 5 children.

loans.use: To buy more plates, spoons, and cooking utensils, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
This is Justice group. Its leader is Mohamed S.. Other members include: Osman M., Mariatu J., and Mabinty K.. The members of this group are petty traders, selling assorted goods. They have completed repaying their previous loan and are now asking for a new one. They want to be loaned the sum of US$ 1,125. With this, they`ll be able to buy more goods, increase sales and eventually, profit.

Mohamed, the group`s leader, is 45. He was born at Mile 91 about 70 miles outside of Makeni. Mohamed now lives in Makeni, where he does his business. He is married with 4 children. Mohamed has been in his current business for 3 years now.

loans.use: Increase the size of their businesses

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. is 59 years old, is married and takes care of 2 people. She has been a member of the Boucotte village bank for the past 7 years. She would like to buy tinted fabric boubous (traditional African clothing) and to resell them in Ziguinchor. Fatou also manufactures soap. She is a hard-working woman, known for this quality in her community. The income from her business helps her take part in the family 's everyday expenditures and their medical care. She is requesting a loan which will be refunded in six months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou S., 59 ans, mariée, 02 personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Est depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter des boubous en tissu teinté et revendre à Ziguinchor. Fatou est aussi productrice de savon. C’est une femme travailleuse et exemplaire au niveau de son groupe. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of tinted fabric boubous (traditional African clothing)

loans.name: Hellen Nakato's Group

texts.en:
Hellen N. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 24 years old, single, and has no children. Helen lives in a slum in an urban suburb of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Hellen began operating her business of running a canteen upon joining MCDT. There is a ready market for her goods, especially during the school year as children are her biggest customers. Since she began operating, Hellen has expanded her business to include a pay phone that also brings in daily income. Her greatest difficulty is that sometimes the school children do not have enough money to pay for her goods.

With this loan Hellen plans on boosting her business and helping pay her sister’s school fees. Hellen hopes that one day she will have enough profits to open up a big shop.

Hellen has successfully paid back six loans since she began working with MCDT.

loans.use: Invest in business to help pay school fees

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Odette Aissatou

texts.fr:
Odette Aissatou M. is 35 years old, is married and has 4 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Ressortissantes village bank in Kaguitte for the past 4 and a half years. She buyys palm oil and dry fish in Yarang, where she also buys supplies of shrimp, which she resells in Ziguinchor. Odette wants to build her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan which will be refunded in six months in only one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Odette Aissatou M., 35 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes de Kaguitte depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle achète de l’huile de palme et du poisson sec à Yarang, s’approvisionne aussi en crevette et revend à Ziguinchor. Odette veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of forestry and halieutic products

loans.name: Victoria Namakula's Group

texts.en:
Victoria N. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 39 years old and married with five children. Her children are 21, 18, 15, 12 and 9 years old. The three youngest children are in school while the two oldest work. Victoria lives in an urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Victoria has been operating her kiosk and selling motorcycle oil for the past six years. She buys products for the kiosk from a nearby market, but must travel into Kampala via shared taxi to purchase motorcycle oil. Victoria sells samosas, sweets, and breads out of her kiosk, mainly to school children . She sells the motor oil from her home early in the morning and late in the evening.

With this loan Victoria plans on buying raw materials for cooking and additional motor oil. Victoria started the center in Mulago and has been working with MCDT for many years. She decided to start the center because she wanted to be able to pay for her children’s school fees.

Victoria has successfully repaid 12 loans and since she began working with MCDT, she has been able to grow her business, provide for her family, and pay school fees.

Victoria hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house one day .

loans.use: Increase motor oil and food stocks

loans.name: Veronica Owembabazi ’S Group

texts.en:
Veronica, 37, is the leader of this 5-member group. She is a single mother with two children,14 and 9 years old. Both children are in school. Veronica had an accident that caused the amputation of one of her legs.

The community she lives in is semi-urban. One of her challenges is the ever-increasing house rent fees due to the influx of Sudanese war migrants. Veronica deems this as a challenge because she may be thrown out of the house if she fails to pay what these migrants can offer the landlords.

She has recently taken a loan of Shillings 500,000/= (US$ 310) .She used the loan to increase her stock and pay rent for three months. She is able to meet the family's basic needs out of the profits she makes from her business.

She is able to send her children to school, fend for her family better, and has learnt to be hard-working because of MCDT loans. She has managed to make herself a metal kiosk, thus reducing the hazards of the weather. There is a ready market for her merchandise.

One of her plans is to make this kiosk bigger to create space for a refrigerator so that she can pack ready-to-eat fruits and fruit juice for sale. She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

She has successfully paid back 8 loans.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle Burgaleta de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de chofer de radio taxi, de la cual provienen sus ingresos mensuales. El credito que solicita es para la compra de una radio de comunicación ya que por el momento alquila una radio de la empresa donde trabaja, pero el costo es muy elevado y prefiere comprar una aunque a medio uso pero que sea de su propiedad. De esta manera, sus ingresos no se verán mermados por el alquiler mensual de la radio. No tiene crédito con IMPRO, es cliente nuevo pero califica para obtener un crédito, después del análisis de su flujo de caja.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Reynaldo lives with his in laws on Burgaleta St. in the Achachicala neighborhood of LaPaz. He works as a chauffeur of a radio taxi which provides him with a monthly income. The loan he is asking for would be to purchase a radio for his taxi since he currently rents one from the company where he works. The rental cost is extremely elevated and he prefers to buy one, even a used one, so that it is his own. Thus his income will not be altered by the purchase of a radio since he is currently renting one. He does not have any previous credit with IMPRO but after a cash flow analysis he qualifies for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a radio for his radio taxi to eliminate the cost of a monthly rental.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Albina's first loan.

Albina belongs to the Aleli Village Bank. She is a 44-year-old widow and has four children. She sells sweets, gelatines and lollipops which she makes. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm in the Fe y Alegría school’s door in her district and she is a mobile seller.

Albina needs a 1750 soles ($US625) loan to buy chocolate, biscuits, gelatine, toffees and fizzy drinks.

She would like to expand her business, have her own capital and she wants her children to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy chocolate, biscuits, gelatine, toffees and fizzy drinks.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo vive en casa de sus padre en la calle Heroínas 16 de julio de la zona de Alto Mira flores de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de cerrajería, pues desde pequeño aprendió con sus tíos. Hugo no es profesional pero la gente ya conoce la calidad de su trabajo y le hacen pedidos; el elabora ventanas, puertas, rejas etc. todo relacionado con fierro y en sus ratos libres realiza trabajos de diseño grafico y con estas dos actividades el cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y estudios ya que sus padres emigraron a España a trabajar pero aun no consiguen un trabajo estable. El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de una máquina soldadora que le ayudará mucho en su trabajo. No tiene crédito con IMPRO , es cliente nuevo pero el análisis de sus ingresos y gastos lo califica para obtener un crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Sr. Hugo lives in his father’s home in Calle Heroinas in the Alto Miraflores neighborhood of LaPaz. There he works as a locksmith, a trade he learned from his uncles. Hugo is not a graduate but many people have come to recognize the quality of his work and they come to him with orders for windows, gates, doors, etc – anything related to iron work. In his free time he also does graphic design work; with these two activities he is able to cover his food and academic needs since his parents have moved to Spain and as of yet have not found a steady job. The loan he is asking for now is for the purchase of a welding machine that will assist him greatly in his work. Although he is a new client with IMPRO his credit analysis shows that he qualifies with his expenses and income for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a welding machine for his iron making (windows, gates, doors) business

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Dionisia's first loan.

Dionisia belongs to the Aleli Village Bank. She lives with her husband, is 33 and has five children. She and her husband have a joiner’s workshop at home in the Olives association. They do all sorts of furniture according to their clients’ requests, but they especially produce cages for livestock farming. Then they sell their products in the San Juan market on Sundays.

Dionisa needs a 1000 soles ($US350) loan to purchase wood.

She dreams about expanding her shop, equipping it with more machines and improving her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Pelagia Aquelina

texts.es:
Ms. Pelagia M. is a woman farmer of humble origins who works incessantly on the arduous tasks of the fields. She works the land daily in order to support her family and her 7 school age children. For this reason, Ms. M. works arduously in her crop fields, where she grows potatoes, beans, olluco (an Andean potato), corn, wheat, oats, and barley. Despite the various losses they have suffered, Ms. M. and her family persevere, motivated by their desire for self-improvement. She is requesting a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles in order to purchase fertilizers so that she can prepare her land and improve the quality of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Pelagia es una mujer agricultora de condición humilde que trabaja incesantemente en las duras tareas del campo, labra la tierra diariamente para conseguir el sustento de su familia y el de sus 7 hijos que están en edad escolar. Por ello, Doña Pelagia trabaja arduamente en sus campos de cultivo, donde siembra papa, habas, olluco, maíz, trigo, avena y cebada. Doña Pelagia y su familia a pesar de las pérdidas que han venido sufriendo por diferente índole, perseveran, motivados por sus deseos de superación. Ella solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para poder comprar fertilizantes; y así pueda preparar y abonar su terreno para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers in order to improve the quality of her crops

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Ms. Paola R. lives in a rented home in the Tocopilla passage of the Bajo Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz with her family. She makes gym shorts for men and children for a living. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine, since the one she currently has cannot meet customer demand. Furthermore, this business generates employment opportunities for two more people, who also earn income in order to cover their bare necessities and support their families.

She has a favorable credit history, which is why she can request a new loan. She has been a member of Impro since 2007, and her payments have always been made following the established agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paola vive en alquiler en el pasaje Tocopilla de la zona Bajo tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz con su familia; la actividad que realiza es la confección de Pantalones cortos deportivos para niños y adultos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina de costura ya que con la que tiene no abastece la demanda de sus clientes. Además con esta actividad genera empleo a dos personas las cuales de alguna manera también generan sus ingresos para poder cubrir sus mínimas necesidades y mantener a sus familias.

Su antecedente es bueno por lo cual puede acceder aun nuevo crédito. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y sus pagos han sido siempre efectuados dentro de los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine for making gym shorts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase chairs and other materials to provide her pupils with a more comfortable atmosphere.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small flower shop in her community.

loans.name: El Eden Iii Group

texts.en:
Celenia S. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in a small town in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Two years ago she opened a small colmado, or store that sells staple foods and accessories. But she lacks enough capital to buy inventory for her store. The money from this loan will go towards buying oil, rice, sugar and flour to sell to her customers. Celenia said that she hopes to continue to grow her business so that she will be able to support her five children (ages 21, 20, 19, 17, and 16) and continue providing them with the education they need to obtain good jobs in the future.

Celenia leads a five-person group, El Eden III. Each of these Dominican entrepreneurs unites in solidarity, so that they can secure access to funding that they would never otherwise be able to receive on their own. One of the other women in the group has a small salon, one prepares and sells food in the street and the others sell clothing.

On behalf of Celenia, the El Eden group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support for this group!

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business producing food in a new market.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Mr. Marco A. lives in his parents’ home in the Alto Chijini zone of the city of La Paz. He is a business man who travels to the border to bring various types of home appliances and distributes them in the city. His parents gave him a space on their property so that he could build two rooms, since they currently only have one that he shares with his brother.

He is requesting a loan in order to construct a flagstone and walls for two rooms. This is the second time he requests a loan. His credit check favorably qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona Alto Chijini en la ciudad de La Paz. El señor Marco es comerciante, realiza viajes a la frontera de donde trae productos electrodomésticos varios que luego distribuye en el comercio de la ciudad. Sus padres le otorgaron un espacio en su propiedad para que pueda construir dos habitaciones, ya que solo cuentan con una habitación que comparte con su hermano.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra gruesa de una loza y muros perimetrales para dos habitaciones. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construct a flagstone and walls for two rooms

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Mr. Roger A. lives in his parents’ home in the Alto Chijini zone of the city of La Paz. He works independently making computers in order to sell them to computer stores or to individuals. In the home of his parents, who are now elderly, they have been building three rooms that will be his dwelling, since he and his brother currently share a room that does not leave them enough space to do what they have to do.

The loan shall be used for finish work on the two rooms. This is the second time that he requests a loan, and his credit check favorably qualifies him to obtain another one.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Roger A. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Alto Chijini de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Roger trabaja por cuenta propia armando computadoras que luego vende en tiendas del ramo y a personas particulares. En casa de sus padres que ya son mayores de edad realizaron la construcción en obra gruesa de tres habitaciones, las que serán su vivienda, ya que en el momento comparten los hermanos una habitación que no les da el espacio para desarrollar sus actividades.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones. Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Finish work for two rooms

loans.name: Kadidiatou Bassène

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou Bassène D. is married and has 2 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Gadapara village bank in Kolda for the past 4 and a half years. She owns a restaurant and has always grown and evolved in this sector. Her restaurant is very accessible to mechanics and tradesmen in the area who constitute a large portion of her customers. She currently employs two women. She would like to grow her small business, and in turn, increase her income. Kadidiatou is asking for a loan which will be repaid in a single payment after six months.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadidiatou Bassène D., mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Gadapara à Kolda depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle est restauratrice et a toujours évolué dans ce secteur. Son restaurant est très accessible aux mécaniciens et boutiquiers qui constituent une bonne part de la clientèle. Elle emploi deux femmes qu’elle paie. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus Kadidiatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Ndèye Mame

texts.fr:
Ndèye Mame D. is 36 years old, unmarried with 2 children in her care, and has been a member of Bignona Bassène for 1 and a half years. She is one of the best in her group. Her business consists of buying and re-selling honey, palm oil, and peanut paste. Her income allows her to participate in her family's expenses. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndèye Mame D., 36 ans, célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bignona Bassène depuis 1 ans et demi. Elle est une des meilleures de son groupe. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre du miel, de l’huile de palme et de la patte d’arachide. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell honey, palm oil, peanut paste, and lemon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of pork and chicken meat to resell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a great variety of beauty products to replenish a small business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes Group

texts.en:
Cerna A. is a middle-aged mother with two daughters.  When asked about her dreams for her future, she replies, “For now, I juS.have to keep moving ahead”.  Her firS.loan from Esperanza allowed her to do juS.that, and now she has returned for a second.  Cerna sells rice, chicken and beans from her home in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.  When she is not preparing food at lunch time, she sells pants, shoes, shirts and blouses in the street and from her home. She will use the money from this loan to buy more food to cook and sell, as well as to buy more clothing to sell in the street.

Cerna A. leads a 10-person group, Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes, which means “Elegant Working Women." Each of these Dominican entrepreneurs unites with the others in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would never otherwise be able to get on their own. This group pays its loan back together to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.  Each woman has her own individual business, but finds support from the others as they come together every two weeks to learn business skills and make their payments together.

On behalf of Cerna, Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, and for your commitment to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy shoes, pants, shirts and blouses, as well as rice, beans, and chicken, for resale.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria has already obtained one loan from KIVA, which she used in order to purchase more merchandise and broaden her clothing business inventory. She said, “Thanks to you, my business has grown considerably. I now have more merchandise and increased sales.”

She is now requesting a second loan in order to put up walls to cover her business space and shield it from the cold and heat, thus giving her customers more comfort while shopping. She is requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to remodel her business space.

My family and I are grateful for the great support you have given us to move our business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María ya recibió un préstamo de parte de KIVA el cual le serbio para comprar mas mercancía y tener inventario mas amplia en su negocio de vender ropa. Ella dijo "Gracias a ustedes mi negocio a crecido bastante ya tengo mas mercancía y mas ventas."

Ella esta pidiendo un segundo crédito para poner las paredes para cubrir el negocio del calor y frió y así sus clientes estar mas cómodos al comprar su mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para remodelar el negocio.

Mi familia y yo estamos agradecidos por su gran apoyo que nos han brindado para sacar el negocio adelante.

loans.use: Remodel business space

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Mr. S. is a young married man with two children. He is an upholsterer, and his workshop is located in the Diakhao neighborhood in Thies. He has been in this business for eight years and earns most of his income this way. He is asking for this loan to stock up on supplies in order to complete his orders and satisfy his clientele.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

mr S. est un jeune homme marié et père de deux enfants .il est tapissier de profession et son atelier se trouve au quartier diakhao de thies .il a une expérience de huit dans ce secteur et tire ses principaux revenus.il demande cette somme pour s'approvisionner en fournitures pour finir ses commandes et satisfaire sa clientèle .

loans.use: the purchase of supplies for his upholstery business

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou B. is 55 years old, married with 12 chlildren and her grandchildren in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Peyrissac for 3 years. She would like to buy vegetables and fishing line to pass on to her fisherman husband, who has a pirogue. Her husband is in charge of managing the lines and returning the catch, and will give her the fishing revenues. She will also sell dried fish and vegetables. She wants to strengthen her business to improve her family's living conditions. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Bintou B., 55 ans, mariée avec 12 enfants dont des petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Elle veut acheter des légumes et des filets de pêche pour remettre à son mari pêcheur qui a une pirogue. Son mari est chargé de la gestion des filets et au retour de la pêche, il lui versera les recettes du poisson. Elle fera aussi la vente de poissons secs et des légumes. Elle veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy fishing lines and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Group

texts.en:
Micheline Metellus is a young and highly-motivated female entrepreneur.  Returning to our organization, Esperanza, to receive her second loan, she has proven that she not only has the ability to payback loans on time, but also that she is able to use loans to make significant improvements in her life.  Selling pants, shirts, and blouses from her home, Micheline has been able to acquire inventory to establish this small business.  She has also begun to save for the first time in her life.  She plans to use her second loan to buy clothes in bulk from the nearby city of Santiago.  Micheline said that her business is more important to her than ever now that she has her first child, a three-month-old girl, to care for.

Micheline leads a five-person group, Las Mujeres Fuertes.  Each of these Haitian entrepreneurs lives in the Dominican Republic and supports the others so that each can access funding that they would never be able to receive on their own.  The purpose of their group loan is reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments so that all may receive their next loan together.  These women have found work here in the Dominican  Republic so that they can send money back to their families in Haiti.  One of the women is running a small salon, one makes empenadas on the street, and the two others others sell clothing similar to Micheline.

On behalf of Micheline, Las Mujeres Fuertes, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the issue of global poverty, and for your commitment to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses and shirts in Santiago for resale in Puerto Plata.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Oumar Diakhaté is a member of IMCEC’s Jammy Xaléyi fund in Thies, living in the Aynina Fall neighborhood. He is married and a father of three. He has been doing inner-city transport of goods for a few years and has benefited from two loans, which he successfully repaid. He is asking for this loan to repair his car in order to increase his income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

oumar diakhaté est un sociétaire de la caisse de jammy xaleyi de imcec thies demeurant au quartier aynina fall.il est marié et père de trois enfants .il fait du transport inter urbain depuis quelques années et a bénéficié de deux prets qu'il a remboursé avec succès.c'est dans le but de réparer son véhicule qu'il sollicite cette somme en vue d'améliorer ses revenus .

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama G. is 52 years old, married, has 5 children with her grandsons in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Boucotte Peyrissac for 5 years. She would like to buy dried fish and vegetables (carrots, cabbage, turnips, peppers, and others) to re-sell at the market in Ziguinchor. The income drawn from her business allows her to participate in her family's expenses and medical costs. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariama G., 52 ans, mariée, 05 enfants dont des petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des poissons séchés et des légumes (carottes, choux, navets, piments et autres) et revendre au marché de Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. is 51 years old, married with 7 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac since 2001. She buys loads of firewood and re-sells them at retail. Fatou would like to strengthen her business to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou S.,51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 2001. Elle achète des chargements de bois de chauffe et revend au détail. Fatou veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To trade in firewood

loans.name: Koffi Mensah

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Mensah D. was born on August 24, 1979 in Agou gadzépé, which is situated 100 km from Lomé. He is married and the father of two children. He is a gardener by trade but he has opened a telephone booth in the Adidogomé neighborhood. At his booth, he also sells rechargeable phone cards. This first credit that he is requesting will allow him to buy a little box of rechargeable phone cards and to get a second telephone for the booth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Koffi Mensah est né le 24 août 1979 à Agou gadzépé, localité située à 100Km de Lomé. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est jardinier de profession mais a ouvert une cabine téléphonique dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Dans sa cabine, il vend aussi des cartes de recharge. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un petit carton de cartes de recharge et d’acquérir un second combiné téléphonique.

loans.use:
Purchase of rechargeable cards

Achat de carte de recharges

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a collection of chic jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Kayi Suzanne

texts.fr:
Born October 4, 1975 in Lomé, Mrs. Kayi Suzanne F. is married and the mother of three children. She is a dynamic woman who has opened up a store selling sewing notions in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. She buys her inventory at the big open-air market in Lomé so that she can satisfy the needs of seamstresses and tailors in her neighborhood which is 10 kilometers from the big Lomé market.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to stock up by buying a carton of buttons, a carton of zippers, and some poplins.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 04 octobre 1975 à Lomé, Madame F. Kayi Suzanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est une femme dynamique qui a crée un magasin de vente des articles de mercerie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle achète ses articles au grand marché de Lomé afin de pouvoir satisfaire les couturières et tailleurs de son quartier distant de 10 Km du grand marché de Lomé.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire le stock par l’achat d’un carton de bouton, d’un carton de fermeture et des popelines.

loans.use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat d'articles de mercerie

loans.name: Amavi Délali

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi Délali B. who is divorced is responsible for raising two children. She was born December 31, 1954 in Kotokpa and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. She has been selling charcoal and cereals since last year. She buys corn and charcoal in the village where she was born for re-sale in Lomé. She has customers who are retailers and who sell in the Adidogomé open-air market. Her clientele has grown and she is not able to satisfy their needs alone.

Thus she is requesting this loan, her first, which will allow her to buy 60 sacks of charcoal so that she will be able to serve all her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Avec deux enfants à charge, madame B. Amavi Délali est une femme divorcée née le 31 décembre 1954 à Kotokpa et qui vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois et de céréales depuis l’année passée. Elle achète le maïs et le charbon de bois dans son village natal pour venir vendre à Lomé. Elle a des clients qui sont des détaillants et qui vendent dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Sa clientèle connaît un accroissement et seule elle n’arrive pas à leur donner satisfaction.

Alors ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 60 sacs de charbons de bois afin de pouvoir servir tous ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 60 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 60 sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.fr:
Sylvestre S. is 32 years old, married, and the father of five children, who are all in school. He has been a tailor for over five years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. In the photo, Mr. S. is the person in the middle dressed in a white shirt. He wishes to use this loan to acquire a sewing machine and some fabrics for resale to customers. This will enable him to satisfy customer demands better. The gains from his business will allow Mr. S. to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Sylvestre S. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants tous à l’école. Il est tailleur depuis plus de 5 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Dans la photo, monsieur S. est la personne se trouvant au milieu et vêtu en chemise blanche. Il souhaite par ce crédit acquérir une machine à coudre et des tissus pour la revente aux clients. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Les gains issus de son activité permettront à monsieur S. de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire a sewing machine and some fabrics for resale to customers

loans.name: Melanie Epiphanie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mélanie Epiphanie A. is married to Mr. Honoré Koffi Blam, a photographer, and was born on January 7, 1971 in Lomé. She is raising four children. She has been selling cosmetics and staples since 1996. With a lot of experience in this business, she earns a daily profit that allows her to help her husband cater for family expenses.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase a case of perfume.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée à monsieur BLAM Honoré Koffi qui est un photographe, Madame A. Mélanie Epiphanie est née le 07 janvier 1971 à Lomé. Elle a quatre enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse de produits de beauté et des produits de premières nécessités depuis 1996. Très expérimenté dans cette activité, elle tire son revenu journalier ce qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un carton de parfum.

loans.use:
Purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

Achat de produits de beauté

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr:
Victorine A. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has maintained a shop of general food items for three years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan, Ms. Victorine wishes to buy canned food, medical ointments, and cartons of milk to increase the capacity of her business and thus to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Victorine A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 3 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce second crédit, madame Victorine désire acheter des boîtes de conserves, des pomades et des cartons de laits pour augmenter la capacité de son activité et par là subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy canned foods, ointments, and cartons of milk

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi S. is 32 years old, married, and the father of four. He has been working as a cabinet maker for five years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Komi is regarded among cabinet makers as the most reputable in his area, and he earns the trust of his customers because of the quality of his work. Thanks to this loan, he wishes to buy planks to fill orders he has received. He intends to improve his family's living conditions using the profits he will make from his work. Komi is the person appearing on the right in the photo.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Komi S. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de menuiserie, depuis 5 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Komi est compté parmi les menuisiers les plus réputés de sa localité et il gagne la confiance de ses clients à cause de la qualité de ses œuvres. Grâce à ce crédit, il désire acheter des planches pour la réalisation des commandes reçues. Il compte améliore les conditions de sa famille par les profits qu’il tirera de son travail. Komi est la personne située du côté droit dans la photo.

loans.use: To buy planks to produce the items on order

loans.name: Wolali

texts.fr:
Wolali A. is 34 years old, married, and the father of two. He is an automobile electrician in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Wolali wishes to use this loan to fix up his shop and to acquire tools of the trade to better meet customer needs and to earn more to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Wolali A. est âgé de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est électricien auto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Wolali désire avec ce crédit aménager son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et de gagner plus pour subvenir les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To fix up his shop and to acquire tools of the trade to meet customer needs better

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rebecca D., widowed mother of three children, was born in Lomé and presently lives in the heart of Lomé, although her business is situated on the outskirts of Lomé. In 1980 she opened a store selling hardware in an area being developed where there are sites under construction. She earns her living and supports her children correctly. She has already received one loan that she reimbursed very well.

Now she would like to expand her stock and is requesting a second loan to purchase 2 cases of locks and 10 cases of inner tubes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Veuve et mère de 03 enfants, madame D. Rebecca est née à Lomé et vit au cœur de la ville de Lomé. Elle a pourtant son activité à la périphérie de la ville de Lomé. Elle a ouvert depuis 1980 une boutique d’articles de quincaillerie dans une zone en développement où les chantiers sont en construction. Elle gagne ainsi sa vie et supporte valablement ses enfants. Elle a déjà pris un crédit qu’elle a très bien remboursé.

Maintenant elle voudrait augmenter son stock et sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de serrures et 10 cartons de chambre à air.

loans.use:
Purchase of locks and inner tubes

Achat de serrures et de chambre à air

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Célestine D. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has been in retail sales for over three years selling plastic packaging and wrapping material in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to buy some bags and five bales of plastics and to lease a store in order to increase the capacity of her commerce. The profits derived from her business will enable her to take on some of the responsibilities of her household.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Célestine D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, depuis plus de 3 ans, de emballages en plastiques à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter des sacs 5 balles de plastiques et louer un magasin afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les profits bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: To buy some bags, 5 bales of plastic, and to lease a store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Married with no children, Kayi L. B. A. was born on February 10, 1985 in Lomé. She left school at a young age to apprentice as a hairdresser because the work suited her. In fact, she became a gifted hairdresser and in 2005 she opened her own salon that she calls FLORE COIFFURE. She then added the sale of cosmetics and items used in her work. This additional business made her clientele grow.

She is requesting this loan, her first, to add to her stock of cosmetics by buying 102 boxes of Gel UB, 24 hair extensions, and 10 wigs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée sans enfant, madame L. B. A. Kayi est née le 10 février 1985 à Lomé. Elle a quitté très tôt les bancs pour se lancer dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure à cause de son goût pour ce domaine. En effet elle devint une coiffeuse très talentueuse et a ouvert en 2005 son atelier de coiffure qu’elle nomma FLORE COIFFURE. Elle associa alors la vente de produits cosmétiques et des articles utilisés pour son travail. Cette association a fait gonfler sa clientèle.

Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock en produits cosmétiques par l’achat de 102 boites de Gel UB, 24 tissages et 10 perruques.

loans.use:
Purchase of cosmetics

Achat des produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es:
Maestra de educacion primaria con 8 años de servicio, de 34 años de edad, con 3 hijos, 2 mujeres, 1 varon; una niña estudia el 5to año de secundaria, el varon trabaja para ayudar a su mamá y la otra niña tiene 2 años. Está solicitando su crédito para utilizarlo en la reparación de su vivienda como es las paredes y porche, adems pintar la parte externa. És una persona responsable y honrada ya que los éitos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC han sido pagados en tiempo y forma. En el sector magisterial es muy reconocida y querida por sus compañeras, su centro de trabajo "Centro Integral Fuente de Vida" está ubicado en la periferia de la ciudad de Juigalpa Chontales, sin embargo no es obstaculo para cumplir con su responsabilidad como docente, pues tiene que caminar para llegar a su lugar de trabajo que está muy lejos de su casa de habitación

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

She is a 34 year old elementary school teacher with 8 years of experience and three children, 2 girls and 1 boy; her youngest daughter is 2 and her oldest daughter is in high school and her son is working to help support his mother. The loan she is asking for is to repair the walls and porch in her home and paint the outside. She is a responsible and honorable person whose loans from AFODENIC in the past were paid on time. She is also well known loved by her colleagues at her work place, “Centro Integral Fuente de Vida” which is located on the periphery of Juigalpa Chontales. Although her home is very far from her work this is not an obstacle for her responsibility as a teacher.

loans.use: Repair porch and walls of her home

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A. is 42 years old, married, and the father of five children; three are in apprenticeships and two are in school. He has been selling tires for three years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Komi is a loyal customer of FECECAV because he is on his third loan. He wishes to use this loan to buy more tires for resale in order to earn more funds to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Komi A. est âgé de 42 ans marié et père de 5 enfants dont 3 sont en apprentissage et 2 à l’école. Il vend des pneus depuis plus de 3 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komi est un fidèle client de FECECAV car il est à son troisième crédit et souhaite par ce dernier acheter plus de pneus pour la revente afin de gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy tires for resale

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao A. is 29 years old, married, with two children. He has a café in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan from FECECAV (Kiva Field Partner), he wants to fix up his café to attract a much larger clientele and also open a new café for his younger brother. By doing this he is contributing to the improvement in living standards of his family and also his community.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Yao A. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une cafétéria à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce second crédit de FECECAV aménager sa cafétéria pour attirer beaucoup plus de clientèle et aussi ouvrir une nouvelle cafétéria pour son petit frère. Ce faisant il contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de a famille et aussi de sa communauté.

loans.use: To fix up his café to attract a much larger clientele and also open a new café for his younger brother

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko A. was born in Lomé on April 22, 1976. She is married and presently has two children. Since she lacked support, she did not continue her studies. She began selling generic products, and since 1998 groceries. Her business is now doing wonderfully well. She received a first loan which allowed her to diversify the range of products she offers.

This made her clientele grow, and she is requesting this second loan to bolster her inventory by the purchase of 6 sacks of rice, 4 tins of oil, and 6 cases of generic products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akoko est née à Lomé le 22 avril 1976. Elle s’est mariée et a actuellement deux enfants. Par manque de support elle n’a pas pu faire de grandes études. Elle s’est alors lancée dans le commerce de produits génériques, et d’alimentation générale depuis 1998. Son commerce aujourd’hui marche a merveille. Elle avait eu un premier prêt qui lui a permis de varier la gamme de ses produits.

Cette variation a fait accroître sa clientèle et elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour gonfler son stock par l’achat de 6 sacs de riz, 4 bidons d’huile et 6 cartons de produits génériques.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and other staples

Achat de riz et d'autres produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Elaysa Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. G. de 35 años de edad, casada con una hija estudiando el 4to grado de primaria, trabaja en el Liceo Agricola desde hace 8 años, ocupando el cargo de secretaria-cajera. AFODENIC le ha otorgado 7 creditos, los que ha pagado con responsabilidad en y le han servido para mejorar su vivienda. Este crédito lo utilizará para embaldozar el piso de la casa de su mamá, pues es de tierra y con el invierno se hace mucho lodo y quiere darle mejor comodidad, evitando riesgos de salud para su familia. Plantea que los créditos le han servido de mucho apoyo para mejorar su vivienda y ahora quiere apoyar a su familia. Sus créditos han sido de mayor monto, pero este lo desea de menor cantidad para no quedar mal, ya que la situacion economica esta un poco dificil.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. G. is 35 years old and married with a daughter who is in 4th grade. She has been working in the Liceo Agricola for 8 years as the secretary – cashier. AFODENIC has given her 7 previous loans which she has paid with responsibility and she has used to improve her home. She will use this credit to tile the floor of her mother’s home since it is currently a dirt floor. In the winter this is very problematic as it often turns to mud which causes health problems in the family. She states that the previous loans have enabled her to improve her home and now she would like to help her family. Additionally, the other loans have been for larger amounts but this time she would like a smaller amount due to her current economic situation to avoid problems with the repayment.

loans.use: Lay tile on the floor of her mother’s home

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es Lic. En Matematicas, trabaja en la UNAN-CUR Chontales en el area de Fisica-Matematicas, tiene 35 años de edad, soltera, no tiene hijos, con 10 años de laborar para el sector educativo. Los créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para ayudar a su mamá y hermanas, este crédito lo solicita para poner el techo a la cocina de la casa de su mamá, ya que cuando no se encuentra el gas tienen que cocinar con leña y el espacio que están utilizando no tiene techo y con las lluvias se le hace dificil cocinar. La profesora durante sus 7 creditos anteriores ha tenido un excelente comportamiento crediticio y mucha responsabilidad con los compromisos adquiridos. Es una joven muy querida por sus alumnos y compañeros de trabajo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Marlene studied Math in College and works at the University located in Chontales in the Physics and Math department; she is 35 years old, single without children and has 10 years of experience in the education sector. Her previous loans have been used to help her mother and sisters; with this particular loan she is planning to use it to pay for putting a roof on her mother’s kitchen. The current kitchen has no roof and she often cooks there when she is using firewood; however, this is often very difficult since it is open to the air and subject to rains. Marlene has had 7 previous loans and has had extremely good credit in the past showing responsibility and dedication to repayment. She is a young woman who is loved by her students and colleagues.

loans.use: Put a roof on the kitchen

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo K. is 40 years old, married, with three children. He lives in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been selling frozen foods for more than five years. With this new loan, he wants increase the capacity of his business by purchasing fish, rump steak, chicken and sausages to sell. The profit from his business will allow him to better provide for his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Kodjo K. est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Kodjo réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est revendeur de produits congelés depuis plus de 5 ans. Avec ce nouveau crédit, il souhaite acheter des poissons, des croupions, des poulets et des saucisses pour la revente en vue d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase fish, rump steak, chicken and sausages to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La Sra. V. tiene la edad de 39 años, casada, con un bebé de 40 dias, con 18 años de servicio en educacion. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en la docencia, ya que su mayor ilusión ha sido dar el pan de la enseñanza a la niñez de su comunidad, siempre ha trabajado en la modalidad de primaria. La profesora V. esta solicitando un credito, el que utilizara para continuar mejorando su vivienda, ya que hoy mas que antes necesita tener una vivienda digna para poder dar mejores condiciones y mayor comodidad a su primera hija que tanto habia esperado. La profesora aseguró que los creditos le han servido mucho, y es de la unica forma que ha podido realizar el sueño de su vida, ya que con su salaria no podria tener su vivienda en optimas condiciones.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. V. is 39 years old and married with a baby who is 40 days old; she has worked for 18 years in education. From a very early age she began working in teaching, always at the grade school level, and her greatest illusion was to give children in her community the gift of learning. Professor V. is asking for a loan that she will use to continue improving her home; now more than ever she needs to have a dignified home for her first child that she waited so long to have. The professor assures us that the loans have helped her enormously saying that it is the only way she has been able to fulfill her lifelong dream since with only her salary she could not have had her house in optimal condition.

loans.use: Purchase of bathroom tile for the walls and paint

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ruth Dávila

texts.es:
Ruth is a young woman, 23 years of age. She is married and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, which belongs to the city of Managua. Ruth has known since she was very young what it is to work in order to earn a living; her parents do not have much money and she has had to help support them. However, now that she is married, she must work for the survival of her own family.

She and her husband have not yet had any children. They work very hard so that when the day comes that they do have children, they will be able to give them a dignified life. Ruth’s husband works as a driver and, like her, contributes to the household expenses. Ruth has been selling clothing for the past nine years. She began the business with her own savings and it has grown little by little in the amount and variety of clothing that she has for sale.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in buying more clothing because she currently does not have much inventory. She hopes to buy more so that she can have better sales and thereby hold on to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruth es una joven de 23 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua. Ruth desde muy joven sabe lo que es trabajar para ganarse la vida, ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y los ha tenido que apoyar. Pero ahora que ya está casada debe velar por la superviviencia de su familia. Hasta elmomento no han procreado hijos, es por eso que trabajan muy duro para que el día que vengan los hijos puedan darles una vida digan. El esposo de Ruth trabaja como conductor y al igual que ella aporta para los gastos de su hogar. Ruth se dedica a la venta de ropa y desde hace nueve años está en este negocio.Empezó la venta con ahorros propios y ha ido creciendo poco a poco en la cantidad y variedad de ropa que ofrece. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en compra de productos ya que actualmente no cuenta con mucha inventario y desea reforzarlo para así poder obetener más ventas y tambíen retener a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy clothing with which to stock her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alassivi Afiavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Alassivi Afiavi M., 28 and the mother of two children, was born in Lomé and lives in a neighborhood quite removed from the city center of Lomé. At a young age, she learned how to run a business from her mother. At 17, she opened her own business. It consists in buying various grocery products wholesale in the big open-air market of Lomé. She then retails them in her neighborhood, where she has a monopoly. She took out a first loan and repaid it correctly. She is now requesting a second loan to expand her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 28 ans, mère de deux enfants, madame M. Alassivi Afiavi née à Lomé vit dans un quartier assez reculé de la ville de Lomé. Initiée depuis son jeune âge aux activités commerciales par sa maman. A l’âge de 17 ans, elle a monté son propre commerce. Cela consiste en l’achat en gros des divers produits d’alimentation générale dans le grand marché de Lomé. Elle les revend ensuite en détail dans son quartier où elle détient le monopole. Elle a pris un premier crédit qu’elle a bien payé. Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of staples for re-sale

Achat des produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge is a young man, 30 years old, who has been fascinated with the restaurant business since he was young. To meet his family's economic needs he began working at a ceviche restaurant when he was 17. There he met his business partner, and together they started their own business, earning such recognition that they opened branches in other cities. But Jorge became sick, and had to undergo urgent surgery, forcing him to leave work. After two years the business went under. Regardless, Jorge is recuperating and he started a new business independently. Now he has a ceviche restaurant in the local market where he's settled, and he hopes to expand the business like he did years ago. In order to realize his dreams he needs your help and is asking for a loan of 1300 soles that will be indispensable to the improvement of his restaurant. Jorge would like to create a more welcoming ambiance for his clients. We hope that you can be the person that helps this young man, who has such a strong desire to overcome the past and to forge a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un joven de 30 años que desde muy temprana edad le fascinó el negocio de la venta de comida y a consecuencia de la necesidad de su familia empezó con esta actividad a los 17 años como ayudante en una cevichería. Fue ahí donde conoció al que sería su socio, juntos establecieron su propio negocio, y así empezaron, llegaron a tener tanta acogida que abrieron sucursales en otras dos ciudades. Pero Jorge enfermó, y tuvo que ser operado con urgencia y dejó de trabajar y en dos años su negocio se vino abajo. Sin embargo, Jorge está recuperado y empezó de manera independiente su propio negocio. Ahora tiene una cevichería en el mercado de la localidad donde radica y tiene el deseo de expandir su negocio como hace unos años atrás. Para la realización de sus deseos requiere de su apoyo y solicita un préstamo de 1300 soles que le son indispensables para la mejora de su restaurante, Jorge quiere un ambiente más acogedor para sus clientes. Esperamos que usted pueda ser la persona que pueda cooperar con este joven que tiene muchos deseos de superar el pasado y forjarse un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of his ceviche restaurant, creating a more welcoming ambiance and keeping his clients satisfied.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is 32 years old, married, with two children. He drives a motorcycle taxi in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan, Komla wants to buy a new motorcycle to improve his business and increase his profit in order to meet the needs of his children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Komla A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komla désire par ce second crédit, acheter une nouvelle moto pour mieux exercer son activité et de gagner plus de profits afin de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr:
Mr. Koku G., 39, was born in Agou Akplolo, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Lomé. He is a professionally trained auto mechanic. Lacking the financial means to have his own garage and at the same time wanting to be his own boss, in 1995, he used the meager means at his disposal to begin selling spare parts for cars and motorcycles. In the meantime, he specializes in selling tires, but has also continued to sell some vital spare parts.

What’s unique about Mr. G.’s business is that he puts his knowledge of auto mechanics to good use in counseling his customers, which makes for a sort of after-sales service. This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy 150 tires to fill an order.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né a Agou Akplolo, Monsieur G. Koku, a 39 ans est marié et père de trois enfants. Il vit à Lomé. Comme formation professionnelle il a fait la mécanique auto. Par faute de fond pour avoir son propre garage, et aussi avec le désir d’être son propre chef, il a commencé avec le peu de moyen qu’il disposait à faire le commerce des diverses pièces détachées pour voiture et moto depuis 1995. Au fil des temps il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de pneus sans toute fois laisser la vente de quelques pièces nécessaires.

La particularité du commerce de monsieur G., c’est qu’il use de ses connaissances en mécanique pour conseiller ses clients, ce qui constitue un service après vente. Ce premier crédit lui permettra de d’acheter 150 pneus pour répondre a une commande.

loans.use:
Purchase of tires

Achat de pneus

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is 32 years old, married, with two children who both attend school. He lives in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been a motor mechanic for more than four years and, with this loan, he wants to fix up his garage and buy the tools needed for his business. This will allow him to gain many more customers and increase his profit, which is essential for the improvement of his family's standard of living. In the photo, Komla A. is the second person from the left.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Komla A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est mécanicien depuis plus de 4 ans et souhaite par ce crédit aménager son garage et acheter des outils de travail nécessaires à son activité. Ce qui lui permettra de conquérir beaucoup plus de clients et de réaliser plus de profits indispensables à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Dans la photo, il est la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche.

loans.use: To fix up his garage and buy tools

loans.name: Claudia Teodora

texts.es:
Claudia is an adoring mother of three, and is separated from her spouse. In spite of this she tries to meet the needs of her children alone, and they value their mother's efforts to give them an education. Because of this, Claudia leaves early in the morning for the hospital, where she has worked as a nutritionist for more than 27 years. Claudia is in charge of the menu for hospital patients. On finishing her shift, she goes to work at the recycling stand in the market, where she spends as much time as possible, especially on weekends and holidays. Claudia also spends her time selling beautify products, which she offers to clients and friends. In spite of these multiple efforts, Claudia isn't able to cover the costs of keeping a home, and above all to cover her children's university tuition. It is for this that Claudia is asking for a loan to invest in her recycling stand in order to satisfy the demand of her clients. We hope that you support this noble mother, who is fighting for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es madre D. 3 jovencitos a quienes adora, a pesar D. estar separada D. su esposo trata D. satisfacer soL., las necesidades D. sus hijos, quienes valoran el esfuerzo D. su madre para darles una educación. Así que Claudia desD. muy temprano sale rumbo al hospital D. L. ciudad donD. trabaja como nutricionista por ya más D. 27 años. ElL. está a cargo D. los alimentos D. las personas internas, al terminar se dirige a su puesto D. plásticos dentro del mercado D. su ciudad, al que se dedica el mayor tiempo posible, sobre todo los fines D. semana y en las ferias. Muy a L. par, también se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, que ofrece a sus clientes y amigos. Sin embargo estas múltiples tareas y actividades no resuelven los diversos gastos en su hogar, sobre todo los requerimientos para los estudios D. sus hijos que ya están en L. universidad. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertir en su plastiquería y satisfacer L. demanda D. sus clientes. Esperamos que apoyen a esta noble madre, que soL., lucha por el bienestar D. su hogar.

loans.use: Revamp her business in order to earn enough to cover the cost of university tuition for her children.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla G. is 30 years old, single, with no children. He drives a motorcycle taxi in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he wants to buy a new motorcycle to improve his business. The profit from his business will allow him to satisfy his own needs as well as those of his younger brothers.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Komla G. est âgé de 30 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto pour mieux exercer son activité. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de satisfaire ses propres besoins et ceux de ses petits frères

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Célestine G. is 42 years old, married, with four children. She is a retailer of dishes and kitchen utensils in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan Madame G. wants to increase the capacity of her business by purchasing more merchandise to sell to customers. The profit from her business will allow her to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Célestine G. est âgée de 42 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de plats et ustensiles de cuisines à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame Célestine souhaite par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant plus de marchandises pour la revente aux clients. Les profits de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To purchase dishes and kitchen utensils to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lebene

texts.fr:
Lebene K. is 33 years old, married, and the father of 2 school-attending children. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to perform repairs on his car and to refurbish his motor, which is worn from use. This will enable to spend less on the repairs and to save more money in order to meet his family's needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Lebene K. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l'école. il réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale toglaise. Il désire par ce crédit procéder au renouvellement du moteur qui est usé et aussi à la révision de sa voiture. Ce qui lui permettra de dépenser moins pour la réparation et de mieux économiser afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aokou

texts.fr:
Aokou A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. He's a furniture maker in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy wood to manufacture and sell furniture. The sale profits will enable him to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aokou A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est menuisier à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit acheter des bois pour la fabrication des meubles. Les bénéfices qu'engendreront ces ventes lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood to manufacture furniture

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. is 39 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He's a motorcycle taxi driver in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Koffi would like to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle since the old one does not work reliably anymore. He's a good client of FECECAV, since he is applying for his second loan. The first one was repaid without problems.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Koffi A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enafnts. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Koffi souhaite par ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que l'ancienne ne fonctionne plus normalement. Il est un bon client de FECECAV puisqu'il est à son deuxième crédit et le premier était bien remboursé.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Claudia Simona

texts.es:
Claudia is a humble mother of seven children, who she worked extremely hard to raise. Now she only supports for the youngest two, one of whom helps her on her farm. The youngest is still in school. Claudia hopes to be able to provide her children with an education, and for this she sacrifices hours and hours working on her land. Claudia grows citrus fruits, plantains, and coffee. These products earn her the income to invest in her children's education. For Claudia this work isn't very tiring, but it is expensive, due to the cost of fertilizer and maintaining the land. More than anything, plants and seeds are expensive, but necessary to increase her production. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy these plants and seeds, in hopes that you can help her and she can ensure that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una humilde madre de 7 hijos a quienes cría con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Ahora sólo está al cuidado de los dos últimos, uno de ellos le ayuda en su trabajo dentro de la chacra y el último es aún escolar. Doña Claudia desea poder darle a sus dos hijos una carrera y por eso se sacrifica horas de horas en su trabajo en sus tierras, produciendo frutas cítricas, plátanos y café. Esto le sirve para obtener ingresos e invertirlos en la educación de sus hijos. Para ella este trabajo no es muy cansado, pero sí, muy costoso, por los abonos y por el mantenimiento que tiene que dar a sus terrenos, sobre todo en la compra de plantas y semillas para aumentar su producción. Para esto que se solicita este préstamo, en espera que usted pueda ayudarla y así conseguir que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and seeds for her crops, in order to earn enough to pay university tuition for her two youngest children.

loans.name: Norma Soledad

texts.es:
Norma is the mother of three children, and she works as hard as she can for them. She sells delicious wines to her neighbors on holidays. First she collects wine requests and then travels to the city of Chicha, in Ica, where she buys gallons of wine wholesale. Thanks to God Norma has a large quantity of orders and she travels constantly in order to fill them. Norma hopes to increase her investment to her family's quality of life, and to do this she would like to invest money to buy greater quantities of wine. That way she'll be able to purchase more than was ordered, to maintain a reserve of wine in her house and later offer these wines in other areas of the city. Norma would also like to buy or rent a small stall in the local market to sell her wines on a more permanent basis. We hope that you can meet Norma's need to grow and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una madre de tres hijos por quienes trabaja y se esfuerza al máximo. Ella vende deliciosos vinos, que ofrece a sus vecinos en días festivos, con los pedidos viaja a la ciudad de Chicha, en Ica, donde compra galones de vino al por mayor, gracias a Dios doña Norma tiene gran cantidad de pedidos y viaja constantemente para comprarlos. Sin embargo, Norma desea incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar la calidad de vida dentro de su hogar, y por ello quiere invertir dinero en la compra de mayor cantidad de vino y no sólo satisfacer sus pedidos, sino también tener una reserva que guardaría en su propia casa, para luego ofrecer estos vinos en otros lugares de su ciudad. También desea poder adquirir o alquilar un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad donde venda sus vinos de manera permanente. Esperamos que usted pueda atender la necesidad de Norma en poder incrementar y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of products in order to expand her client base to have a permanent stall to sell wines in the local market.

loans.name: Karina Paola

texts.es:
Karina is a young mother who had to pull herself together after being abandoned by her partner, and thanks to her relatives she was able to do it. She confronted her situation head on and overcame her depression and made headway along with her three-year-old, who was even more affected by her father leaving. So Karina, with the support of her parents and for the well being of herself and her daughter, installed a small convenience store in her home. There she could tend to customers and not neglect her baby. Karina has been doing this for almost a year now and her shop has become the most-frequented in her area, no doubt due to her charisma and her desire to get ahead. Now her goal is to enlarge her business, increase her stock and supply her store with more products to meet her customers' demands. She does not have the capital to achieve these goals, so she turns to you for support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Karina es una joven madre que tuvo que sobreponerse ante el abandono de su pareja, y gracias a sus familiares pudo hacerlo.
