Enfrentó su situación, sobrellevó su depresión y pudo salir adelante por su pequeña hija de tres años, quien fue la más afectada por el abandono de su padre. Entonces Karina con el apoyo de sus padres, por el bienestar de su hija y por es suyo propio, instaló una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. Ahí atiende a sus clientes sin descuidar a su bebe. Hace ya casi un año que Karina viene trabajando de esta forma, y su tienda se convirtió en la más concurrida de la zona, no cabe duda que el carisma y deseo de salir adelante de Karina, dieron sus frutos. Ahora su deseo es agrandar su negocio, incrementar su mercadería y surtir su bodega con otros productos que solicitan sus clientes. No cuenta con un capital que pueda invertir en ello, y por eso recurre a ustedes.

loans.use: Acquire new products so she can meet her customers demands / Incremento de capital de trabajo, para la adquisición de nuevos productos para su bodega, y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
Agustín is a gentleman who works as a technician at a gasoline station in the town of Ticuantepe, where he is from. Agustín lives with his wife and 4 children for whom he must provide and also educate.

He has two manzanas (a unit of measurement for land equal to 1.68 acres) of land on which he cultivates pineapple. He has been working in agriculture for 8 years. While looking for better opportunities for his family, he decided to look for another job, since pineapples can’t be harvested every month of the year, and he needs to feed his family. For this reason, Agustín gets up very early every morning so that he can dedicate some time to his pineapples.

He needs the loan so that he can buy organic fertilizers to use on his land. That way, the pineapples will show the expected results and be of the best quality, so that he can earn enough to continue getting by, just like he always has.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Agustín es un señor que trabaja como técnico en una bomba de una gasolinera del municipio de Ticuantepe, de donde es originario. Don Agustín vive con su señora y con 4 hijos, a los cuales tiene que darles educación y el sustento diario. Tiene 2 manzanas de tierra, en las cuales cosecha piña, tiene 8 años de experiencia en la agricultura. En busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, decidió buscar un empleo, ya la cosecha de piña no se da todo los meses del año, y necesita alimentar a su familia. Es por eso que donAgustín se levanta muy temprano en las mañanas para poder dedicarle tiempo a sus piñas. El motivo del préstamo es para adquirir abonos orgánicos para regarlos en sus tierras, y así las piñas al momento de la cosecha puedan rendir los resultados esperados y sean de la mejor calidad para poder obtener suficientes ganancias para seguir saliendo adelnate como siempre lo ha hecho.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to use on his pineapples so that he can acheive improved production

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth Julia

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a hard-working mother who helps her husband with farming. They leave very early in the morning to the hill where they have their lands, which they keep clean and in the best condition for good production. Dedicating one's self to farming is nothing easy, much less for a woman who first must tend to her children, cook for her family and only then care for her crops. After the harvest, she takes the products to the nearest cities to sell. This is Elizabeth's work cycle.

What Elizabeth most wants at the moment is to add more land and increase crop production. But to meet this end she needs 500 soles ($175) to purchase banana and coffee and add them to her fields. We hope you can help this humble woman who only wants to improve as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Elizabeth es una trabajadora madre de familia que ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura, debido a ello salen muy de mañana al monte donde tienen sus terrenos de cultivo, los cuales limpia para su libre producción, manteniéndolos en la mejor condición. Dedicarse a la agricultura no es nada fácil y mucho más, para una mujer que primero tiene que atender las necesidades de sus hijos, cocinar para su familia y luego internarse en sus terrenos cuidando la producción, para después cosechar y llevar los productos para la venta a las ciudades más cercanas. Ese es el ciclo de trabajo de Elizabeth. Lo que desea en estos momentos es ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo e incrementar su producción. Pero para este fin requiere de 500 soles para comprar plátano y café e incorporarlos a sus terrenos. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudar a esta humilde señora que sólo desea progresar como agricultora.

loans.use: Purchase new products (banana and coffee) to increase the crop prodcuction of her lands / Comprar nuevos productos (plátano y café) para ampliar la producción de sus terrenos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther is married and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood of the town of Concha. She is 35 years old and has two children, who are 3 and 7 years old. Her husband works as a driver and they both work hard to help their family get by. Maria Esther has a small business selling ornamental plants.

She has been in this business for 20 years. She grows the plants herself and then sells them to her customers. She sells flowers and green plants. She will use the loan to buy new species of plants and good soil so that she can offer new products and also increase her inventory.

Her immediate plans are to help her family get ahead and improve their living conditions. She hopes to do this by increasing her sales, which would be accomplished by offering new plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esther es casada, habita en el barrio San Caralampio del municipio de la Concha, tiene 35 años de edad y dos niños de 3 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo desempeña como conductor y ambos llevan a cuestas la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus familia. Maria esther es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la plantación y ventas de productos ornamentales. Desde hace veinte años está en el negocio de comercio de plantas, ella misma cultiva sus plantas y después las vende a sus clientes. Vende Flores y Plantas Verdes. El dinero lo utilizará en la adquisisción de nuevas especies de plantas y tierra abonada para poder ofrecer nuevos productos y así mismo incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Sus planes inmediatos son poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida y espera poder hacerlo através del incremento de sus ventas, y que será debido a la oferta de nuevos productos de plantas.

loans.use: To buy plants and soil so she can create new products for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Oscar obtained a few manzanas (a unit of measurement for land equal to 1.68 acres) of land on which he decided to plant products such as pineapples, chayote squash, and beans. Since that time he has worked in agriculture, into which he has put his best efforts so that he can produce quality products. Continuing with this activity has cost him a lot, given that the problems that present themselves—both the land and climate—are innumerable and he must always be attentive to his crops.

Now is the time of year when his crops need fertilizer to continue their growth. The purpose of this loan is to buy fertilizers to use on his products. Oscar is married, and he and his wife have 2 small children, to whom they would give all that they have.

Oscar’s wife has a small grocery store in their house. Oscar helps her in the store when he is not in the fields. They both hope to always have work so that they can educate their children and give them a dignified roof under which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años Oscar obtuvo algunas manzanas de tierra en las que decicidió sembrar algunos productos como piñas, chayotes y frijoles, y desde ese entonces se ha dedicado a la agricultura a la cual le ha puesto su mejor esfuerzos para producir productos de calidad. Mantener esta actividad le ha costado mucho ya que los problemas que presentan tanto la tierra como el clima son inumerables y siempre tiene que estar atento al cuido de la misma. Este es el tiempo en que sus planatciones necesitan de abono para constinuar su crecimiento, y el fin del préstamo es ese mismo,adquirir abonos agrícolas para rociarlos a sus prosuctos. Oscar es casado y junto a su esposa tiene 2 pequeños hijos por los caules ellos darían todo lo que tiene. La esposa de Oscar es comerciante y posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, Oscar también la apoya en la atención del negocio cuando éste no está en el campo. Desean ambos poder tener siempe trabajo para así poder darles educación a sus hijos y un techo digno donde vivir.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use on his crops

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba has gradually been investing in the construction and improvement of her house. Through the efforts that she and her family members have made, they have been able to improve their living conditions. They now wish to change the floor of the house because it is currently made of cement and they want to put in ceramic tile.

Doña Alba sells food from the house and hopes to be able to increase her business and offer the best quality of services to customers by building a small restaurant. Doña Alba is 37 years old, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, is married, and has three children. One of them is financially independent and the other two are studying. Her husband is an auto mechanic and contributes to the household expenses.

She also hopes to help her children get ahead; she hopes that, like her oldest, she will be able to teach them the worth of work so that one day they will be able to make a living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alba poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en la construcción y mejoras de su casa de habitación. Gracias al esfuerzo que ella y su familia realizan es como han podido ir mejorando las condiciones de vida. Ahora desean cambiarle el piso a su casa de habitación ya que actuelmente es embaldosado y quieren ponerle cerámica. Doña Alba se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación y espera en un futuro poder incrementar su negocio y llegar a ofrecer mejora calidad de servicios a sus clientes al llegar a poner un comedor. Doña Alba tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casada y tiene tres hijos uno de ellos ya es independiente y los otros dos están estudiando, su esposo es mecánico automotriz y aporta a los gastos del hogar. También espera poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y así como al mayor de ellos poder enseñarle el valor del trabajo para que un día puedan valerse por si mismos.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tile for the floor of her house.

loans.name: Víctor Andrés

texts.es:
Victor is a young man who eagerly works as a motorcycle driver. He leaves very early in the morning to take students to their schools and all kinds of other people to their places of business. With this job he can help his relatives with family expenses. At the moment he has no desire to get married, so he wants to have some stability for his parents and then later start building his own home.

Victor wishes to acquire a new motorcycle, which will allow his parents to work with him and help satisfy the household's necessities, namely those of his little brothers. To achieve this end he is requesting a loan that he will use as a down payment for a new motorcycle. He hopes that you will lend a helping hand so he can realize his dreams and bring some economic stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Víctor es un joven que trabaja con mucho ahínco con su motocarro, sale muy de mañana para trasladar a los escolares a sus respectivos centros educativos y a las diversas personas a sus respectivos lugares de trabajo. Con esta actividad Víctor puede ayudar a sus familiares en los gastos de su hogar, por ello, que por el momento no desea casarse, hasta ver a sus padres estables, luego de eso, con tranquilidad podrá iniciar la construcción de su propio hogar. Víctor desea adquirir un nuevo motocarro, el cual puedan sus padres ayudarle a cuidar y trabajar, para así, satisfacer las necesidades dentro de su hogar, sobre todo con sus hermanos pequeños. Para este fin requiere de un préstamo para poder dar como inicial de un nuevo motocarro. Espera que usted le pueda tender una mano amiga para realizar su deseo de brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus padres.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle so his parents can work with him and improve the quality of life for his younger brothers / Comprar un nuevo motocarro para que sus padres puedan trabajar junto a él y lograr una mejor calidad de vida para sus hermanos menores.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Félix Alejandro

texts.es:
Félix is 26 years old, is married, and lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood. He and his wife have 2 children, one girl and one boy. His wife works as a machine operator in a free trade zone of Managua and helps her husband so that they and their family can get ahead. While looking for opportunities that could generate a better income, Félix is working as a taxi driver and also buys and sells scrap metal.

Félix has been working in scrap metal for the past three years. It was difficult for him to get started in the business because he didn’t have enough capital to buy the scrap metal. So, he started out with a small quantity and through the years he has been able to increase the amount.

He needs the loan to invest in the construction of a store where he could carry out the buying and selling of scrap metal; he doesn’t currently have enough space to do this. He hopes that in the near future he will be able to finish building the store so that he can establish himself and grow in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix tiene 26 años de edad, es casado, y habita en el bario Camilo Ortega, junto a su esposa ha procreado 2 niños,una mujer y un varón. Su esposa trabaja desempeñándose como operaria en una zona franca de Managua y apoya a su esposo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.En busca de mayores oportunidades que puedan generarle mayores ingresos Félix se dedica al servicio de Taxi y a la compra y venta dechatarra. Desde hace tres años Felix se dedica al negocio de la chatarra, el comienzo de este negocio fue muy difícil para él por que no disponía de suficiente capital para poder comprar la chatarra, así que empezó con pocas cantidades y através de los años las ha podido aumentar. Requiere del préstamo para invertir en laconstrucción de un local donde pueda desarrollar la compra y venta de la chatarra ya que actuelmente no cuenta con el espacio suficiente para poder hacerlo. Desea en un futuro poder terminar la instalación de este puesto de comprar para así poder establecerse y desarrollarse en este negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the construction of a store where he can buy and sell scrap metal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida and her husband dedicate themselves to renting motorcycles. She administers the renting, while her husband uses one as a hired driver. This how the family pays household expenses. Sadly in the past months, a number of their motorcycles have had different mechanical problems and they don't have the money to pay for the repairs. The couple is requesting a loan to fix and maintain their stable of cycles, which are their only means of labor. They predict these costs will be around 300 soles ($125), which they earnestly hope you can help them with.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Nelida trabaja junto a su esposo, ellos se dedican al alquiler de motocarros. Nelida administra el alquiler, mientras su esposo trabaja con uno de ellos en transporte público. Es la manera en que esta familia sostiene los gastos diarios del hogar. Lamentablemente en estos últimos meses, varios de sus motocarros se encuentran con diversas fallas mecánicas y no cuentan con el dinero para su reparación. Ellos solicitan un préstamo para el arreglo y mantenimiento de sus motos que son sus únicas herramientas de trabajo. Frente a ello han previsto que los gastos de mantenimiento suman 300 soles, monto con el que no cuentan por el momento y desean encarecidamente que los puedan ayudar.

loans.use: Repair and maintain their motorcycles, her only means of income / Reparación y mantenimiento de sus motocarros, que son sus únicas herramientas de trabajo.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
For three years Carlos S. has worked hard building his own business selling construction materials in the municipality of El Viejo in Chinandega, Nicaragua. His business has been growing steadily and the income allows Carlos to take care of his wife and three children.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more construction materials. The loan will help him continue to grow his business and improve the quality of life for his family.

Desde hace tres años el señor Carlos S. se ha dedicado a laborar en su propio negocio de Venta de materiales de construcción en el municipio de El Viejo en Chinandega. El negocio lo ha venido desarrollando muy notablemente y por medio de sus ingresos percibidos, mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS FOR HIS CONSTRUCTION BUSINESS,  INCREASE HIS INCOME, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR HIS WIFE AND CHILDREN.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía is a mother of two small children, who are her motivation to work hard and make headway with her and her husband's motorcycle transportation business. She handles the vehicle with a lot of care and detail so she can have better earnings, and above all makes sure that it's always well maintained to prevent future problems.

Lucía has saved some money to acquire a new motorcycle and thus increase the daily income for her family. But what she has saved so far is not enough to buy one, and she and her husband are hoping you will help them with this purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Lucía es una madre de familia de dos pequeños hijos quienes son su motor de trabajo y por quienes trata de salir adelante junto a su esposo con quien trabaja en su motocarro. Ella administra el vehículo con mucho cuidado y detalle para que pueda tener mayores ingresos, y vela que su movilidad y herramienta de trabajo sea bien cuidada, sobre todo tenga los respectivos mantenimientos para prevenir problemas futuros. Lucía tiene ahorrado algo de dinero para poder adquirir un nuevo motocarro, y así ampliar los ingresos diarios de su familia. Pero lo que hasta ahora tiene, no alcanza para la compra de su nuevo motocarro, esta pareja de esposos recurre a ustedes esperanzados en que puedan ayudarlos a comprar su nuevo motocarro.

loans.use: Enlarge her transportation reach with the purchase of a new motorcycle / Ampliar su campo de trasporte con la compra de un nuevo motocarro.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria H. works selling household cleaning products. Since she began her business, she has continued to increase her income and has been able to take care of her young daughter. As a single mother, Maria has sole responsiblity for her child's welfare. Her business has enabled her to maintain her small home, and she's made good use of the loans she's received from Ceprodel, using the money to purchase more products to sell. She is requesting a new loan to grow her business, increase her income, and continue to care for her young daughter.

La señora Maria H. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos químicos de limpieza para el hogar. Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido a su familia el cual consta de su pequeña hija a la que tiene que mantener por ser madre soltera.

Desde que inició con su negocio ha logrado mantener su humilde hogar y ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de los productos químicos de limpieza del hogar. Hoy en día una vez mas solicita un crédito para la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER BUSINESS SELLING HOUSEHOLD CLEANING PRODUCTS.  THE INCOME FROM HER BUSINESS ENABLES THIS HARDWORKING SINGLE MOTHER TO CARE FOR HER YOUNG DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
Mrs. Meris C., with much effort, works in the town of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, in her convenience store, which she has set up in a room of her home where she offers different types of food and personal use products.

She has currently been able to stock her business and has done so with the help of Ceprodel credits, which she has invested in the purchase of merchandise for their sale. Today, she is applying once more for credit to buy supplies to for their sale and to continue maintaining her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Meris C. se dedica muy esforzadamente a laborar en su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación donde ofrece diferentes tipos de productos como comestibles y personales.

Hoy en día ha logrado surtir el negocio y lo ha realizado apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido para la compra de su mercadería para ofrecerla. Hoy solicita una vez mas el crédito para la compra de los materiales y así ofrecerlos y continuar manteniendo su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
The business of preparing and selling food requires a lot of hard work since one must work in high temperature conditions in the kitchen and also be aware of food preparation at all times so that they are made in the highest quality.

Aware of this fact, Mrs. Gertrudis J. puts a lot of effort into her prepared food business in her hometown of El Viejo. She has come to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a credit loan that will allow her to buy supplies to be used in food making.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos requiere de mucho sacrificio por la razón de que se debe trabajar a altas temperaturas en la cocina y además se debe de estar pendiente de la preparación de los alimentos en todo momento para que sena elaborados con una alta calidad.

Consciente de esto, la señora Gertrudis Juárez se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida en el municipio de El Viejo de donde es originaria. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a woman who is, without a doubt, an excellent farmer and mother. She works arduously day after day so her products are the best at the market where she sells them. For this, she makes sacrifices to adequately care for and fertilize her lands. Above all, she pays the highest respect for keeping them clean so that her fields can bear high-quality products.

One of Florencia's dreams is to increase the size of her fields, but that is, doubtlessly, an investment she cannot make solely on her own. For this, she is requesting economic support, money that will help in the purchase of lands and crops. She hopes that you will heed her call and will be forever grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Florencia es una mujer que sin duda es buena madre y excelente agricultora, ella se esfuerza día a día para que sus productos sean los mejores del mercado donde los vende. Por ello, se sacrifica cuidando y abonando adecuadamente sus tierras, y sobre todo dándole los respectivos mantenimientos de limpieza para que sus plantaciones puedan dar productos de buena calidad. Uno de sus deseos es poder aumentar la proporción de sus cultivos, sin duda esto es una gran inversión que sola no puede afrontar. Por ello pide su apoyo económicoa, dinero que le ayudaría en la compra de plantaciones y de su vivero . Florencia espera que usted pueda atender a su solicitud. Se mantendrá agradecida toda su vida por su apoyo.

loans.use: Increase crop production and purchase new fields / Ampliar la producción de sus cultivos y compra de nuevas plantaciones.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Eduardo J. is a hardworking man who owns his own tire shop and car wash that opens everyday in the El Viejo municipality of the city of Chinandega.

He now needs to invest money in the purchase of tires and motor oil to sell to his customers. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel in order to obtain the loan needed for this purchase, thus continuing to work on his business that really needs an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eduardo J. es un caballero muy esforzado el cual posee su propio negocio de venta de llantas, servicio de lavado de vehículos y vulcanización atendiendo todos los días en su municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa su taller es que necesita invertir en la compra de llantas y lubricantes para ofrecerlos a los clientes. Es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para su respectiva compra y de esta manera continuar laborando en su negocio que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: Purchase tires

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marcos José

texts.es:
Mr. Marcos C. has been in the food sales business for the past 10 years on the outskirts of the El Viejo Town Market in the city of Chinandega. He prepares the food himself and sells them once they are ready.

What Mr. C. currently needs as soon as possible is the purchase of supplies to prepare food in order to offer them to his clients. That is reason why he is looking for Ceprodel’s help in obtaining the credit for the purchase of these supplies and in that way to be able to continue with his high quality food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marcos C. se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de alimentos en las afueras del mercado del municipio de El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Los alimentos los prepara el mismo y una vez que están elaborados los comercializa en su sector.

Actualmente, la necesidad atravesada por el señor C. es que necesita lo más pronto posible la adquisición de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de estos productos y así continuar con su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos de alta calidad.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
Jose Fracisco C. is a young father of a small son, who is the reason why he makes great efforts to provide the necessary conditions so that he can develop and become a professional.

He is in the bike repairs and spare parts sales business which is located in the El Viejo Town Market in the city of Chinandega.

Like any developing business, his business currently needs to invest in the purchase of spare parts to sell them in his business. With this credit he, along with his small child and spouse, will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

José Francisco C. es un joven padre de un pequeño hijo motivo por el cual se esfuerza grandemente para brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que este se desarrolle y logre llegar a ser una persona profesional en la vida.

Su negocio es la reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicletas ubicándose su tramo en el Mercado del municipio de El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Como cualquier negocio en desarrollo, hoy en día su negocio requiere de inversión en la compra de los repuestos para venderlos en el negocio. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su pequeño hijo y su cónyuge.

loans.use: To purchase work supplies

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel Sanchez is a lady from the town of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega that runs her own convenience store. She started her business 10 years ago, offering a limited amount of merchandise since her initial capital was that of fifty dollars. Slowly, as time went by, she has been able to improve her business by offering a larger variety of products for sale.

She has looked to Ceprodel for help with the goal of obtaining a credit for the purchase of supplies for her business. That is why she wait confidently, knowing that her application will be accepted and besides this way, she be able to improve conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

María Isabel S. es una dama que se dedica a atender su propia pulpería en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Inició el negocio desde hace 10 años ofreciendo pocos productos ya que su capital inicial fueron cincuenta dólares. Poco a poco a medida que el tiempo fue transcurriendo ha venido mejorando su negocio ofreciendo mayores cantidades de productos para su venta.

Ha acudido al apoyo de Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito para la compra de su mercadería para el negocio. Por este motivo espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su solicitud será otorgada y además de esta forma podrá mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna O. is a lady from the town of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega. It is with much effort that she runs a clothing and shoe sale business in her own home, where she has three display cases to show her products.

She currently needs to obtain merchandise from her providers in order to offer them in her business because she is slowly selling out her inventory. That is why she is looking for Ceprodel’s help in obtaining a credit to purchase said merchandise and in that way continue to support her home that needs that investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna O. es una dama originaria del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de venta de ropa y calzado en su propia casa de habitación donde posee tres vitrinas para mostrar sus productos.

La necesidad que ella hoy en día atraviesa es que debe de adquirir la mercadería de sus proveedores para ofrecerla en su negocio por lo que poco a poco se le ha venido agotando su inventario. Por este motivo ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para adquirir dicha mercadería y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Cecilia's first loan.

Cecilia belongs to the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She lives with her husband, is 24 and has two little children. She is a mobile fruit woman in a tricycle in an inter-provincial transport station. She works all day, all week. She sells all kinds of fruit she purchases at the wholesale market.

Cecilia needs a 1250 soles ($US450) loan to invest in granadilla, apples, grapes, bananas, pears and oranges.

She wants to help her children in their studies, and she dreams about expanding her business, having a stable store and building her house.

loans.use: To buy granadilla, apples, grapes, bananas, pears and oranges.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Luis Marcos

texts.es:
Luis is the father of three children, one of them helps him take care of his motorcycle carts. Every morning they get up very early to offer services to the public. However, the last few months the motorcarts have needed maintenance and repair. Luis would like to fix them, But the economic situation prevents him from being able to get to a mechanic and he can't afford to make the repairs. Without the motorcart, he can't work, and his family suffers.

He is requesting the loan to repair his motorcarts and pay the mechanic fees which are very high. Let's help this father/daughter pair so they can continue their daily work.

Luis es padre de tres hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda en la atención de sus motocarros, trabajando padre e hijo juntos. Todas las mañanas salen muy temprano para brindar sus servicios de movilidad pública. Sin embargo, los últimos meses sus motocarros están teniendo ciertas fallas y don Luis desea poder repararlos, pero sus posibilidades económicas le impiden poder llevar su motocarro a un mecánico porque los repuestos son costosos. Sin su motocarro, don Luis no puede trabajar y deja de llevar el sostén diario a su hogar. El préstamo que ahora solicita es para comprar los repuestos de su motocarro malogrado, darle un necesario mantenimiento y también pagar los servicios mecánicos. Los repuestos para estas motos, son muy caros, y no están a su alcance. Colabora con este dúo de padre e hijo a continuar con su trabajo diario.

loans.use: TO MAKE THE NECESSARY REPAIRS ON HIS MOTORCART, SO HE CAN CONTINUE TO WORK.  WITHOUT THE MOTORCART, HIS FAMILY HAS NO INCOME.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.en:
Click this link to view the borrower's first loan.

Flor de María Q. C. belongs to the Estrella Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their 15-year-old son. She owns three bars in different central streets in Ayacucho where she sells drinks. She has employees who work from 9 am to 9 pm.

In the last few months, Flor de María has started a new business selling food in a rented place, where she prepares typical regional meals every day.

Flor de María needs a 2000 soles ($US700) loan to buy rice, sugar, vermicelli and vegetables. She dreams about having a micro-enterprise, more branches and providing everything her son requires so that he can be a professional.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vermicelli and vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is a hardworking mother. She has been able to get through very difficult times due to poverty, with the support of her husband and three grown up children. One of her children is a teacher, and he helped Feliciana set up a small general store. Thanks to her sons, she now runs her small shop from her house.

The loan Feliciana is requesting would allow her to expand the products she sells and increase her stock of basic items. She also raises small pigs which she sells. She invested wisely with her son's support, and she will do the same with this loan, making the payments on time and growing her business. She believes that when somebody gives you a hand, you respond with kindness and honesty.

Feliciana es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de haber pasado por momentos críticos a causa de la pobreza en la que se encontraba, pudo salir adelante gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus tres hijos quienes ahora son mayores, uno de ellos es profesor y ayudó doña Feliciana a abrir su pequeña bodega. Gracias a sus hijos, que ahora Feliciana cuenta con una tienda en su casa, surtida con algunos dulces. El préstamo que ella solicita ahora es para ampliar la variedad de sus productos y vender también productos de primera necesidad. Feliciana también cría chanchos, los cuida y alimenta y cuando llegan a la edad y peso adecuado, los vende. Con este préstamo, ella podría también comprar más cerdos. Feliciana ha invertido adecuadamente el apoyo que le brindó su hijo y promete que de igual manera, confíen que este monto será invertido correctamente en su negocio y responsable en sus pagos. Ella sabe que cuando alguien le tiende la mano, le debe corresponder con cariño y honestidad.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL GENERAL STORE,  AS WELL AS MORE SMALL PIGS WHICH SHE RAISES AND SELLS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sofía Albina

texts.es:
Sofia helps her husband with the household expenses by renting out her two motor taxis. The income helps support their three children who attend school. Sofia's work is very tiring, even though it's not physical work, she needs to be vigilant in the care and maintenance of the motor taxis, which is ongoing work. She also needs to be careful that the motor taxis are used responsibly. Sofia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. With high aspirations, she hopes to build her own successful transportation business one day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase new motortaxis. With more vehicles to rent, she will also increase her income, and as more time passes, she will be closer to achieving her goals.

Sofía, es una madre de familia que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y por ello tiene a su cuidado sus dos motocarros. Su negocio es alquilarlos por día y así obtienen ingresos para su hogar y lo que significa tener a tres hijos en la escuela. El trabajo de doña Sofía es muy cansado, porque a pesar que no es un trabajo físico, vigilar el cuidado y mantenimiento de las motos es un trabajo arduo y permanente, también debe estar pendiente de que no sean utilizados para otros fines que no sean los convenidos, y debe lidiar cada día con todo tipo de transportistas. Sin duda una de sus cualidades es ser una mujer valiente, y la otra es ser emprendedora, con aspiraciones muy altas, ya que ella quiere convertirse en una exitosa empresaria y tener una línea de transporte. El préstamo que ella solicita será invertido en la compra de nuevos motocarros. Al aumentar la cantidad de vehículos, aumentará también el ingreso de dinero diario, y con el paso del tiempo el sueño de Sofía se hará realidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE NEW MOTORTAXIS TO GROW HER TRANSPORTATION BUSINESS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Ms Felicita is a member of the communal bank Sol Naciente, located in the Jr. Augusto B Laguia 1098, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali She is 58 years old and is the mother of 6 children, her husband is merchant, but their income is not sufficient for the expenses of the home, so Ms Felicita with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on a small restaurant. Currently she sells meals at night, for which she gets up at at 7 o'clock in the morning, prepares her husbands breakfast and then begins with the preparation of the food she sells from 5 pm. to the 10 pm. With this loan of S/. 2500 which will be paid in 4 months, she bought sugar, rice, condiments, coal, eggs, olives, oil, seasonings, all for the preparation of the meals. Ms Felicita is a very hard-working woman, who even with the support of her children, she still desires to do well on her business so she can continue to feel proud of being a woman and mother.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Felicita pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Augusto B Laguia 1098, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para la canasta familiar, es así que Felicita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comidas en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos en las tardes desde las 5 pm. hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro azúcar, arroz, hojas de bijao, carbón, huevos, aceitunas, aceite, condimentos, etc. Para la preparación de sus comidas. Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos ella desea salir adelante a base de su propio trabajo y esfuerzo para sentirse orgullosa de ser mujer y madre.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina is a mother of two young children who attend school. Her priority is to make sure her children have everything they need, and so Rufina helps her husband with the household costs. She works in the fields and her husband work in a mine. The agricultural work is very tiring, as the zone they live in is jungle and the climate is very hot. Rufina needs to walk for many hours in the heat, preparing the land. But she is a hard working woman and keeps her motivation up even in the heat.

In order to generate more income for her family, Rufina wants to open a small nursury, where she can grow coffee and other products. She is requesting a loan to fund this business. She needs to buy new plants, cultivate them and wait for them to mature. The sale of these new products will help improve the quality of life for this family.

Rufina es una mujer con dos hijos que todavía van a la escuela de menores, quienes son su adoración. Cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, son la prioridad para ella y por esto apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Ella trabaja en el campo, mientras su pareja lo hace en una mina. Como agricultora, Rufina señala que su labor es muy cansada, porque la zona donde vive es selva, y el clima es terriblemente caluroso, ella tiene que caminar durante varias horas limpiando sus tierras y preparando el terreno. Pero no se siente desanimada pese a la sobrecargada labor que realiza, definitivamente es una mujer muy trabajadora. Para generar más ingresos para su familia, Rufina quiere implementar un vivero, donde se dedique a la producción de café y otros productos adicionales, para esto es que solicita un préstamo. Debe comprar nuevas plantas, cuidar de ellas y esperar que produzcan. La venta de estos nuevos productos mejorará la calidad de vida de esta familia.

loans.use: TO SET UP A SMALL PLOT OF LAND WHERE SHE CAN CULTIVATE COFFEE AND OTHER PRODUCTS TO SELL.  THE EXTRA INCOME WILL HELP WITH THE HOUSEHOLD COSTS AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Dolly Dermis

texts.es:
Ms Dolly is a member of the communal bank Las Divinas, located in the Jr. Progreso 168, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is the mother of 2 children, but her income is not enough to keep up with the expenses of the home, so Dolly with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on the beverage industry by selling juice. Currently she has one establishment to sell juice. She gets up at 6 o'clock in the morning and prepares all the juices that she sell from 6 am to the 9 am. With this loan of S/. 1500 which will be paid in 6 months, Ms Dolly bought carbonated water, papayas, orange, bananas, milk, apples, bread, ham, butter, etc. Dolly is very happy with her business because she is doing well, and her effort and dedication have paid off. Her family is her inspiration and she desires to offer them the best in order to improve their lifestyle and offer her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dolly pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Progreso 168, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para mantener los gastos familiares, es así que Dolly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de jugos. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de jugos, para lo cual se levanta a las 6am, a preparar sus jugos que los pone a la venta desde las 6 am hasta las 9 am. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró gaseosas, papayas, naranjas, plátanos, leche, manzanas, panes, jamón, mantequilla, etc. Dolly esta contenta con su negocio porque sale adelante por su esfuerzo y dedicación, con el único impulso que es su familia, ella desea brindarles todo el apoyo a través de su trabajo para darles una mejor condición de vida y de educación.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and carbonated water

loans.name: Carmen Francisca

texts.es:
Ms Carmen Francisca is a member of the communal bank “Brave Women,” located in the Jr Coronel Portillo 836, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is the mother of 3 daughters, her husband is a carpenter, but their income is not sufficient for their needs, so Ms Carmen with the first loan received of Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on the construction of a commercial space for events.

Currently, Ms Carmen has one location, which she rents for all kinds of social events. She gets up at 7 o'clock in the morning and prepares breakfast for her daughters and her husband. Then she waits for the arrival of her clients and at the end of her work day she takes care of the home. With this loan of S/. 1000 which will be paid in 4 months, She bought wood, cement, nails, paint, etc.

Carmen has just begun to make her dream come true. She has always wanted to have her own business, since her husband was always the one dealing with their investment. Carmen desires to continue to prosper on her business in order to benefit her family. She feels happy with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmen Francisca pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Trujillo 250, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 3 hijas, su esposo es maderero, pero su economía familiar no es suficiente para sus gastos, es así que Carmen con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la construcción de un local para eventos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local con el cual presta servicios de alquiler para todo tipo de eventos sociales, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijas y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la espera de la llegada de sus clientes y a los quehaceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró madera, cemento, calaminas, clavos, pintura, etc. Carmen recién esta empezando a hacer realidad el sueño de toda su vida, el de manejar sola su empresa ya que siempre las inversiones lo realizaba su esposo, ella desea seguir adelante para el beneficio de su familia. Se siente feliz con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Ms. Clara is a member of the communal bank “Brave Women,” located in the Jr Coronel Portillo 836, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. Ms. Clara is 37 years old, her husband is a mechanic, but their income is not sufficient for their needs, so Ms. Clara with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300, decides to invest on a small business. Currently, she gives manicures and facial cleanings. She gets up at at 7 o'clock in the morning, she prepares her husbands breakfast and then begins seeing her clients. With this loan of S/. 1500 which will be paid in 4 months, Ms. Clara bought diverse products for her business such as nail polish, scissors, etc. She realizes that as days pass by she has more and more clients, which is due to the good service she offers. , Ms. Clara’s profits have allowed her to better cover the expenses of the home, and improve the services she offers at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Clara pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, su esposo es mecánico, pero los ingresos económicos no son suficientes para la economía familiar, es así que Clara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella realiza maniquiure y limpieza facial, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo, de allí se dedica a atención de sus cliente. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró diversos productos para su negocio como esmaltes, tijeras, etc. Clara esta se da cuenta que sus clientes cada día van aumentando debido al buen trato que les da, esto se ve reflejado en sus ganancias ya que le permite apoyar en los gastos de su hogar para tener una mejor condición de vida y para mejorar los servicios que ofrece en su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Adelia Judith

texts.es:
Adelia belongs to the Valiant Women Communal Bank located on Jr Coronel Portillo 836 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of six. Her husband is a forrestry engineer, but their income isn't sufficient to support their family. With the first loan Adelia received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business selling beauty products. Currently, she still sells beauty products and gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, then distributes and collects her products for clients until 4pm. Wit this loan of $600, which she will repay in four months, she will buy perfumes, powders, deodorants, lipsticks, blushes, jewelry, watches, wallets, etc. Adelia is very happy that her business is growing and she is providing for her family. She is very thankful for the immense support that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adelia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Forestal, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son suficientes para el sustento familiar, es así que Adelia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dirige a repartir y cobrar sus productos a sus clientes hasta las 4 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, labiales, sombras, rubores, joyas, relojes, carteras, etc. Adelia se encuentra muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y esta dando buenos frutos para beneficio D. su familia. Esta muy agradecida por el inmenso apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To purchase various beauty products.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (“Brave Women”), located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 30 years old, but her income is too small to meet her cost of living, which is why she used her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos to start a business raising chickens.

Currently, she has a small shed where she tends to her chickens, for which she rises at 7 am to fix breakfast after which she dedicates herself to her animals and to keeping house.

With this loan of S/. 1300, to be repaid in four months, she bought 100 chicks as well as lumber for the construction of her shed.

Lilia, despite being single, thinks about her future and wants to be independent in every aspect of life to show other women that one doesn’t need to have a husband and children in order to get ahead and be successful. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for providing her the opportunity to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lilia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy pocos para sus gastos, es así que Lilia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de crianza de pollos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un pequeño galpón donde cría a sus pollitos, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar su desayuno, de allí se dedica al cuidado de sus pollitos y a los quehaceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro 100 pollitos y madera para la construcción de su galpón. Lilia a pesar de ser una mujer soltera piensa en su futuro y desea ser independiente en todo aspecto para demostrar a todas las mujeres que no se necesita tener hijos y esposo para tener las ganas de sobresalir y tener éxito. Esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de formar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and lumber.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
Encarna belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and has six children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income is not enough to meet their monthly expenses. It’s for this reason that Encarna, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small general store.

She currently has her grocery store, for which she rises at 7 am to fix breakfast for her children and husband, after which she tends to her store until 8 pm.

With this loan of S/. 2,000, to be repaid in six months, Encarna bought two sacks of rice, one sack of sugar, to boxes of milk, noodles, eggs, vegetables, oil, etc.

Encarna is very proud of herself because she has learned to manage her finances and conduct her business well given her desire and effort continue with the sole wish of supporting her children in their educations and to provide them with a better standard of living. She is very glad for the support provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Encarna pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz A2 Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos que posee no son suficientes para los gastos mensuales, es así que Encarna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta una bodega de abarrotes al por menor, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes hasta la 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, fideos, huevos, verduras, aceite, etc. Encarna esta muy orgullosa de si misma por que aprendió a manejar sus ingresos y a conducir su negocio por buen camino a base de esmero y lucha continua con el único deseo de apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida, se siente muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of general products at wholesale.

loans.name: Lenith

texts.es:
Lenith belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has two children. Her husband is a teacher, but his income is not enough to support the family financially. It’s for this reason that Lenith, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business.

Currently, she runs a business of photocopies, for which she rises at 6 am. She takes care of her household and business until 6 pm. The majority of her customers are children.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, to be repaid in six months, she bought bond paper at wholesale, supplies for her photocopy machine, materials to improve her location, etc.

Lenith only thinks about continuing to get ahead and growing her business so she can meet the goals she has set for her life and, in this way, support her children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lenith pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Colegio Sor Anneta de Jesús, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son suficientes para el sustento familiar, es así que Lenith con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de fotocopiadoras, para lo cual se levanta a las 6am. Para atender las labores de la casa para luego dedicarse a su negocio hasta las 6pm. La mayoría de sus clientes son niños. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró papel bond al por mayor, insumos para su maquina fotocopiadora, materiales para la implementación de su local, etc. Lenith solo piensa en seguir progresando y engrandeciendo su negocio para que así pueda cumplir los objetivos que se trazo en la vida, pues así podrá apoyar a sus hijos en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase paper at wholesale, supplies and other materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has five children. Her husband is a doctor, but they do not have enough income to meet their household expenses. It’s for this reason that Elsa, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business selling food and soft drinks.

She currently has a restaurant, and rises at 7 am to fix breakfast for her husband and children, after which she dedicates herself to preparing her food to sell between the hours of 12 pm and 3 pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, to be repaid in four months, she purchased materials to implement her restaurant such as tables, tablecloths, chairs, lumber, paint, etc.

Elsa feels very happy and thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has provided for her enterprise since now she can manage her own income and savings independently, and also support her children in their educations which is a top priority for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley 735, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es medico, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elsa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas y gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar su desayuno de su esposo y de sus hijos, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos a sus comensales desde las 12 pm hasta las 3 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró materiales para implementar su restaurante como mesas, manteles, sillas, madera, pintura, etc. Elsa se siente muy feliz y agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos para sus negocios pues ahora puede manejar sus propios ingresos y ganancias de manera independiente y también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios que es su prioridad.

loans.use: Purchase materials and other sundries to improve her restaurant.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has five children, however her income was not enough to meet their household expenses. It’s for this reason that Maria, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a sewing business.

Currently, she has a small business as a seamstress and making women’s clothing for which she rises at 7 am to make breakfast for her children, and from there she dedicates herself to making her garments until the late hours of the night to fill orders from customers.

With this loan of S/. 1,800, to be repaid over a six month period, she bought a sewing machine, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

Maria wishes to increase her earnings so she can maintain her children who are her reason for wanting to get ahead. She asks to continue to be supported, and is very glad for the help that Manuela Ramos has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Av José Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz A Lt 18, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 5 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan, es así que Maria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de costura. En la actualidad ella cuenta un pequeño negocio de servicio de costura y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, de allí se dedica a la confección de sus prendas hasta altas horas de la noche para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro 1 maquina de cocer, hilos, elásticos, botones, etc. Maria desea que sus ganancias aumenten para poder apoyar a sus hijos, que son su razón de ser para salir adelante, pide que le sigan a poyando y se siente muy feliz con el apoyo que le otorga Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, thread, elastics, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es:
Magda belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and has five children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income is low and not enough to support the family. It’s for this reason that Magda, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business.

Currently, she runs a business making clothes for which she rises at 7 am to make breakfast for her children and husband, so she can later dedicate herself to creating her garments until late at night and to meet the orders put in by her customers.

With this loan of S/. 900, to be repaid in six months, she bought fabric, borders, sequins, decorations for the garments, elastics, lace, thread, buttons, etc.

Magda is very happy because her earnings are increasing now that her enterprise is accumulating more customers. This allows her a better income so she can help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magda pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Miraflores 234, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no son suficientes para su familia, es así que Magda con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. confección D. vestuarios, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am. para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo para luego dedicarse a la confección D. sus vestuarios hasta altas horas D. la noche y poder cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Con este préstamo D. S/. 900 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró telas, bordadoras, lentejuelas, adornos para prendas, elásticos, blondas, hilos, botones, etc. Magda esta muy feliz por que sus ganancias están aumentando ya que su negocio esta captando mayor cantidad D. clientes, esto le permite mayor cantidad D. ingresos para que pueda apoyar en los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale, supplies, thread, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (“Brave Women”), located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, but her income is very low and not enough to support the family financially. It’s for this reason that Margarita, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a business selling sweets.

Currently, she has a small store where she sells a variety of items. The business is located in her own home. She gets up at 7 am to make breakfast for her children. With this loan of S/. 2,000, to be repaid over a period of four months, she bought cookies, gum, candies and other snacks.

With her small earnings, Margarita helps with the household expenses and at the same time supports her children in their educations. She is glad to have the support that Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Margarita pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Eduardo del Aguila 455, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no le alcanzan para sus gastos familiares, es así que Margarita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de golosinas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde vende diversas golosinas, negocio ubicado en su propia casa. Ella se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro galletas, chicles, caramelos, y otras golosinas. Margarita con las pocas ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ayuda en los gastos de su hogar y a la vez a apoya a sus hijos en los estudios, se siente feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of candy/sweets at wholesale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lizett

texts.es:
Lizett belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver, however his income is not enough to meet the financial needs of the family. It’s for this reason that she decided, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, to invest in a small business selling “chupetes” (frozen ice popsicles).

Lizett gets up very early to take care of the household chores, so she can then make her products and sell them throughout the day. She tends to her business from her own home, which allows her to still take care of her husband and children easily. With the loan of S/. 1,500, to be repaid over six months, she bought a refrigerator, small bags, sugar, milk and other supplies to make her confections.

Lizett is a woman with much desire to get ahead, along with her kids, and provide them with more opportunities for a better future. She is content with how her business is progressing, as she is capturing more customers and she is very glad for the support provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lizett pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz A3 Lt 9, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son los suficientes para sus gastos familiares, es así que Lizett con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de chupetes (helado de hielo). La señora Lizett se levanta muy temprano para atender las labores de la casa para después elaborar sus productos y así poder venderlos durante todo el día. Ella atiende su negocio desde su propia casa, esto le permite atender a su esposo e hijos sin dificultad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1, 500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró 1 refrigerador, bolsitas para preparar chupetes, masas de aguaje, masas de ungurahui, azúcar, leche, etc. Lizett es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto a sus hijos, para brindarles mejores oportunidades en el futuro, esta contenta con el progreso de su negocio, ya que esta volviendo a recuperar a sus clientes y se siente contenta con el apoyo dado por Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and other supplies.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente”, located in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 61 years old and has three children, however her income is not enough to meet her financial needs. It’s for this reason that Romelia, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business selling food.

She currently runs the business at night, rising at 7 am to prepare her breakfast and from then on dedicate herself to preparing her food which she sells from 5 pm until 10 pm.

With this loan of S/. 2,500, to be repaid over a period of four months, she bought rice, oil, sodas, condiments, poultry, fish, etc.

Romelia is very happy and her business is growing little by little, and her sales are also are increasing. All the effort she puts forth is to support her family and to demonstrate for other women that they too can work and be successful businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Romelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en la Av. Jhon F Kendy 999, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para su economía familiar, es así que Romelia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. venta D. comidas en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar su desayuno y D. allí se dedica a la preparación D. sus comidas para venderlos en las tardes desD. las 5 pm hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró menestras, arroz, aceite, gaseosas, condimentos, gallinas, pescado, etc. Romelia está muy feliz, su negocio está creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas también aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para apoyar a su familia y demostrar a todas las demás mujeres que si pueden trabajar y ser grandes empresarias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es:
Noelali belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and has two children. The income she has is not enough to meet the financial needs of the family, which is why Noelali used her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos to invest in a business selling sodas.

She runs this business today, rising at 7 am to make breakfast for her children and tend to the housekeeping, which allows her to then dedicate herself to selling her product throughout the day.

With the loan of S/. 800, to be repaid over a period of six months, she bought sodas at wholesale, as well as jellos, kekes, etc.

Noelali has felt very happy since the day she was able to take control over her own income because she can contribute toward the expenses of her household for the benefit of her children. She is very content with the support provided by Manuela Ramos for her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noelali pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 638, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 2 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para mantener los gastos familiares, es así que Noelali con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de gaseosas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, a preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y a los quehaceres de su hogar, para luego dedicarse a la venta de sus gaseosas durante todo el día. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró gaseosas al por mayor, gelatinas, kekes, etc. Noelali se siente muy feliz desde el día en que pudo manejar sus propios ingresos pues de esa manera pudo aportar en los gastos de su hogar, para el bienestar de sus hijos. Está muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy sodas at wholesale, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.en:
Maria Carmela's previous Kiva loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28973

Carmela belongs to the Llamkasum (“workers” in Quechua) Village Bank.

She is married, is 79 and has 6 children.

She has a grocery in the Chiara district and purchases her products in Ayacucho. She also raises animals, more especially bovine, produces cheese and sells milk in Ayacucho in a mobile way in an avenue. She does home selling as well.

Carmela needs a 1750 soles loan to buy sugar, rice and oil.

She would like to have a regular shop, produce more cheese and she wants her daughter to have economic stability.

loans.use: Carmela needs a 1750 soles loan to buy sugar, rice and oil.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Esperanza Cconislla

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34162

Esperanza belongs to the Imperio Village Bank. She is married, is 60 and has 3 children.

She makes typical clothes like petticoats, aprons and sells her products in fairs. She also weaves pullovers and that is for she purchased a weaving loom 3 months ago. Thus she can proviD. more products to her business.

Esperanza travels at fairs where she sells vegetables, fruits and clothes she makes.

She needs a 1000 soles loan to buy wool and clothes.

She wants her children to have their own business like she did. She also would like her grandchildren to study and she dreams about extending her business.

loans.use: She needs a 1000 soles loan to buy wool and clothes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Noema

texts.en: Noema P., 59, is married with seven children. Noema runs a plantation business and it's well supported by her grandsons. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Noema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Noema would like to purchase gromoxone, sting and knives for her plantation.

loans.name: Salu

texts.en: Salu T., 34, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation/vegetable business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Salu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Salu is a very energetic mother, owning a four-acre plantation in her village.

loans.use: Purchase purchase pesticides, sting, knives, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi M. U., 26, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (~416 USD). SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is a single female running a small shop in the village of Faleseela. She's supporting her parents and sisters.

loans.use: Restock her shop, to have enough supply

loans.name: Vaiana

texts.en: Vaiana T., 32, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 480 Tala (~200 USD). SPBD loans are Vaiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaiana is running a plantation business. Her husband is unemployed but working together with her in running the business.

loans.use: Purchase purchase pesticides, empty gallon jugs for carrying water.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi S., 46, joined Tinh Thuong Fund in 2002. Since then, Mrs. Bui has used the Fund’s loan to invest into making noodles for restaurants in her neighborhood and breeding chickens and pigs, which have helped her family earn a stable income. Her husband is very hard-working and supportive of what she does. She has three children, one of whom has already grown up and moved out. The other two are still in school. Her family income is about 4 millions VND per month. In the next loan period, she would like to borrow 10 millions VND to keep making noodles and breeding animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.
