Chị Bùi Thị Sến 46 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002 vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào làm bún kết hợp cùng với việc chăn nuôi lợn nên gia đình chị luôn có nguồn thu nhập ổn định, chị chuyên làm bún bán cho các cửa hàng bán ăn sáng quanh khu vực nên việc làm bún của gia đình chị luôn diễn ra đều đặn, chồng chị là người chịu khó luôn hỗ trợ chị trong công việc, ngoài viêc làm bún gia đình chị còn đầu tư nhiều vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà, bình quân hàng năm xuất chuồng 4 tạ lợn, chi có 3 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con hiện đang đi học và sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm bún và chăn nuôi.

Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi N. is now 39 years old. But she was only 33 when she joined Tinh Thuong Fund in 2002. Young as she was back then, she was very willing to venture into business. She discussed joining the Fund with her husband so that she could ask for a loan to invest into making "banh da"- Vietnamese's traditional pancake. Mrs. Dao used an initial loan of 2 millions VND to purchase necessary equipment for her business. And since she was the only "banh da" maker in her area at that time, her products were sold like hot cakes. Mrs. Dao plans to invest the next loans into making "banh da", which has been a stable source of income for her family. Mrs. Dao has two children, both of whom are still in school but one of them is now old enough to help her with her business. Her husband is a motorbike- driver, with an income of 2 millions VND per month. Combined together, her family income is about 5 millions VND per month. In the next loan period, she would like to borrow 15 millions VND. 

Translated from Vietnamese h by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Nụ 39 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002 lúc đó chị còn rất trẻ 33 tuổi nhưng chị rất mạnh giạn làm kinh tế, chị đã bàn với chồng vào Quỹ tham gia vay vốn để đầu tư làm bánh đa, với vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua đồ nghề, với nghề này tại địa phương chị hiện chưa có ai làm vì vậy sảm phẩm của gia đình chị bán rất chạy, vẫn dự án như vậy các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị tiếp tục đầu tư vào làm bánh, kinh tế gia đình ngày một phát triển, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân  2.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học, 1 con đã lớn có thể giúp chị trong công việc làm bánh. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm bánh đa. 
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu F., 42, is married with 5 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Sefulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to repair the house. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase equipment such as weedkiller, knives, sharpeners and also chemicals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 50, joined TYM Fund in 2004. In the first round of loan, Mrs. H. asked for 3.000.000 VND to invest into a small business, which didn’t generate much profit. She then switched to the business of molding and selling steel and concrete mixer. As the demand for building materials has been enormous in recent years, the business has been relatively lucrative. She has been able to purchase more furniture for her home and build houses for her two children. The smallest one is living with her. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. wishes to borrow 15.000.000VND ($900) to invest into concrete mixers. Her family’s income is about 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004 vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ, thu nhập từ dự án này là không cao nên vòng vốn sau chị đã chuyển hướng kinh doanh, vợ chồng chị bàn bạc kinh doanh buôn bán, đúc ép cóc bê tông, trong điều kiện kinh tế phát triển như hiện nay nhu cầu xây dựng tăng cao nên việc kinh doanh mặt hàng này rất phù hợp, thu nhập cao kinh tế gia đình phát triển hơn chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình ngoài ra chị đã xây dựng và cho 2 con ra ở riêng, 1 con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đâu tư vào buôn bán cọc bê tông.

Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., aged 46, is a member of TYM Fund. Since joining TYM, she has been using the loans to invest into her small business in the market. As she and her family live close to the market, it is very convenient for them to run the business there. Her customers are usually those who have been doing the business with her for a long time. In recent years, Mrs. L. has used the loans to purchase more goods for her store, which help appeal to more customers. Her family’s income has been more stable ever since. Her husband is a taxi-driver with an income of 3.000.000 VND per month. Mrs. L. has two children, both of whom are still in school. In the next round of loan, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 15.000.000 VND ($900) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s monthly income is 5.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Lương 46 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán nhỏ tại chợ, thuận lợi cho gia đình chị sống gần chợ nên việc buôn bán của chị đã có nhiều năm, số khách đến mua hàng của chị chủ yếu là khách quen, từ việc buôn bán nhỏ ban đầu, khi có vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư mở rộng thêm nhiều mặt hàng đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe tắc xi nên thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào buôn bán.

Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Talaleomalie

texts.en: Talaleomalie F., 35, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Talaleomalie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to renovate her house. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase equipment needed for the business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. is a 52 year old mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend school. She is a subsistence farmer in Trapaing Skun Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Mi Seng, collects palm juice to process into sugar. Mrs. Chan T.’s plantation now faces a problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Chan T. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to add to her old one for use as draft animals. Last year, one of her children suffered from typhoid and Mrs. Chan T. spent $100 in medical expenses for the cure. Mrs. Chan T. has insufficient money to buy a cow to plow her field. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to her old one for use as draft animals.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., aged 47, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2002. Her family’s main source of income is selling pork; her husband slaughters pigs and she sells pork in the market. Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. N. didn’t have much capital so she had only one pig. But with the loans from TYM Fund, Mrs. N. has been able to expand her business, selling meat from 2 or 3 pigs per day. Besides selling pork retail in the market, Mrs. N. also sells it wholesale to some customers. Mrs. N. has two children, both of whom are grown-up and have jobs. Her family’s daily income is 200000 VND. In the next round of loan, Mrs. N. wishes to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($600) to invest into her business. Her family’s income is about 6.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nháng 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002 nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là làm nghề thịt lợn, chồng chị là người thịt còn chị là người bán tại chợ, trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ đồng vốn của gia đình chị còn nhỏ gia đình chị chỉ thịt 1 con lợn, qua các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đã có vốn trong kinh doanh, đến nay gia đình chị đã mở rộng thị trường hơn, số lượng tiêu thụ ngày càng tăng bình quân mỗi ngày thịt từ 2 đến 3 con, ngoài việc chị bán lẻ tại chợ gia đình chị còn giao buôn cho một số khách hàng, thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình bình quân 200.000đ, 2 con chị đã lớn và đã có công việc ổn định. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn.

Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Mrs. Ki M. is a villager in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Ki M. is a 41 year old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is enrolled in school. All family members currently live in an old house, thus, Mrs. Ki M. decided to request a loan to build a new house. Previously, Mrs. Ki M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. lives in Deok Peang Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Thol Lan, is a construction worker and subsistence farmer. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough cattle to plow his field. Therefore, Mrs. Ly Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Mrs. Ly Y. is 30 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the last one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ly Y. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers to support her husband’s field. Mrs. Ly Y. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase an additional cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Meanana

texts.en: Meanana S., 18, is married with no children.  She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the general public and villages 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Meanana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used for the business needs. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, and shovel.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mr. Sokhom S. is a farmer in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, he collects palm juice to process into sugar. His wife, Mrs. Morn Phoem, helps him on the field. Mr. Sokhom S. usually hires a laborer with draft animals to plow his rice field, but  he has decided to do the plow work himself.  He has decided to request a loan to purchase cows for plowing. Mr. Sokhom S. is 40, and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two others are enrolled in school. The remaining two are too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Sokhom S. obtained a loan to hire a laborer to plow the rice field and he bought fertilizers for his field as well. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow his rice field.

loans.name: Onosai

texts.en: Onosai M., 70, is married with 10 children. She has 5 years of experience in the General Store business. She sells to the village people and public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans)with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~291 USD). SPBD loans are Onosai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to maintain the shop improvement. He husband has always been a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To fund items and products needed for replacement.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth S. is a subsistence farmer in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her rice revenue is very minimal. Thus, Mrs. Reth S. decided to request a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice more rice  and expand her revenue. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sim, sells firewood door to door. Mrs. Reth S. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Last year, Mrs. Reth S.’s husband suffered from a severe stomach ache and Mrs. Reth S. spent $500 to on medical attention to cure him. The medical expenses drained Mrs. Reth S. savings and she no longer has enough money to spend on the rice field. Mrs. Reth S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice and expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Taualagi

texts.en: Taualagi T., 50 years of age, is married with 7 children. She has 2 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Taualagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to fund businees improvement. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: To get what is needed for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan P. is a wedding chef in Prey Tachap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is also a farmer. Mrs. Yan P. is a widow with three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is studying in the local school. Mrs. Yan P. faces a small problem with her rice plantation because she does not have enough money to buy an additional cow to add to the old one for use as a draft animal. Thus, she has decided to request a loan. Mrs. Yan P. would use any remaining money to purchase fertilizers to increase her crop yield. Previously, Mrs. Yan P. obtained a loan from AMK to start a pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to add to the old one for use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Mu

texts.en: Mu F., 58, is married with 9 children. She has many years of experience in the cabbages, beans, green pepper, and pumpkin business. She sells to the general public and villages 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Mu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to repair house. Her husband helps out to do the vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam E. lives in the Prey Tachap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a wedding chef who makes only a small income to support her family. Mrs. Sam E. is a 48 year old widow with five children, all of whom are employed in different business activities. Even though they are all working, they still live in poor conditions in an old house. Thus, Mrs. Sam E. decided to request a loan to repair her house in order to improve the hygienic conditions and decrease the incidence of illness. Previously, Mrs. Sam E. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to improve the hygienic conditions and decrease the incidence of illness.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua A., 44, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the general public and villages 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Sua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She'll se to repair the house and to pay for the kids' cducation. Her husband works on their farming.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and shovel.

loans.name: Kaing

texts.en: Mrs. Kaing M. lives in Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Keov, are subsistence farmers.  They have three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is working as a construction worker. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Although there are four people working in this family, there is still an insufficient amount of money to purchase equipment to repair the family home. Thus, Mrs. Kaing M. has decided to request a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Kaing M. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy equipment to repair the family home.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa Fedow, 36, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the clothing business. She sells to the general public and villages 5 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Epenesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to pay for the kids' education. Her husband helps with the business.

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric, paints and brushes.

loans.name: Vannak Chhon

texts.en: Mr. Vannak C. is a 27 year old farmer in Thnaol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Sokun Uon, is a garment factory worker. They have a child who is too young to work or study. Mr. Vannak C.’s living conditions are poor, and to improve them he wants to start a pig breeding business; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy pigs. Last year, Mr. Vannak C. spent $100 to cure his child from an infection.  Mr. Vannak C. has decided to request a loan to purchase some pigs to begin the piggery. His wife is presented in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to support his family.

loans.name: Legase

texts.en: Legase E., 40, is married with 2 children. She has 1 year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and schoolchildren 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Legase’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to start her project. She is running her pancake project while the husband does all the farming to support the family.

loans.use: to start her pancake business.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mr. Sao M. is a villager in Prey Changva Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is a farmer and a collector of plastics, cans and empty bottles which are then re-sold to a recycling center. Previously, Mr. Sao M. had obtained a loan to start his recycling business. Since his business is now doing very well, Mr. Sao M. has decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his recycling waste for sale. His wife, Mrs. Pov Choek, helps her husband on the rice field. Mr. Sao M. has seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three others are attending school. The remaining three are too young to work or enroll in school. Last year, one of his children got  dengue fever and Mr. Sao M. spent $250 on medical bills to cure it. Presently, other children got typhoid and he has had other unforeseen expenses which caused Mr. Sao M.’s savings to dry out. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his recycling waste for sale.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga F., 45, is widowed with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the pork bun business. She sells to the general public and villages 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will be able to use it for the business, Kids school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase meat, soy, garlic and onions, cement, timber, nails, iron roofing

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch P. and her husband, Mr. Choem Khat, are subsistence farmers in Prey Changva Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children, three of whom are construction workers while the remaining two are attending school. Although the family members have different business activities, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Mrs. Touch P. and her husband want to start an ice-cream selling business which is likely to do well since Cambodia is hot. Thus, Mrs. Touch P. has decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike with a freezer for her husband to sell ice-cream door-to-door. Last year, one of Mrs. Touch P.’s children got dengue fever and  she spent $175 on medical bills to cure. The additional expense hurt the family budget. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a freezer for her husband to sell ice-cream door-to-door.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan C. lives in the Ta Reach Village in Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Koeurn Sok, are farmers. They have eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are enrolled in school. The remaining four are too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Yan C. now faces a problem because she does not have enough draft animals to plow her rice field, thus, she requests a loan to buy a new cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Previously, Mrs. Mrs. Yan C. had obtained a loan from Amret Co., LTD to buy piglets for breeding. Last year, one of her children got dengue fever and she spent $125 to cure it. This unexpected expense drained Mrs. Yan C.’s savings even further so now she has insufficient money to buy a cow. Mrs. Yan C. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Seng

Aside from these business activities, he is a pig breeder. His piggery now needs to be repaired. Thus, Mr. Seng C. decided to request a loan to fix it. His wife, Mrs. Kim Orm, is a farmer. Mr. Seng C. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other two are attending school. So far, Mr. Seng C. obtained a loan to buy rice to make wine. His wife is presented in the right of the photo.

loans.use: Repairs to his piggery.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mr. Yem N. owns a small rice farm in the Angk Taley Village in Kampong Speu Province. One of Mr. Yem N.’s cows died, recently, so now he does not have enough draft animals. Thus, Mr. Yem N. decided to request a loan to purchase a new cow to replace the deceased one used to plow his field. Mr. Yem N. is a widower with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a car driver whom makes only a small income. A fourth child is attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study.  Previously, Mr. Yem N. had obtained a loan from AMK to start a poultry business. Last year, his wife needed an operation on her throat and Mr. Yem N. spent $1000 in medical bills; unfortunately, his wife died because of this disease.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the deceased one used to plow his field.

They have a child who is too young to work or study. In order to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Vannathim N. wants to start a cow breeding business. Thus, Mr. Vannathim N. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business in order to improve his standard of living.

She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Paese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Aall will be used for her vegestable business. Her husband is doing fishing while she is doing selling.

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en: Fariz was born in 1982. He is married and has 2 children. Fariz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in Baku city, Yasamal region. He has been in this business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts so as to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his wife is pictured) is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1950. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Biladjari settlement. He has run this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy goods for re-sale

loans.name: Mevla

texts.en:
Mevla is a 42-year-old woman living in Binjezevu, right outside Sarajevo. She is divorced and living with her only child. Mevla has worked selling clothes, which gave her a monthly income of about 300BAM ($240 USD). However she recently started to grow mushrooms in her basement, and has found she is able to earn more in this line of work.

This 600 BAM loan is her first loan from Zene za Zene. She will use this to buy fungicide and pesticide treatments for her mushrooms to prevent any crop losses for the season. Mevla is excited to focus more on her mushroom business and hopes this will be a good move for her. With her one child in school, she will need to earn more money to pay for schooling and supplies, and she believes this will be the best way to ensure her income growth.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to protect her mushrooms

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en:
Djeyhun was born in 1975, is married, and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Kalbadjar region of Azerbaijan. He has settled in Surakhani region.
Djeyhun has run this business  for 3 years. Now he is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more curtains to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy curtains for re-sale

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Albertina M. is single and over 65 years old. She was born in Xaka Ni Mizi, known as Kilometer 18. She was able to complete the 3rd grade and then had to stop because of her parents’ social and economic conditions.

Albertina has 5 children. The oldest lives in South Africa and works as a miner, and the youngest is 25 years old, studied until the 9th grade, and is currently working as a fisherman. Albertina also supports 4 grandchildren who live with their respective mothers in the same plot.

Because of the military conflict, Albertina took refuge in Maputo with her family. She learned to work the land from her father, and has been working in agriculture for 23 years. Her day begins at 6:00 and ends at 10:00. She has no employees. The money she makes from agriculture goes toward supporting the family.

Albertina lives in her own house, and this is her 8th loan. The first 3 were for building her home, and the others were for the fishing business. She found out about Hluvuku through credit officials. In the future Albertina intends to finish her house, fix her fishing boat, and if possible, save some money for other needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Albertina M., solteira maior de 65 anos de idade, nasceu em Xaka ni mizi conhecido por Kilómetro 18, estudou até 3ª classe e não teve possibilidade de continuar devido as condições sociais e económicas dos seus pais. Tem 5 filhos sendo que o mais velho tem 36 anos e trabalha na África do Sul como mineiro e o mais novo tem 25 anos estudou até 9ª classe e actualmente é pescador, todavia sustenta 4 netos e vivem no mesmo quintal embora com as respectivas mães. Devido ao conflito armado tinha se refugiado na cidade de Maputo junto com a familia. Actualmente dedica-se a agricultura e faz este trabalho a 23 anos, inicia as 6:00 e termina as 10:00mn e não tem empregados e relata que aprendeu com o pai. Basicamente o rendimento da agricultura é para sustento da familia. Albertina M. Vive em casa própria e já beneficiou de 8 empréstimos sendo que os 1º a 3º foi para Habitação e os restantes para pesca e teve conhecimento da existencia da hluvuku atraves de trabalhos de divulgação pelos oficiais de crédito. No futuro pretende terminar com a obra de sua casa e reparação do barco e se possivel poupar para algumas necessidades.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her boat

loans.name: Pompilio José

texts.pt:
Pompilio José A. is 38 years old and was born in the province of Zambesia, in the district of Inhassuque. He is married and the father of 4 children aged between 12 and 7, whom he had with 2 different women. The 2 older ones are already in school. Pompilio supports his children and his two wives.

Pompilio completed the 7th grade, after which he had to stop because he was drafted into military service. That is how he left his birthplace in the province of Zambezia and move to the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, where he began his family.

Pompilio is now living in his own house. When the peace accord was reached, he was demobilized and now receives a pension. Besides that, he earns some extra money by doing small clothing repairs, which he learned to do in 1999.

Pompilio is not able to save any money and states that his income is far from his needs. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and his first through Kiva. His first loan was for 8,000.00 MT that he used for building materials. He intends to use this second loan for the same purposes. Pompilio’s greatest dream is to have a house to shelter his family with dignity.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Pompilio José A. tem 38 anos de idade, Nasceu na provincia da ZAmbezia distrito de Inhassuque , casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 12 anos, 7 anos e dois sendo de mães diferente ambos com três anos. Os dois mais velhos já vão a Escola. Ninguem fora dos filhos e as duas esposas que é sustentado por Pompilio.

Pompilio estudou até 7ªClasse e deixou de continuar por ter ingressado nos serviços militar obrigatório. Desta forma permitiu ao Pompilio sair da Provincia da Zambezia terra natal para provincia do Maputo ao Sul de Moçambique onde veio a constituir a sua familia. Neste momento vive numa casa própria.

Pompilio com acordo geral de paz foi desmobilizado e assim recebe pensão da reforma. Para alem da pensão faz pequenos serviços de concertos de roupa por conta própria e este trabalho não é rotineira depende da sua solicitação. Aprendeu em 1999 aqui no distrito em que mora neste momento. Pompilio não faz poupança nenhum alegando que os rendimentos estão longe das sua necessidades.

Para pompilio este é o segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku e Primeiro no Kiva o primeiro foi de 8000,00mt qual usou para compra de material de construção e este também usara para o mesmo fim.

Pompilio tem como grande sonho ter uma casa digna para albergar a sua família.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Fatima João

texts.pt:
Fatima João B. is 27 years old and was born in Boane. She is single and lives alone with her 5-month-old daughter. Fatima has never lived outside her hometown. She was trained at the elementary teacher training center as an elementary school teacher. She is currently living in her pantry because her house is under construction.

Fatima has been teaching at a public school for 3 years, and receives a monthly salary of 2,640.00 MT. This is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku and her first through Kiva. She has never taken out loans through other institutions. She found out about Hluvuku by chance when she walked by and saw an announcement. She decided to stop and get information, and later on put in her first request, which was approved.

This loan will go toward buying building materials. Her greatest dream is to see her house built and furnished.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatima João B. tem 27 anos de idade, natural de Boane e residente em mesmo distrito, solteira e mae de uma filha de 5 meses. Ela vive sozinha com a filha.

Fatima nunca mudou de cidade é formada como professora do ensino primário. Nestre momento vive na dispensa dado que a casa está em construção.

Fatima dá aula numa escola publica a 3 anos e tem um salário mensal de 2640,00mt e consegue poupar 1600,00mt por mês. Aprendeu o seu trabalho no centro de formação dos professores primários.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo para Fatima na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva e nunca teve noutras instituições. Conhece Hluvuku por casualidade estando a passar e viu a escrita e assim decidiu entrar para se informar da s condições e assim mais tarde veio a apresentar o seu primeiro pedido e este foi aprovado.

Assim este empréstimo destinara para compra de material de construção e constitui seu grande sonho ver a sua casa concluída e mobilada.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Filomena Jorge

texts.pt:
Filomena Jorge M. is 34 years old and was born in Catembe. She is completing the 10th grade and will be taking her exams in July. She is single and has a 16-year-old daughter in the 9th grade and a 14-year-old daughter in the 7th grade. Filomena also supports her father and 2 brothers, who live with her. She has never left Catembe.

Filomena has been an administrative assistant at the Primary School of Catembe since 1997. Her work hours begin at 7:30 a.m. and end at 5:30 p.m. She learned her work from other co-workers and from over 10 years of experience.

Filomena lives in her own house, and has benefited from 2 loans. The first she used to buy basic goods, and the second for building materials. She found out about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues.

In the future Filomena intends to finish her studies and build a solid house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena Jorge M., nasceu na Catembe tem 34 anos, tem frequencia da 10ª classe e em Julho próximo vai realizar exames extraordinários.

Solteira tem duas filhas sendo que a mais velha tem 16 anos de idade e frequenta a 9ª classe e a mais nova tem 14 anos e está na 7ª classe.Sustenta também o pai e dóis irmãos e vivem com eles e relata que nunca saiu da catembe.

Atualmente é assistente administrativa efectiva na Escola Primária Completa da Catembe desde 1997, entra as 7:30 e sai as 15:30mn. O trabalho que faz aprendeu com colegas de profissão e fá-lo a mais de 10 anos.

Vive em casa própria e já teve dóis empréstimos o 1º foi pra compra de bens de consumo e o 2º para compra de materiais de construção e conheceu a Hluvuku atravéis de colegas e amigas. No futuro pretende concluir os estudos e construir uma casa de material convencional.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: José Amos

texts.pt:
José Amos D. is 43 years old and was born in the province of Tete. He is married and father of 6 children – 3 girls and 3 boys. All of them go to school except the youngest, who is 2. Besides his children, he also supports his mother in-law by sending her food supplies.

José completed the 4th grade, at which point he had to stop because he was drafted into military service. He was wounded in war, and is handicapped as a result. He married in 1994.

José currently lives in his own house, although it is still under construction. He receives a monthly pension of 4,500 MT, none of which he can save because of building expenses.

This is José’s 3rd loan. His first one was for 6,500 and his second for 7,000. Both previous ones were designated for purchasing building materials, like this third loan. With future loans, José intends to eventually build a store to increase the family’s income and to better educate his children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

José Amos D. tem 43 anos, natural da provincia de Tete, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos sendo 3 meninas e 3 rapazes, todos vão a escola excepto o mais novos de 2 anos. Alem dos filhos sustenta a sogra más não vive com ela na mesma casa só manda comida ou géneros alimentícios.

José estudou até 4ªclasse e deixou por ter ingressado no serviço militar obrigatório. Foi desmobilizado e é mutilado de guerra (deficiente físico) em 1994 casou se maritalmente. Neste momento vive numa casa própria apesar estar ainda em construção.

José é pensionista e aufere mensalmente 4500,00mt deste não poupa nada porque está investindo na construção. Este é o terceiro empréstimo do José os dois primeiros de 6500,00mt e 7000,00mt ambos destinados para compra de material de construção e o terceiro pretende também continuar com a compra de material de construção.

José pretende futuramente com ajuda de empréstimo construir um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar os rendimentos da família assim acha que será fácil a educação escolar dos filhos.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: José Pinto

texts.pt:
José Pinto C. was born in Catembe, is 27 years old and single. He does not have children and lives with his parents, where he contributes to some of the household expenses. José Pinto completed his 3rd year of Accounting at the Commercial Institute of Maputo and is currently trying to enter night courses in one of the higher education institutions.

José Pinto has worked as a full-time accountant for over 2 years, where his day begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 5:00 p.m. He graduated from the Commercial Institute of Maputo and then did a 3-month internship at the same company he works for now. His monthly income is 6,000 MT and he’s able to put away some of it.

This is José Pinto’s first loan with Hluvuku. He found out about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues. In the future, he plans on building his own house and will need to take out another loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

José Pinto C., solteiro de 27 anos de idade, nasceu na Catembe, não tem filhos, vive na casa dos pais e naturalmente contribui com algumas despesas domésticas.

José Pinto concluiu o 3º ano de Contabilidade no Instituto Comercial de Maputo e presentemente está a concorrer ao curso pós laboral numa das instituições de ensino superior.

É contabilista de profissão em regime permanente a mais de dóis anos, entra as 7:30 e sai as 17horas. Formou-se no Instituto Comercial de Maputo e teve 3 meses de estágio na empresa onde trabalha actualmente, o rendimento mensal é de 6.000Mt e consegue poupar algum dinheiro.

Para José Pinto este é o 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku e teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku a traves dos colegas e amigos.

No futuro pretende construir sua residência e vai precisar de fazer outro empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Júlia Tomás

texts.pt:
Júlia Tomás N. is married and 33 years old. She was born in Catembe on September 6, 1975. She studied until the 6th grade. She supports 3 children who are all in school.

She was born and raised in a family environment with her parents but when she was young her aunt invited her to live with her because she did not have any children. She was going to school and in her free time would help her aunt with her work in Machamba.

She returned to her parents' home when she was 15. Due to the war and her health she interrupted her studies and went to live in the city of Maputo with her oldest sister. When she was 16 she had her first child. As soon as the war ended she returned to her parents' home and began to work as a volunteer activist for the Institute of Social Action in 1998.

Currently she works in the ONG Imagine as a community coordinator. With the loan she intends to purchase beams, zinc plates, and cement to build a home where she has sufficient space. Work is moving along reasonably well. In the future she longs to build a mini grocery store to help with the family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Júlia Tomás N. casada maritalmente, tem 33 anos de idade, nasceu em catembe aos 06 de Setembro de 1975, estudou até 6ª classe, sustenta 3 filhos e todos estudam. Nasceu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais, só que cedo a tia convida-a viver com ela pois esta não tinha filhos, estudava e nos tempos livres ajudava a tia nos trabalhos da machamba. Regressa a casa dos pais quando tinha 15 anos de idade, devido a problemas da guerra e de saúde interrompe os estudos e passa viver na Cidade de maputo com a irmà mais velha. Aos 16 anos teve seu 1º filho e logo que termina a guerra regressa a casa dos pais e começa a trabalhar como activista voluntária no Instituto de ação social em 1998. Actualmente trabalha na ONG imagine como coordenadora comunitária. Com o crédito pretende comprar barrotes, chapas de zinco e cimento e tem espaço sufuciente para erguer sua casa e conseguiu-o por trespasse e as obras estão a decorrer razoavelmente. No futuro almeja construir uma mini mercearia para ajudar na renda da familia.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Pedro Adriano

texts.pt:
Pedro Adriano M. is 38 years old and native to the District of Marracuene, province of Maputo to the south of Mozambique. He is married and the father of 4 children between the ages of 15 and 6 months. The 3 oldest are already in school. Besides his family he also supports his parents by sending them money.

Pedro studied until the 9th grade and stopped because of the financial situation of his family. In 1977 he left the district of Marracuene, where he was born, with his family when his father was transferred with the services to Boane. He lives in his own home in Boane

Pedro has raised chickens since 1992 and possesses a small poultry farm where he works from 6:00am through 6:00pm. He has two employees, one woman and a boy. He learned his trade watching friends in the area since 1992. Business is going well despite the high cost of chicken food and transportation. He has to make purchases in the city of Maputo which is a distance of 30 km.

He sells the chicken for 8MT each and is able to sell 30 chickens per day. He has monthly receipts of 31,200MT and has saved a little.

This is Pedro's first loan in his life and with Hluvuku. He intends to purchase food and baby chicks given that to make a profit in this type of business necessitates a high number of chicks. Pedro's dream is to increase his business and have more chicken farms.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Pedro Adriano M. tem 38 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Marracuene Provincia do Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre os 15 anos e 6 meses. Os 3 já vão a escola. Para alem da sua família tambem sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro para eles. Pedro M. estudou até 9ªclasse e deixou por situação financeira da família. Pedro saiu do distrito que nasceu junto com a família quando o pai foi transferido pelos serviços de Marracuene para Boane em 1977.vive numa casa propria em Boane. Pedro é criador de galinha de corte desde 1992 e possui um pequeno aviário, onde faz trabalhos das 6:00h até 18:00h. Tem dois empregados sendo uma senhora e um rapaz. Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade vendo amigos na zona desde 1992. Actividade decorre bem apesar ter custos altissimos de Ração e também o transporte uma que as compra são feitas na cidade deMaputo que dista e 30 km. Vende o frango por 80,00mt cada, onde consegue vender por dia 30 frangos. Tem, receita mensal de 31200,00mt e tem poupado algum. Para Pedro este é o primeiro empréstimo na vida e na Hluvuku. Qual destinara para compra de ração e pintos. Dado que para rentabilizar este tipo de negocio é preciso um numero elevado de pintos. Constitui grande sonho para Pedro ampliar cada vez mais a sua actividade ter mais aviarios.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in undergarments in order to start a small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to resell in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey L. is 32 years old and married without any children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells and repairs refrigerators and air conditioners. He learned this business in 5 years, and he started his own business in 2000. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years. He needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more parts for refrigerators and air conditioners for repairs and sale. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand refrigerators and air conditioners

loans.name: Akhere

texts.en: Akhere O. is 31 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City. Akhere sells second-hand refrigerators. He learned this business in 5 years and started his own business in 2000. He has been a LAPO client for the past 5 years. He needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more second-hand refrigerators for sale. He says thank you.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand refrigerators for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City. Florence sells drinks and cooked food. She learned this business in 6 months. She started her own business in 2007. She is a LAPO client. Florence is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Enogionmwan

texts.en: Enogionmwan I. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City. She started this business of selling female clothes in 2003. She learned this business by herself. Enogionmwan is a LAPO client. She is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more female clothes, shoes, and wrappers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes, shoes, and wrappers for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She learned this business of selling beef in 6 months. She started her own beef business in 2003. She is a LAPO client. Josephine needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more beef for sale.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 49 years old and married with 8 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells and designs clothes for the people in her community. Margaret trained for 4 years in designing clothes. She has been in this business for years. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nnaecheta

texts.en: Nnaecheta C. C. is 33 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City with his family. C. sells timber. He learned this business in 9 years, and he started his own timber business in 2000. He is a LAPO client. He is requesting the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Toghanro

texts.en: Toghanro L. is 38 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City with her family. Toghanro sells timber. She learned this business in 3 years, and she started her own business in 1992. She has been a LAPO client for 5 years now, and she is requesting the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy timber for sale

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen A. is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells videos and audio CDs. She learned this business in 1 year and 8 months. She started her own business in 2000. She is a LAPO client. Amen is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more videos and audio CDs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more videos and audio CDs for sale

loans.name: Osarienmen

texts.en: Osarienmen E. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She travels to Lagos and the Asaba main market to buy clothes and sells them to her customers in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more female clothes for sale. Osarienmen is a LAPO client. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City with her husband and children. Elizabeth sells cooked foods and drinks. She has been in this business since 1978. She learned how to cook from her mother. She needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more foodstuffs for cooking and for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking and for sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity I. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family, where she sells drinks to the people in her community. She learned this business in 6 months and has been in this business since 2007. Charity needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale to meet the demands of her customers. Charity is a LAPO client. She says thank you to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City where she sells second-hand shoes to people in her community. Gladys learned this business for 2 years.  She started her own business in 1995. Gladys needs the loan amount of $1, 200 to buy more second-hand shoes for sale and also to meet the demands of her customers. Gladys is a LAPO client. She says 'thank you' to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand shoes for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives with her family in Benin City. She sells second-hand clothes in one of the major markets in Benin City. She learned this business for a year. She started her own business in 2000. Esther is requesting the loan amount of $1, 200 to buy more second-hand clothes for sale and expand her business. She says 'Thank you'.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing C. is 35 years old and she is single. She lives in Benin City. She has been in this business of selling second hand clothes since 2003. She enjoys doing this business.  She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of $1, 050 to buy more second hand clothes for sales. She is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Lizzy I. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City. Lizzy learned this restaurant business for 12 months. She has been in this business since 1983. She needs the loan amount of $1, 200 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. Lizzy is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Kudiratu O. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City with her husband and children. Kudiratu has been in this business of selling provisions and drinks since 1978. She learned this business for a year from her mother. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. Kudiratu is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo lives on “B” street in the Villa Adela zone of the city of El Alto.

He lives with his wife Fabiola in his parents’ house.

He dedicates himself to selling printed goods such as wedding announcements and invitations that he sells from his rented store located in a central part of the city.

The loan would be to purchase additional merchandise (invitations, announcements) to supply his store and be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynaldo, vive en la calle “B” de la zona de Villa Adela de ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa Fabiola en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica al comercio de trabajos de imprenta, partes matrimoniales e invitaciones, los cuales los expone y vende en su tienda que posee en alquiler en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería (invitaciones, partes matrimoniales, etc.), para surtir su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as invitations, wedding announcements, cards, etc., to sell in his store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris is a young mother who lives with her relatives in a house located in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a tailor in Brazil.

She has a one-year-old daughter.

Iris dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products of various brands, for which she earns commissions for her subsistence.

The loan would be for the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can try to increase her income and improve the quality of life for herself and her daughter.

This is the first loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Iris es una joven madre la cual vive en casa de sus familiares, ubicada en la Avenida Unión Fátima de la zona Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto, su esposo trabajo como costurero en la republica del Brasil. Tiene una hija de un año. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diferentes marcas, por los cuales obtiene comisiones que le alcanzan para su subsistencia. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería y así tratar de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y de ella. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación presentada la califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise related to beauty products and perfumes, for her business selling these types of items.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana dedicates herself to raising cows, from which she then sells the milk at the PIL Andina milk plant.

She lives in the Huancollo community in the Tihuanacu section, about three hours from the city of La Paz.

She lives with her husband who works as an employee in the mayor’s office of the region. She has four children, ages 11, 10, 8 and 6, respectively.

The loan would be used to purchase a milk cow of better quality so she can increase her milk production, therefore her sales and income.

This is her first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Valeriana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive., vive en la comunidad Huancollo del sector de Tihuanacu provincia Ingavi a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la alcaldía del sector, tiene 4 hijos de 11,10,8,6 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow to increase her production and therefore her sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena A. is married. She lives in Belaya Tserkov where she sells office supplies in a favourable downtown location. Yelena has been in business for 6 years, and she offers quality service that attracts many customers. Her current monthly income is about $1000. 

Yelena is looking for an express loan that will be paid back in two months. Additional merchandise purchased with this loan along with Yelena's good character and strong business skills will allow her to expand and strengthen her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yulya N. a cheerful business-woman who is married with a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in Stryi where she sells flowers and plants at affordable prices. Her nicely decorated store is located next to a city market. Yulya's mother helped her launch her business about 3 months ago, and her current gross income is about $1600 a month. She has about $3000 in inventory. 
Yulya is seeking a loan so that she can purchase decorations for her flower bouquets and accessories for her flower store. Yulya hopes that this loan, combined with her creativity and good taste, will allow her to expand her business. She hopes to use some of the profit to purchase furniture for her home. Yulya has excellent references from other entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and decorations for flower bouquets

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando dedicates himself to raising cattle, from which he then sells the milk at the PIL Andina milk plant.

He lives in the Huancollo community in the Tihuanacu section, about three hours from the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife and two children, ages 3 and 1, respectively.

The loan would be used to purchase a milk cow of better quality. With this purchase, he plans to improve his income levels and have the opportunity to increase the volume of his milk production and sales to PIL Andina.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rolando se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive. en la comunidad Huancollo del sector de Tihuanacu provincia Ingavi a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada. De esta forma planea mejorar su nivel de ingresos al tener la posibilidad de aumentar su volumen de producción de leche y venderla a PIL Andina. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow to increase his milk production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina lives in the Topater zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her three children, ages 11, 9 and 3, respectively.

She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of used clothing at the different markets of the city. Her husband works in construction in the Cochabamba area.

The loan would be used for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, nails and other items that she will use to make repairs to the roof of her house which is in very poor condition and threatens to crumble in high winds.

This is her first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina vive en la avenida Calle 1 de la zona Topater, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11,9 y 3 años respectivamente. Se dedica a la compra - venta de ropa usada en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como albañil en el departamento de Cochabamba. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de construcción, como calamina, clavos y otros, los cuales empleara en la refacción de los techos de su vivienda que están en malas condiciones y que por los fuertes vientos corre el peligro de derrumbarse. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, nails and other materials to fix the roof of her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela raises cattle for a living. She sells the milk the cattle produce to the Industrialized Milk Plan. She lives in the Ninachiri community of Laja, a part of the Los Andes province, about three hours from the capital city La Paz. Graciela lives together with her husband a four children who range in age from 20-13 years old. Her husband works as a long distance trucker.

The requested loan will be used to purchase an additional high-breed milk cow in order to increase her home’s milk production and thus increase her income. This is the first loan Graciela has requested from IMPRO, but the evaluation completed by IMPRO has approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la comunidad Ninachiri de sector de Laja provincia Los Andes a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como transportista de larga distancia, y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 14 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar su producción de leche, lo cual le dará posibilidades reales de aumentar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order increase milk production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz lives on Mirador street in Ventilla, a semi urban zone of El Alto. Due to family issues she separated from her husband and currently lives alone. Her husband lives with and supports the children.

Beatriz sells leather and hides from cattle and goats along the border with Peru. She works in this area because prices are higher. The requested loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise (hides). The market is stable, but the demand for the goods currently exceeds her supplies so she will surely increase her sales.

This is the seventh loan that Beatriz has requested from IMPRO. She has been a client since 2004 and has a good credit history. The evaluation completed by IMPRO approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, vive en la calle Mirador de la zona de Ventilla, zona peri urbana de ciudad de El Alto. Actualmente vive sola ya que por razones familiares se separo de su esposo quien se encarga de sus hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de cueros de vaca y chivos en la frontera con Perú, ya que su precio es más elevado en dicho sector. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería ( cueros de vaca y chivo) pues indica que la demanda por dichos productos excede su oferta actual y el mercado está asegurado y que definitivamente mejorarán sus ingresos. Es el séptimo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito. Beatriz es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Purchase of additional cattle and goat hides to sell along the Peruvian border.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kadia M

texts.fr:
Kadia T. is 38 years old, married with 1 child in her care, and has been a member of the village back of Peyrissac for 3 years. Her business consists of buying thioub cloth (thioub damask from Mali) and shoes and re-selling them in Ziguinchor. The income drawn from her business will allow her to participate in the family expenses and medical costs. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Kadia T., 38 ans, mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus thioub (thioub bazin du Mali) et des chaussures et revendre à Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell dyed cloth and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flor María needs a 2000 soles loan to buy rice, sugar, vermicelli and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou C. is 31 years old, married with 2 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for 7 years. Her business consists of buying sheets and dresses and re-selling them in Ziguinchor. The income drawn from her business allows her to participate in the family expenses and medical costs. She is asking for a loan which will be repaid at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou C., 31 ans, mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des draps et des robes et revendre à Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell dresses and sheets

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr:
Sira F. is married with three children and is a member of the Peyrissac village bank. She has already received and easily repaid eight loans. Sira would like to buy palm oil, cans and a bottle of gas for her business. She would like to develop her business to better help take care of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Sira F., mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 8 prêts remboursés sans difficultés. Sira veut acheter de l’huile de palme, des bidons et une bouteille de gaz pour son commerce. Elle veut renforcer son activité pour mieux aider à entretenir sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa B., 46, is married and has been a member of the Peyrissac village bank for five years. She would like to develop her business of selling fresh fish. Awa buys barrels of large and small fish and sells them wholesale and retail wholesale at the market in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps pay for her family’s expenses and health care. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Awa B., 46 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 5 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de poissons frais. Awa achète des bassines de gros poissons et des poissons de friture et vend en gros et demi gros sur le marché de Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old, hard-working mother of two, resident of Temeke in Dar Es Salaam city. She is a poultry farmer, a business she has been doing for the past five years, and that has grown tremendously ever since then. She keeps both layers and broilers.

She is in need of a loan to help her further expand her poultry business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Astimah

texts.en:
Astimah is a 32-year-old businesswoman, running a shop in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam's busiest trading area. She sells brightly-colored, traditional cloth commonly called kanga, that women frequently wear.

Astimah is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: expand business

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with 2 grown children.She lives in Simferopol. Her husband is retired and Natalya's women's clothing business is the only source of income for the family. She has been in business for 8 years and has good taste. She buys only the best quality merchandise from wholesalers. 

Natalya has over $14000 invested in merchandise. She is requesting a loan to pay the kiosk rent. The profits made because of this loan will be put toward building a new store at the same marketplace and remodeling her apartment.

loans.use: To pay the rent

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
Khadidiatou C., 23, is a single mother of one child and has been a member of the Boucotte Est village bank for three years. She buys fish in Ziguinchor and then sells it in Dakar. On her way back from Dakar, she brings clothing and shoes with her to sell in Ziguinchor. Khadidiatou would like to develop her business so she can improve her family’s quality of life and pay all of her expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Khadidiatou C., 23 ans, célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Est depuis 3 ans. Elle achète du poisson à Ziguinchor et va le vendre à Dakar. En revenant de Dakar, elle va ramener des habits et chaussures pour les revendre à Ziguinchor. Khadidiatou veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et se prendre entièrement en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of fish and clothing

loans.name: Rokhyatou

texts.fr:
Rokhyatou D., 40, is a widowed mother of six and is the president of the Kaguitte residents’ village bank. She has a lot of experience in her line of work, which consists of buying cloth (for sheets and outfits) and products to dye them and then selling them. She is very energetic and is well-respected within her group. The income she earns allows her to pay her family members’ daily expenses and improve their quality of life. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Rokhyatou D., 40 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est présidente du banc villageois des Ressortissantes de Kaguitte. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son activité qui consiste à acheter des tissus (pour draps et ensembles) et des produits, faire la teinture et vendre. C’est une femme dynamique et très respectée au sein de son groupe. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and dying products

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar belongs to the Valiant Women Communal Bank located on Jr Sáenz Peña 318 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 57 years old and the mother of three. Her income didn't cover her daily expenses, so she decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos in a business selling food and cold drinks. Currently, she has a restaurant. She gets up at 7 am every morning to prepare breakfast for her children, then she begins preparing the meals that she sells from 11am until 3pm with the help of her children. With this loan of $375.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, condiments, meats, etc. Pilar hopes that her business continues to grow so that her income increases and she can provide for her children in the future. She is very happy for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Pilar pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Sáenz Peña 318, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 3 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos no le alcanzan, es así que Pilar con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas heladas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, de ahí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas que los vende a partir de las 11 am. hasta las 3 pm. junto con la ayuda de sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, condimentos, carmes, etc. Pilar desea que su negocio siga creciendo para que sus ganancias aumenten y así pueda darles todo lo que necesitan a sus hijos en el futuro. Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de préstamo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Ms. Martha G. makes cakes and sells them at an educational center in Managua. She has been in the baking business for 7 years, despite the fact that not all seasons are favorable for her, which is why she had to look for an alternative; she now sells clothing for a living as well.

A neighbor showed her how to prepare cakes that the students enjoy. She would like to keep learning more about how to improve the quality of her products. With this loan, she will purchase the ingredients needed for baking cakes, thus boosting sales and consequently her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha G. se dedica a la pastelería y vende sus productos en un centro escolar de Managua. Desde hace 7 años se dedica al oficio de la pastelería aunque no todas las temporadas son buenas, es por eso que buscó una nueva alternativa y ahora se dedica también a la venta de ropa.

Una vecina amiga de ella fue quien le enseñó a preparar la repostería tan gustada por los alumnos. Desea seguir aprendiendo mucho más para poder mejorar la calidad del producto que ofrece. Con el préstamo comprará materia prima para elaborar más repostería y así aumentar su nivel de ventas y por ende sus ganacias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cakes to sell in her snack bar

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nelly Victoria

texts.es:
Nelly belongs to the Valient Women Communal Bank located on Jr La Habana Mz G Lt 6 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 68 years old and the mother of nine. Since her income did not cover her expenses, she invested her first loan from Manuela Ramos in a secondhand clothing business. She gets up at 7am to prepare lunch for her children, and later she sells her clothing until 5pm. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy secondhand clothing for women, men, and children. Despite her age, Nelly continues moving her business forward, struggling tirelessly despite the difficulties. She will not give up and will keep moving ahead with her family. She is very happy for the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr La Habana Mz G Lt 6, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 años y es madre de 9 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos no le alcanzan para sus gastos, es así que Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de ropas usadas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropas usadas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dedica a la venta de sus prendas de vestir hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro ropas usadas para damas, caballeros y niños. Nelly a pesar de su edad aun sigue saliendo adelante con su propio trabajo, luchando incansablemente a pesar de las dificultades, ella no se rinde y sigue adelante con su familia, se siente muy feliz por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Compra de prendas de vestir de segunda mano.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yamileth A. lives in Managua’s Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, an area known to be one of the poorest in the city that lacks basic services. Yamileth is married and has 3 school age children. Her husband works as a railroad engineer, and as a result, he is away from home most of the time. He was the one who supported his wife in starting a clothing business ten years ago in order to increase the family income.

Over the years, Yamileth has also gotten involved in cosmetics sales. The family’s living conditions have improved little by little. They have been able to invest in their house, and they would like to be able to do so until finishing it completely. Yamileth would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase the materials needed to start putting up bricks in her house, thus continuing to improve her dwelling and achieve her goal of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yamileth A. habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, un barrio caracterizado por ser uno de los más pobres de managua, con bastante escases de los servicios básicos. Yamileth es casada, tiene tres hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. El esposo de Doña Yamileth se desempeña como conductor de furgones y la mayoría del tiempo se encuentra fuera de su casa. Fue él quien hace diez años apoyó a su esposa para que ella iniciara un negocio de venta de ropa, para así obtener mayores ingresos en la familia.

A través de estos años Yamileth también ha incursionado en la venta de cosméticos.El nivel de vida de esta familia ha crecido de poco en poco, han podido ir inviertiendo en su casa de habitación, y desean poder hacerlo hasta verla totalmente finalizada. El motivo del préstamo de Yamileth es comprar materiales para comenzar a poner ladrillos en su casa de habitación y así poder seguir con este crecimiento para poder llegar a su meta de mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase bricks for her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
Maria Andrea is a 37-year-old woman who works as a housekeeper. She is a single mother who has always had to watch over her 3 children all on her own. She now only looks after 2 school age children, whom she hopes to help so that they can finish their studies and become decent men.
