Therefore, T. is asking for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland to expand his crops, and to purchase fertilizer. The loan will allow him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to expand his crops, and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia S. is a 50-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation/farming business, and she proudly works hard at her profession. As a result, she sells her crops to the village people and to the public at large 3 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 350 Tala ($145 USD).

As a matter of fact, SPBD loans are Rosalia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her kids' education, while the rest of the loan proceeds will be used for general business purposes.

loans.name: Leuta

In practice, she sells her products to the public and village people 3 days per week, which normally generates a positive weekly net cash flow of approximately 400 Tala ($166 USD).

She has received 1 previous loan from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Leuta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase equipment to improve her operations on the plantation and to commence the ice cake business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her operations by purchasing equipment for her plantation and by beginning an ice cake business

loans.name: Elisa Farani

She has 2 years of experience in the plantation/farming business, and she is proud to say that she does all of the farming on her plantation. As a result, she sells her crops to the public and village people 3 days per week. Typically, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 500 Tala ($208 USD).

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $525, all of which will be used to improve and expand her business by purchasing equipment.

loans.use: To expand and improve her plantation's business by purchasing equipment

loans.name: Tuulima

texts.en:
Tuulima T. is a 49-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation/farming business, and she is proud to say that she does all of the farming on her plantation. As a result, she sells her crops to the village people and to the public at large 3 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 400 Tala ($166 USD).

Tuulima has received 1 previous loan from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Tuulima’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her kids' education, and the rest will be used for general business purposes.

loans.use: To purchase necessary goods for business purposes and to pay for her childrens' education

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa T., 40, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells food to the villagers and school children 5 days a week. She has received 2 previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

He wants to expand his business to increase his income because of his increasing cost of living. He is asking for a loan to purchase more rice to make wine; he will use the remainder of the loan to purchase pig food.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to make wine and to purchase pig food

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID number: 03040001), 54 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to invest in her food shop. Her husband and her 2 children are both working, earning about 200 USD/month. Her income from the food shop together with the stable contribution of her husband and two children have made repaying not very problematic for her. Her family wants to borrow money so that they can better their life, and to expand the workshop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID number: 03040004), 29 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to sell rice.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Minh (ID number: 03040006), 30 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to invest in her fruit shop.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Huong (ID number: 03040005), 37 years old, wants to borrow 75 USD to breed animals.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Mai (ID number: 03040002), 37 years old, wants to borrow 265 USD to breed chickens.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Nguyễn Thị Hướng, 54 tuổi(Ms03040001), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng ăn uống.Chồng và hai con cô đều đi làm có thu nhập bình quân khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.Thu nhập từ cửa hàng ăn uống và lương ổn định của chồng và hai con giúp cô trang trải cuộc sống nên gia đình cô không gặp khó khăn gì khi hoàn trả vốn. Gia đình luôn mong muốn vay vốn tạo thu nhập để cuộc sống sung túc hơn, đồng thời vay vốn để mở rộng cửa hàng để người thân không phải đi làm thuê bên ngoài. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 29 tuổi(Ms 03040004), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để kinh doanh gạo. Hà Thị Minh, 30 tuổi(Ms 03040006), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán hoa quả. Nguyễn Thị Lợi, 44 tuổi (Ms 03040007), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt. C. Thị Hương, 37 tuổi (Ms03040005), mức vay: 1.060.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Nguyễn Thị Mai, 37 tuổi (Ms 03040002), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Koeurn M. is a subsistence farmer in Suo Sdey (Hello) Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 39-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Although the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Koeurn M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her profit to start a cow breeding business so that she can improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Mekhman

texts.en: Mekhman M. is a 48-year-old man who sells house slippers, sport slippers and socks in the local Sabirabad bazaar. He started his business in 1990. He is married and has 4 children. He lives in a small village and every day he commutes to Sabirabad. He works as a teacher in his local village school but his salary as a teacher is very low. His main source of income is from his business. Mekhman has applied for a loan of $1200. He will use the loan to purchase different types of shoes.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mr. Ry P. and his wife, Mrs. Khun Chaem, are farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have five children, two of whom assist their parents in the fields while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

One of Mr. Ry P.’s children is going to organize his engagement ceremony; unfortunately, Mr. Ry P. does not have enough money to celebrate this occasion, which is very important in Cambodian culture. Therefore, Mr. Ry P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. In the past, Mr. Ry P. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a buffalo for breeding. Mr. Ry P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To organize an engagement ceremony which is very important in Cambodian culture

loans.name: Han

He lives with his brother in Beung Veal Village, Pursat Province. He wants to expand his business to increase his income, so he is asking for a loan to purchase two buffalos to use for his business. The loan will allow him to improve his income and living conditions. In the future he will take another loan to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalos to use for his business

texts.en:

For five years, Mrs Somaly and her sister have been reselling vegetables purchased at Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh.
To this point she has been renting, but now is requesting a loan of $500 to add to her own money to purchase a shop from which to sell the vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a shop for selling vegetables.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur S. is a 27-year-old man who has been selling tableware, vacuum cleaners, irons and other products in the small village of Sabirabad since 2000. Most of his customers are brides and recently-married people. This kind of store is very popular in Azerbaijan. Seymur would like to expand his business so he has applied for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Mrs. Dara S., 47, and her husband, Mr. Socheat Ung, 52, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, while two others have full time employment and one is in local school. The remaining two children weave silk at home.

Mrs. Dara has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Socheat has been a policeman for the same amount of time. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Mrs Dara is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her family’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif Z. is a 45-year-old man who sells women's clothing in the local Sabirabad bazaar. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He has applied for a loan of $1000 to purchase more inventory in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Alizadeh

Alizadeh has applied for a $1000 loan to expand his business and purchase more fruit and vegetables for sale. Fruit and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. Expanding his business will help him to increase his income.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Miss Sitha L., 33, is single and lives with her elderly parents and one sister on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her sister has full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Miss Sitha has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S., 40, and his wife, Mrs. San Moe, 56, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 1989 and have two children who are in school.

Mr. Heng has been a carpenter in a factory for 17 years, while Mrs. San has been a garment factory worker for nine years. Currently the couple is in the process of building their house, and Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to aid in that construction and make a drain pipe for the house.

loans.use: To help build his house and make a drain pipe.

loans.name: Puthy

Mr. Puthy S., who is single and lives with his widowed mother, has been a secondary school teacher for five years, having begun his career immediately upon completion of his studies. He has six brothers and sisters, three of whom are garment factory workers, while one sister is in local school. His mother grows rice in the village.

The family lives live along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, where Mr. Puthy and his mother are now in the process of repairing their house. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 to complete those repairs.

He works as a teacher in the local school but his main source of income is electronic goods sales. He has applied for a loan of $800 to repair his store and improve the condition of it.

loans.use: To improve the condition of his store

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mon S. (his wife is shown in the picture on the right) was selected to be a group leader of two families for a loan from Maxima. All of the group members live along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Mon S., 52, (not in the picture) and his wife, Mrs. Hoy Him, 51, were married in 1973 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Three of their children have full time employment and two are in school. Mon has been a Motor Remoque Taxi driver for six years, and his wife stays at home taking care of the children. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one.

2-Mrs. Chanthea N., 40, (shown in the picture on the left) and her husband, Mr. Sam-aun Pol, 44, were married in 1986 and have two daughters who are in school. Chanthea has been selling grocery items for four years, while Mr. Hoy has been a policeman since 1980. Chanthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for the motor taxi and expand the business of selling grocery items.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Mr. Hieng S., 36, is a tailor; his wife is a housewife as well as helping Mr. S..  They work and live with two children in Prolay Thom Village, Pursat Province. They both make about $5 per day and work hard every day, because they need income to support their family. S. serves all clients who live in his village and he can make pants and shirts to sell as well. Now S. asks for a loan to purchase more cloth stock to sew for sale. The loan will allow him to increase his family’s income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth stock to sew for sale.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Hout S. is a young marble carver; his father is a motorcycle taxi driver. They both live in Banteaydey Krom Village, Pursat Province. S. has been carving for five years and he makes around $5 per day. To grow his business, he needs a loan to purchase more marble to carve. The loan will allow him to expand his marble business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more marble to carve

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en: Ajdar is a therapeutist. He was born in 1954. This kind man lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has 3 children. He has been as therapeutist for 10 years. He enjoys his business, because he helps people to be in good health. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy an apparatus for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy an apparatus for improving his business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim D. is a farmer who lives with her husband in Trach Village, Kampong Thom Province. She has been farming for twenty-nine years and makes about $3 per day. She works hard every day because she is responsible for supporting her family, which includes four children. The cost of living is increasing, so day to day her family faces high expenses. To support the family sufficiently, her two daughters work as garment workers.  Their combined income is $4 per day. Every year D. rents buffalos to plow her farmland.  Now she wants to own buffalos to use personally. She is asking for a loan to purchase two buffalos to use for her farmland. The loan will allow her to eliminate the cost of renting other buffalos.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalos to use for her farmland

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mey S., 47, is a widowed farmer who sells vegetables that she grows behind her house. She has been farming for eighteen years and makes about $3 per day. She lives with four children in Dang Kea Village, Pursat Province. One of her daughters works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh City and her income helps Mrs. S. with the family’s expenses. Mrs. S. now asks for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a pig to raise.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a pig to raise

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en: Rizvan N. is a 58-year-old who sells food in the small village of Sabirabad. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has two sons. He has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz Z. is a 58-year-old man who sells vegetables in the small local bazaar of Sabirabad village. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. This is the only source of income for his family. It is just enough to cover basic family needs but not enough to expand his business. To improve his business and purchase more vegetables, he has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Hul L., 46, is widowed and raises ducks behind her house in Trapeang Prey Village, Siem Reap Province. She bought small ducks to raise and sells their eggs and meat as well. L. wants to expand her business to increase her family’s income, so she now is asking for a loan to purchase more ducks to raise. The loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en: Khafiz Z. is a 52-year-old man who raises cows. He started his business in 1991. He is married and has 4 children. They all live together in Sabirabad. Khafiz sells milk and yoghurt to the local milk factory and to the local people. These products are in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Khafiz applied for a loan to purchase two more cows at an estimated cost of $600 each. This will help him to sell more milk and will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Shamilaga

texts.en: Shamilaga S. is a 47-year-old farmer who breeds cows for meat production in the small village of Sabirabad. He started his business in 1995. He chose to run this business because meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday cuisine.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves at an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Samiq

texts.en: Samiq Q. is a 32-year-old trader who has kept a food store in the small village of Imishli since 1998. His shop is located in a very good place near to the road. In addition to locals, other people who pass his store while traveling to other villages come to buy something from his store. Now Samiq has applied for 1000 USD to expand the inventory of the products he sells.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim (her husband is pictured) was born in 1967. She has four children. The Muzaffarov family lives in the Khachmaz region. Her husband has been in the building material sales business for six years. Now they need a loan of $1,200 US to buy spare parts for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Awa Méta

texts.fr:
Awa Méta D., 72, is a widowed mother of six and has been a member of the Kadior village bank for seven years. She would like to develop her business, which consists of buying soap, lemons, salt and brooms and then reselling them. The income she earns from this business allows her to pay her family members’ daily expenses and improve their quality of life and health. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Awa Méta D., 72 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans. Elle veut poursuivre son activité qui consiste à acheter du savon, du citron, du sel et des balaies et revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of lemons, soap, salt and brooms

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en: Sadig live in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1960, is married, and has three children. He buys calves to fatten them for sale. He has been in this business for 12 years. Now Sadig needs a loan of $1,200 to buy four calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
Shahla is a 34-year-old woman. She previously received and repaid a share of a group loan which she invested in her husband’s flower-making business. Since he has had this business, Shahla has always helped her husband with making beautiful flowers and selling them. However, Shahla’s real profession is beautician. She has 20 years' experience in this field. Ms. Shahla has also received a certificate for this profession. She has applied for a loan and wants to open a beauty shop in her neighborhood.

Shahla has 5 children. One of her young daughters works with Shahla, helping her with the beauty parlor. With a bulk individual loan, Shahla wants to open a shop and hire two more workers for her salon. Shahla has a lot of customers at home. She believes that by having a shop outside her home, she will not only keep these customers but will also find new customers. She will also use the loan fund to purchase beauty material and cosmetics to complete her shop equipment.

Shalla lives in a rented house. One of her immediate goals for the near future is to make enough money to get a mortgage on a house and not pay thousands every month in rent. She is also confident that her work will go well and that she will be able to buy a car which she and her husband have dreamed of forever.

loans.use: To purchase beauty material and cosmetics to complete her shop equipment

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim (his brother is pictured) was born in 1967. He lives in Khachmaz region. He is married, has two children, and has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 US to buy four calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Targul

texts.en: Targul (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. She was born in 1969 and lives in Khachmaz town. This family sells blankets. Five years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of $1200 US to buy blankets for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy blankets

loans.name: Sokhanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhanthy E., 25, and her husband were married in 2007 and live with her mother, who grows rice in the village. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Sokhanthy has been working in a garment factory since 2000, and her husband is also a garment factory worker.. The family lives in a Khmer wooden house, but its staircase is old and broken. Now Sokhanthy is requesting a loan of $600 to build a new staircase.

loans.use: To build a staircase for her house.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin N., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sinat Em, 44, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school.

Mrs. Sophoin has been selling mangoes and making Pro Hok (Cambodian Cheese) for resale since 1993, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Sinat has been operating a motor taxi and selling mangoes for the same amount of time. Now Sophoin is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase mangoes on contract for the next season.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for the next season.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Bin Bou, 52, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is in the makeup business and also weaves with her parents, while the other three children are in local school.

Mrs. Phally and her husband have been silk weavers and in the makeup business for over 20 years. Phally sells her silk products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her makeup business is in demand for wedding ceremonies in the village and nearby communities. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for her family’s weaving business and to build a handrail for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build a handrail for her house.

loans.name: Khan Mohammad

texts.en:
Khan Mohammad is 56. He never went to school but he is quite smart and has considerable entrepreneurship skills. He is married and the father of 6 children. Khan has an auto spare parts shop. He’s been in this business for more than 3 decades. However, he did not own such a shop all the time but worked for others especially during a decade as a refugee in Iran. The household returned to Afghanistan a few years ago.

Khan has applied for an individual loan to expand his inventory for his auto spare parts shop. He initially invested 50,000 Afghani (about US$ 1,100) but just a few years after his return from Iran, his capital has grown by as much as six times. With this loan he is intending to purchase extra spare parts for his shop, parts which many customers demand but that he does not have on his shelves. The loan money will definitely, he believes, increase profitability for his venture.

One of Khan’s wishes in his life is to support his son’s dream of going to college outside Afghanistan, especially in the western countries. Khan believes that expanding his current business and enhancing his venture’s profitability will get him one step closer to that dream.

loans.use: To expand his inventory for his auto spare parts shop

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en: Nurana  was born in 1983. She is single and lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago she started a cafe and now needs a loan of $1200 US to buy necessary equipment for the cafe.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for a cafe

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz has worked in a printing house for 2 years. He was born in 1954. He lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married with 3 children. Now Chingiz needs a loan of $1,200 US to buy the necessary equipment for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for improving his business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema A. is 36-year-old mother of three, resident of Kitunda in Dar es Salaam. She runs a grocery, a business she has been doing for the past six years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Ruphi

texts.en: M., 37, is a resident of the Kitunda area in Dar Es Salaam. He runs a small shop selling fruits and vegetables. He grows some of the vegetables and buys others for resale. He has also started a poultry farm project so as to supplement on his income. He is in need of a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anyesi

texts.en: Anyesi is a resident of Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam. He runs a shop selling common traditional attire, called kanga and vitenge. He has two shops in Kitunda area and has plans to open more. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel O.  is resident of Kivule area in Kitunda area, Dar Es Salaam. He runs a retail shop selling household items and utensils. He also sells fruits and vegetables. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna M., is hard-working businesswoman, and a mother of three. She runs a small shop selling household items and utensils, a business she has been doing for two years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 27-year-old mother of 2, resident of Kitunda area in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a small restaurant in the area, which prepares all the most common meals: rice, beans, Ugali and fish. Many of her customers say she prepares the best meals of all the near by restaurants. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi L., aged 38, joined TYM Fund in 2003. Her family’s main business is to buy and sell coals and other necessities. Mrs. L. has invested all the loans from TYM Fund into her coal business, and thus it has been lucrative. The customer service Mrs. L. provides is excellent, drawing an increasing number of customers. For example, Mrs. L. used the loan to purchase automobile to transport coals when her customers demand. In addition to her coal business, Mrs. L. opens a retail store in her neighborhood, offering a diverse range of goods and necessities. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. In the next loan level, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 19.000.000 VND ($ 1,125.00) to invest into her retail store. Her family’s monthly income is 8.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Liên 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình chị là kinh doanh và buôn bán, hiện tại gia đình chị đang kinh doanh than đốt và cửa hàng tạp hóa, vay vốn của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vào hoạt động kinh doanh, công việc kinh doanh than đốt của gia đình chị rất phát triển, gia đình chị cung cấp dịch vụ rất tốt nên khách hàng đông, nhà chị đã đầu tư tiền mua ô tô khi khách hàng mua than của gia đình chị có nhu cầu vận chuyển thì gia đình chị có thể đáp ứng ngay được, ngoài bán than gia chị còn đầu tư một cửa hàng tạp hóa với nhiều mặt hàng đáp ứng được nhu cầu tại địa phương, chị có 3 con hiện các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào hoạt động kinh doanh bán hàng tạp hóa.

Thu nhập bình quân.8.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Investin business

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi N., aged 54, is a member of TYM Fund. She has been using the loans from TYM Fund to invest into the business of buying and selling poultries in the market. Mrs. N. also provides services for weddings, funerals and other religious events etc. Because Mrs. N. has many years of experience in this business, the numbers of customers keep increasing. Mrs. N. has three children, all of whom graduated from high school and are working with an average income between 2.000.000 VND and 3.000.000 VND. In the next loan level, Mrs. N. wishes to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($ 600) to invest into her business. Her family’s income is 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Nhạt 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương vay vốn gia đình chị đã lựa chọn hoạt động kinh doanh buôn bán gia cầm, mua gia cầm sống về giêt mổ bán tai chợ, ngoài việc bán tại chợ gia đình chị còn nhận phục vụ các gia đình có công việc như hiếu, hỷ, tết..... Trải qua nhiều năm trong nghề kinh doanh măt hàng này nên gia đình chị thu hút được lượng khách hàng rất đông, chị có 3 con đều học hết phổ thông trung học hiện nay các con chị đều có công ăn viêc làm ổn định, hàng tháng thu nhâp từ 2.000.000đ đến 3.000.000đ phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán giết mổ gia cầm.

Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi L., aged 44, joins TYM Fund so that she can take out a loan and invest it into breeding poultries including chickens and ducks. Mrs. L. has been using all the loans from TYM Fund very effectively, and thus making good profits. Before joining TYM Fund, it was an extremely rough time for Mrs. L. and her family. But since joining TYM Fund, her family’s income has become more stable than ever. They have been able to purchase motorbike, refrigerator and other necessary furniture. The quality of life has been improved as a result. Mrs. L. is currently breeding 100 ducks, 100 chickens, pigs. She has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently. The other two are still in school and lives with her. In the next loan level, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 10 millions VND ($ 600) to continue investing into poultries. Her family’s monthly income is 4.5 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị Luyến 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia cầm, loại gia cầm chăn nuôi là vịt, gà. Các vòng vốn đều được gia đình sử dụng hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao, lúc trưa tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị kinh tế còn khó khăn, đến nay kinh tế đã phát triển rõ dệt. Thu nhập từ dự án gia đình chị đã tích lũy mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị trong nhà như xe máy, tủ lạnh .....Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 100 vịt thịt và 100 gà thịt, ngoài ra chị vẫn chăn nuôi lợn, chị có 3 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 2 con hiện đang sông cùng chị và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia cầm. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 33 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2003 when she was only 28. When TYM Fund was expanded in her area, Mrs. T. and her husband decided to join T. Fund so that she could take out a loan to invest into her business- selling eggs. She is now T. regular supplier of eggs for ten restaurants. Besides selling eggs wholesale, Mrs. T. also sells them retail at her home. About 400 eggs from ducks and 300 eggs from chickens are sold daily, which generate a daily profit of 150.000 VND. Her family’s income thus has been relatively stable. Mrs. T. has two children, who are still in school. Both of them are very diligent and well-behaved, and thus are a source of motivation for their parents. In T. next loan level, Mrs. T. wishes to borrow 19 millions VND ($ 1,125.00) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s monthly income is 6 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. 33 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003 lúc đó chị con rất trẻ 28 tuổi. Khi Quỹ Tình Thương triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn, khi vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán trứng gia cầm, hiện nay chị đang giao cho 10 quán ăn thường xuyên, ngoài ra chị còn bán lẻ tại gia đình, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị bán 400 quả trúng vịt lộn và 300 quả trứng gà, thu nhập từ việc buôn bán mỗi ngày gia đình chị lãi 150.000đ. Kinh tế gia đình chị tương đối ổn định, 2 con chị đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học, các con chị ngoan và học giỏi đấy cũng chính là nguồn động viên anh chị trong làm ăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán trứng.

Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in food business

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi V., 59 years old, is a participant in the Fund. Her family borrowed money to do business in butchering chicken. On average, each day they sell 30kg of chicken. Because of the success of the business, they had to hire one worker to work for the family fulltime; each month they pay him a salary of 1,500,000 VND. Her husband is a retired veteran, with a stable monthly pension of 2,500,000 VND. Even though he has the pension, her husband is still very hardworking and helps the family by raising fish. The annual income from the fish business is 10,000,000 VND. With the various sources of income, her family’s finances are relatively good compared to people in the region. She has 3 children, 2 who are grown and live on their own, and 1 who is still young and goes to school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to invest in the butcher shop. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị V. 59 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị vay vốn buôn bán giết mổ gia cầm, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị bán 30kg gà thịt, do việc kinh doanh thuận lợi nên gia đình chị phải thuê 1 công nhân chuyên làm cho gia đình chị hàng tháng gia đình chị trả lương 1.500.000đ, chồng chị là cán bộ quân đội về hưu lương tháng ổn định 2.500.000đ, mặc dù có lương hưu nhưng chồng chị rất chịu khó vẫn luôn phụ giúp công việc gia đình chăn nuôi cá, hàng năm thu hoach từ thả cá là 10.000.000đ. Với nhiều nguồn thu như vậy nên kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc diện khá tại địa phương, chị có 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 1 con sống cùng gia đình và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị vay 15.000.000 đầu tư vào giết mổ gia cầm. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in butcher shop

loans.name: Thi Nga

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Nga, 38 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She sells breakfast foods to earn a living. As she lives in a busy town with high demand for breakfast foods, her average daily income reaches 100,000VND (about 6USD). Her husband is also a hardworking man who is willing to share the housework load with her. He works as a construction worker with frequent work so his monthly income is 2,000,000VND (about 128USD). In total, their family's average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 322USD). Since joining the Fund, their family's economy has been improving tremendously. Mrs. Nga has 2 school-going children. This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (600USD) to invest in selling breakfast foods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Nga 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, hoạt động kinh doanh của gia đình chị là chuyên bán hàng ăn sáng, với lợi thế gia đình chị sống tại thị trấn nên nhu cầu đời sống ở đây là rất cao, chị bán hàng ăn sáng bình quân mỗi ngày thu nhập 100.000đ, chồng chị là người chịu khó biết chia sẻ công việc gia đình cùng vợ, anh làm nghề thợ xây công việc đều đặn bình quân mỗi tháng thu nhập 2.000.000đ, từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị luôn đầu tư vốn có hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình phát triển, chị có 2 con hiện nay các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào bán hàng ăn sáng. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: selling breakfast foods

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 54 years old, joined the Fund in 2001. In the past 7 years of participation in the Fund, her family has experience much improvement in their finances and afford more conveniences. She was able to build houses for 3 of her children so each can live on their own. Two children still live at home with her and are attending school. In each round of funding, the family invested in farming fish. With the money invested they were able to have the fish pond right near their house so the business of tending to the fish was very favorable. Her husband is a hardworking person with an inquisitive mindset in the profession of raising seafood, so the family’s investment in raising fish always brings in a high income. In this round of funding the family is requesting 11,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising the fish. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month on average.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ năm 2001, chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 54 tuổi qua 7 năm tham gia vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi, mua sắm tiện nghi trong gia đình, xây dựng gia đình cho 3 con và đều làm cho mỗi con một dinh cơ ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng chị đều đi học, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi cá, với lợi thế gia đình chị có ao ngay tại nhà nên viêc chăn nuôi, chăm sóc rất thuận lợi, chồng chị là người chịu khó luôn học hỏi kinh nghiệm trong việc nuôi trồng thủy sản, vì vậy nên gia đình anh chị đầu tư vào ao cá luôn có thu nhập cao cho gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 11.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào nuôi cá. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising Fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Nguyen, 42 years old, joined the Fund in 2001.  Her family's main profession is working the farm and building milling machines.  When joining the fund, the family made plans to invest in raising livestock, and with the income from this business they built milling machines.  They then used the milling machines to process waste wheat and rice for the pigs, so the cost of feed is kept very low.  Each year, on average, the family produces about 500 kg of pigs.  Doing business involving the livestock operation fits the family very well, their finances are improving day by day.  She has 3 children, 2 who are still in school and 1 who is working and helping to support the family.  In this round of funding she and the family are requesting 16,000,000 to continue investing in livestock.  Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month. 
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tính 42 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001, nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và làm máy xay sát, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã bàn bạc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, với thuận lợi gia đình chị làm máy xay sát nên tân dụng được cám, tấm thừa vãi nên chi phí đầu tư thức ăn cho việc chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị là rất ít, hàng năm bình quân ra đình chi xuất khoảng 5 tạ lợn, kinh doanh kết hợp cùng với chăn nuôi đó chính là một cách làm ăn rất tốt với gia đình chị, kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, chị có 3 con, 2 con đang còn đi học, 1 con đang đã đi làm và có thu nhập phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in raising livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi H., 38 years old, although still relatively young, is an industrious and quick-minded woman. She is always looking for ways to improve her family’s finances. In 2001 she joined the Fund for the first time. With a small loan, she invested in raising livestock; in subsequent rounds she always successfully put the loan to good use and brought in a high income. From then, her family was able to save up an amount of money. Even though the money saved up was not very much, it was enough for the family to invest in opening a store specializing in selling rice. This item is one item that people truly cannot live without. Starting with the small store, the family has been able to expand the business to a larger operation. Since shifting focus to this venture, she has seen the family’s finances improve faster; both her children are able to go to school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Hậu 38 tuổi mặc dù tuổi đời còn trẻ nhưng là người phụ nữ năng động, nhanh nhẹn nên chị luôn tìm mọi cách làm ăn để nâng cao kinh tế gia đình. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm đầu với mức vốn còn nhỏ chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, qua các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều sử dụng hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao, từ đó chị và gia đình đã tích lũy được một lượng vốn tuy không nhiều những cũng đủ để gia đình chị đầu tư mở một cửa hàng chuyên mua bán thóc gạo, đây chính là lương thực không thể thiếu của con người, từ một cửa hàng nho nhỏ đến nay cửa hàng của gia đình chị đã có quy mô lớn hơn, từ khi chuyển hướng kinh doanh chị thấy kinh tế gia đình phát triển nhanh hơn, 2 con chị đều được đầu tư ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in rice store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 58 years old, joined the Fund in 2001. Her family’s situation is very unfortunate; her husband passed away, leaving her to raise their one child by herself. The child is now grown and live at home with Mrs. Nguyen. When she first joined the Fund, the family invested in livestock. In every round of funding the family used the money successfully and brought in a large income. Currently she is investing the funding in general store run out of her home, and it is truly a business venture that brings strong results with high incomes. In her town, there are very few people running general stores, so the majority of the townspeople buy goods from her family’s store. Although her family situation was in a very desperate state, thanks to her perseverance the family’s finances are now very much improved. In this round of funding she is requesting 18,000,000 VND to continue investing in the general store. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên 58 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 hoàn cảnh gia đình chị vất vả, chồng mất sớm một mình chị vất vả nuôi 1 con hiện nay con chị đã trưởng thành và chị đang sống cùng con, khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn cũng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, qua các vòng vốn gia đình chị đều sử dụng có hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao. Hiện nay chị đã đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh cửa hàng tạp hóa tại gia đình, đây chính là mô hình kinh doanh đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, tại địa phương chị có rất ít người kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa vì vậy chủ yếu người dân tại địa phương đều mua hàng của gia đình chị. Măc dù hoàn cảnh vất vả như vậy nhưng với sự cố gắng của bản thân đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá hơn rât nhiều. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in grocery, general goods

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi K.. 54 years old, joined the TYM Fung since 2001. She always uses her borrowed money in the food shop. Because she is good at communication, and has a lot of experience in this business, she always has a lot of customers. Since being a member of the Fund, her business has been going very well. She is able to furnish her home. She has 3 children who are grown up. She and her husband is living with one of her children. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to invest more in her food shop. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị K. 54 tuổi, Tham gia Quỹ năm 2001, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào cửa hàng ăn uông, có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm bán hàng ăn, lại là người khéo léo trong giao tiếp nên cửa hàng ăn uống của gia đình chị luôn là địa chỉ của nhiều khách hàng, từ khi được tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ nên viêc kinh doanh của gia đình chị thuận tiện hơn kinh tế phát triển chị đã mua săm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị trong gia đình, chị có 3 con hiện đã trưởng thành, vợ chồng chị sống cùng 1 người con. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn uống. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in food shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi B., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. After 7 years of membership, she has borrowed money regularly and invested in breeding pigs. Af first, because of lack of experience, she only raised 2-3 pigs. Throughout the time, she learned more techniques and was ready to expand her breeding plant. She has 2 pigs that bear 4 farrows of pigs per year. She sells half of them and keep the other half to sell their meat. Every year, she releases 700 kg of pigs. She has 3 chidlren, 2 of whom are working and the last one is going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 900 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001 qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn đều đặn, sử dụng vào dự án chăn nuôi lợn, những vòng vốn đầu do chưa có kinh nghiệm về chăn nuôi nên gia đình chị chỉ nuôi nhỏ lẻ 2 đến 3 con, qua nhiều năm chị đã tích lũy được kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi, cùng với vòng vốn vay của Quỹ tăng cao gia đình chị đã mạnh giạn mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi, với 2 con lợn nái sinh sản cứ bình quân hàng năm có 4 lứa lợn bột, gia đình chị bán một nửa và một nửa để lại nuôi lợn thịt, bình quân 1 năm gia đình chị xuất 7 tạ lợn thịt, chị có 3 con, 2 con đã có công ăn việc làm ổn định, 1 con đang đi học. Vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 48 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. Similarly to many other people in the area, her chief activity is working on the rice field and breeding animals. Before joining the TYM Fund, she did not enough money and therefore, she just had a small farm. After becoming a member of the Fund, she expanded her animal-breeding farm, fixing the pigsties and other equipments. Her breeding activity has been going very well and every year, she releases 600 kg of pigs. She has been using the income to raise her 4 children, three of whom are working and the last one is going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to invest in breeding pigs and chickens. Her average income is 350 USD.month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhường 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Cũng giống bao chị em khác trong địa phương nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi, trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ do không có vốn nên viêc đầu tư chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ở mô hình nhỏ, khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn đầu tư nhiều hơn vào chăn nuôi, chuồng trại sửa sang thoáng mát nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi cho thu nhập cao bình quân mỗi năm chị xuât 6 tạ lợn. Từ những thu nhập đó chị đã có điều kiện kinh tế để nuôi day 4 con, các con chị đều rất ngoan, hiện nay 3 con chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập giúp gia đình, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising Pigs and chickens

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. After 7 years old membership, she has always used the borrowed money in breeding pigs and chickens. Being hardworking, beside working on the rice field, she always spends time on the animal-breeding projects. Because she has a large backyard, breeding chickens is very convenient for her. She usually releases about 200 chickens after 3 months and earns 1200 USD. She currently has 200 chickens and 4 pigs ready to be released. She has 3 children, two of whom are working and the last one is going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 775 USD to invest in her animal-breeding projects. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2001, chị Nguyễn Thị Lân 50 tuổi đã trải qua 7 năm vay vốn, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Là người phụ nữ chịu thương chịu khó nên ngoài việc làm ruộng ra chị luôn giành thời gian chăm sóc dự án chăn nuôi của gia đình, với thuận lợi có vườn rộng nên việc chăn nuôi gà của gia đình chị rất phát triển mỗi một lứa thường gia đình chị nuôi 200 con sau 3 tháng gia đình chị có thể xuất, thu nhập 1 lứa gà 20.000.000đ, hiện tại gia đình chị đang có 200 con gà và 4 con lơn đang chờ xuất, chị có 3 con, 2 con đã đi làm và có thu nhập, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 4500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., 55 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. Her husband passed away for quite a while; therefore, she was on her own to take care of the family. She is a hard-working woman. She raised her 3 children by herself. After joining the TYM Fund, she used the borrowed money in breeding chickens. Since she learns the experience from other people and vaccinate her chickens regularly, they are all free of diseases. Her activity has been going very well and helps improving her fmaily economy. She helps her children in building their own family. This time, she wants to borrow 1125 USD to invest more in breeding chickens. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Hà 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 chồng mất sớm nên mọi công việc gia đình đều đè năng lên đôi vai chị, bản chất là người phụ nữ chịu thương chịu khó, chị đã vượt qua bao khó khăn để nuôi 3 con lớn khôn trưởng thành, các con chị đều rất ngoan nghe lời chị nên chị phần nào cũng đã bớt đi những khó khăn, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi gà thịt, học hỏi kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi của bà con trong vùng nên các lứa gà gia đình chị nuôi ít khi bị mắc bệnh chị, thường có lịch tiêm phòng chống các dịch bệnh theo định kỳ. Vậy việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất phát triẻn, kinh tế khá lên rât nhiều, chị đã xây dựng gia đình cho các con chị. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.500.000đ/tháng.

loans.use: breed chickens

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba D. is 41 years old, divorced with three children and has been a member of the Peyrissac village bank for seven years. She buys her merchandise, such as thioub fabrics, shoes, and bags, in Dakar and sells them for cash or credit in Ziguinchor. Her business revenues allow her to help pay for the family’s health, food and school expenses. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Coumba D., 41 ans, divorcée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans. Elle achète de la marchandise à Dakar (tissus thioub, chaussures et sacs) et revend au comptant et à crédit à Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge des besoin de santé, d’alimentation et de scolarité de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Buy thioub fabrics, shoes, and purses to resell

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Pinolillo is a widely sold drink, typical of Nicaragua and known for its very good flavor. Rosa T. has for several years commercially sold powdered pinolillo, which is ready to be mixed with water and sugar. Her business is conducted through home sales and occasionally through travelling sales in the streets of Sandino City in Managua.

Rosa has sought the help of Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purpose of buying more product to sell. Emphasis is placed on the fact that both Rosa and the two small children she cares for will benefit greatly from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El pinolillo es una bebida muy comercializada por ser la bebida típica de Nicaragua ya que se distingue por ser de muy buen sabor. La señora Rosa T. se dedica desde hace varios años a comercializar el pinolillo en polvo listo para combinarlo con agua, azúcar y prepara la bebida. Este negocio lo ha venido realizando por medio de ventas en su casa de habitación y en ocasiones ambulantemente en las calles de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra del producto para comercializarlo. Es de necesidad destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tiene que mantener.

loans.use: Beverage sales (pinolillo)

loans.name: Idania

texts.es:
Mrs. Idania C. is a mother of four (three of her children are still studying).That is why she puts a great effort in her tortilla business, which she runs from her home in the Ciudad Sandino county in Managua.

She has come to Ceprodel in order to request a loan so that she can buy all the ingredients needed to make her delicious tortillas so that she can sell them from her home. She is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and has obtained 3 loans with them which she has timely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Idania C. es madre de cuatro pequeños hijos de los cuales tres de ellos se encuentran estudiando y por dicho motivo ella se esfuerza en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar la material prima para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas y así venderlas en su casa de habitación. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel por lo que ha obtenido tres créditos habiéndolos cancelado de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina A. has sold home cleaning products for two years, offering all types of products in many different scents. She is the mother of two small children, for whom she provides an education and makes sure all their needs are fulfilled.

Currently, Clementina is finding it necessary to invest in the purchase of more home cleaning products. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan with Kiva partner Ceprodel. She has been a faithful participant with the organization, and all of her previous loan proceeds were invested directly in her business of home cleaning product sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clementina A. desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a la labor de venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar ofreciendo todo tipo de productos y en todos los olores. Es madre de dos hijos pequeños los cuales les brinda su respectiva educación y vela para que no les haga falta nada.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los productos químicos de limpieza del hogar y para eso solicita un crédito en Ceprodel con el cual adquirir dichos productos. Es de necesidad destacar que ella se ha destacado por ser fiel cliente de la institución y todos los anteriores créditos han sido invertidos directamente en su negocio de venta de productos químicos de limpieza para el hogar.

loans.use:
Purchase of home cleaning products
Compra de los productos de limpieza del hogar

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr:
Nafissatou B. is 34 years old and single with two children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Est village bank for five years. She hopes to strengthen her catering business. She has a refreshment area on highway 54 in Ziguinchor, where she sells bottled and canned drinks, breakfast, and sandwiches and thiacry, a Senegalese dessert, for dinner. The refreshment area was converted and equipped for her old revenues. She would like to improve the living conditions for her family and pay for all of the expenses. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Nafissatou B., 34 ans, célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Est depuis 5 ans. Elle compte renforcer son activité de restauration. Elle dispose d’une buvette sur la 54 à Ziguinchor ou elle vend de la boisson(en bouteille et canette), le petit déjeuner et le diner (thiacry, sandwich). La buvette a été aménagé et équipé par ses revenus antérieurs et elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et se prendre entièrement en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Stocking the refreshment area so as to sell breakfast and dinner

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin N. is a native of Sandino City in the capital of Managua, Nicaragua. For several years, he has sold clothing in the city streets as a traveling vendor.

His business requires a high degree of effort, moving daily from one place to another, and exposed to direct sunlight. He undertakes these efforts with the objective of supporting his family, which consists of his young school-age daughter.

Marvin's reason for approaching Kiva field partner Ceprodel is to obtain a loan for the purchase of inventory. By doing so, he will be able to keep up his traveling sales and thereby improve his financial condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marvin N. es originario del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua. Desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa el cual la vende ambulantemente en las calles de su municipio.

Esta labor requiere de mucho trabajo por lo que se expone diariamente al traslado de un lugar a otro y además a la exposición al sol. Sin embargo estos múltiples esfuerzos los lleva a cabo con el propósito de mantener a su familia la cual esta compuesta por su pequeña hija en edad escolar.

El motivo por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito para la compra de su mercadería y así continuar vendiendo la ropa ambulantemente para mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use:
Purchase of clothing
Compra de la ropa

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra C. is wholeheartedly dedicated to her cosmetic sales business, which she operates from her home and sometimes through traveling sales in Sandino City in Managua, Nicaragua.

Alejandra is the mother of three children, for whom she looks after all matters of health, education, and feeding. As with all businesses in the developmental phase, her business requires investment in sales inventory (cosmetics). For this reason, she has sought the help of Ceprodel, a Kiva field partner, in obtaining a loan for her purchases. In this way, she will be able to maintain the condition of her home, offering her children the necessities which they require.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Alejandra C. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de cosméticos ofreciéndolos en su casa de habitación y en ocasiones ambulantemente en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Alejandra es madre de tres hijos los cuales tiene el deber de velar por su salud, educación y alimentación. Como todo negocio en desarrollo, hoy en día su negocio requiere la inversión en la compra de cosméticos para su venta. Por esta única razón es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para su respectiva compra y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar brindándoles las condiciones necesarias de vida a sus pequeños.

loans.use:
Purchase of cosmetics
Compra de los cosméticos

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie G. is 52 years old, married with three children, and a member of the Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar village bank. She would like to take out the loan in order to buy a freezer for her ice cream and juice business, which is doing very well. She also sells palm and lemon oil. Her revenues allow her to improve the living conditions for her family. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Marie G., 52 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter un congélateur pour son commerce de glace, de crèmes glaces et de jus qui marche bien. Elle s’active aussi dans la vente de l’huile de palme et du citron. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Buy a freezer, baobab, and roselle

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
Ana Espernaza Gutierrez is a native of Sandino City in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. After selling groceries for two years, she has realized a measure of success, diversifying her products and increasing sales.

Field partner Ceprodel has played an important role in developing local businesses and for this reason has offered Ana loans to develop her business. Today Ana is asking for a new loan to buy merchandise to re-stock the shelves with products that she has sold out of.

With this loan, Ana will increase her inventory and thus her sales of groceries, thereby improving her overall financial condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana Espernaza Gutierrez es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua capital de Nicaragua. Con dos años de haber iniciado su negocio de pulpería, ha logrado salir adelante diversificando sus productos e incrementando las ventas en el negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante en el desarrollo del negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos para su desarrollo. Hoy en día ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de su mercadería por lo que al estar agotándose le es necesario llenar sus estantes de productos.

Por medio de este crédito logrará mejorar su condicione económica ya que al incrementar sus inventarios también incrementan sus ventas en su negocio de pulpería.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise
Compra de mercadería

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna S., 54, is married and the mother of 6 children, three of whom are married daughters. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar for six and a half years. She wants to bolster her business by buying palm oil in Yarang and selling it in Ziguinchor. Maimouna is attempting to improve living conditions and the health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maimouna S., 54 ans mariée mère de 06 enfants dont 03 filles mariées est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant de l’huile de palme à Yarang pour le revendre à Ziguinchor. Maimouna cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying palm oil for re-sale

Acheter de l'huile de palme et revendre

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa Samaté, 38, is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar for three and a half years. She wants to start back up and bolster her businesses making and selling ready-to-wear (for children and adults) and selling groceries. She has two canteens and a stall in the open-air market of Grand Dakar. She has put sewing machines and a refrigerator in one of the canteens. In the other and in the stall she sells grocery items such as palm oil, honey, vegetables, etc. Awa wants to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Awa Samaté, 38 ans mariée, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut reprendre et renforcer ses activités de confection et vente de prêt à porter (pour enfants et adultes) et de produits alimentaires. Elle a deux cantines et un étal au marché de Grand Dakar. Elle a mis des machines à coudre et un réfrigérateur dans l’une des cantines et dans l’autre et l’étal sont vendus les produits alimentaires comme l’huile de palme, le miel, les légumes et autres. Awa cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase fabric for sewing clothing and groceries for re-sale

Acheter des tissus pour la confection des habits et des produits alimentaires et vendre

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.en:
Myrtha G. has established a small business selling rice, chicken, and fried plantains. Selling cooked meals from her home, she is able to provide affordable meals to her neighbors while watching over her two daughters (ages 3 yrs. & 3 months). Her short term goals are to continue expanding her business and clients with the loan that she will receive from Esperanza. Eventually, she would like to have a separate restaurant from her home. When she’s not working, Myrtha enjoys spending time with her daughters and going to the local church in the community of Barrio Haiti.

Myrtha G. is one of the coordinators of the 15 person micro-bank, Mujeres Divinas, which means “Divine Women”. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. Some of the other women in this particular bank make a living selling clothing, running small salons, and selling vegetables on the street. This Kiva loan will go towards the entire group and be divided among each member respectively to pay back.

On behalf of Myrtha, the Mujeres Divinas group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

A couple of the women's children as well as three of the Esperanza loan officers are pictured in the photo as well.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, chicken, and plantains for her in-house restaurant.

loans.name: Elsa Dora

texts.es:
Elsa Dora is a lady with lots of energy for her daily work, she is 54 years old and for the last 30 years she has been taking care of her own business, a store, set up at her home so she can support her children. Years have gone by and today she is living with two of her younger children who are still in school, and they are the reason for her effort. Elsa Dora started this business years ago traveling all over the city on a tricycle. Now she is happy because, for several years, she has had no need to leave her house and daily the nice customer service allows her to receive the economical income she needs to maintain her home. For that reason she requests a loan of 1000 soles ($375) to be invested in the purchase of merchandise, especially candy and sweets, for her store. Please support Elsa Dora to continue with her efforts for a noble cause: her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Elsa Dora es una mujer de mucha energía para trabajar diariamente, tiene 54 años de vida intensa, se dedica desde hace 30 años a su propio negocio, una tienda, que instaló en su casa para que ella pueda sostener a sus hijos. Los años han transcurrido y ella hoy está viviendo con dos de sus hijos menores que aún están estudiando, ellos son la razón actual de su esfuerzo. Elsa Dora se inicia en este negocio años atrás de manera ambulante, con un triciclo recorría todas las calles de la ciudad. Ahora está contenta porque desde hace varios años ella ya no tiene que salir de casa y cada día la esmerada atención que ofrece a sus clientes le permite los ingresos económicos que necesita para ser parte del sostenimiento de su hogar. Por ello que solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería para su tienda especialmente dulces y golosinas. Apoya a Elsa Dora a continuar adelante con sus esfuerzos por una noble causa: sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at general store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina sells different products such as sodas, juices, crackers, and sweets in her stand which is located in the Almirante Grau street in the area of San Pedro (La Paz). She is a single mother of two, and both her children are going to college (that is why they cannot economically help her at the moment, although Marina also does not want them to do it). Her home is located in the area of Miraflores (very far away from San Pedro).

This is the first credit that she is requesting with us and it requires your support. She will use the amount in order to buy products such as sodas, crackers, etc., which will allow her to reduce her costs, increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Marina se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, galletas y dulces en un kiosco ubicado en la calle Almirante Grau de la zona de San Pedro (La Paz), es madre soltera de dos hijos que asisten a la universidad (por el momento ellos no pueden ayudarla económicamente, Marina tampoco quiere que así sea). Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Miraflores (esta zona queda muy lejos de San Pedro) . Este es su primer crédito con nosotros y requiere su apoyo. El monto será destinado para la compra de insumos (refrescos, galletas, etc.), lo que le permitirá reducir sus costos, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy products for her business and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Marina makes embroidered wallets and crafts, as well as working as domestic help in the southern area of La Paz: she has three children who attend school. She was widowed 5 years ago.

Her home is located in the area of lower San Antonio, one of the most dangerous areas of the city due to the quantity of robberies and assaults: although the house is small and old, the rent is quite high.

This is the second credit she has received from IMPRO, but it will be the first time that Kiva has offered help. She will use the money as work capital and buy primary materials in order to drive forward her artesenal business (as even if she already has a stable employment as a domestic employee, se will be able to increase her income through developing this creative activity.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Marina elabora carteras con hilo y artesanías, igualmente, trabaja como empleada doméstica en la zona sur D. La Paz, tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela y es viuda desD. hace cinco años.

Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona D. San Antonio Bajo (una D. las laderas más peligrosas D. la ciudad pO. la cantidad D. robos y asaltos), aunque la casa es pequeña y vieja, los alquileres son bastante altos.

Este es su segundo crédito en Impro, pero será la primera vez que Kiva le brinD. su apoyo. Ella usará el dinero para capital D. trabajo y compra D. materia prima para impulsar su negocio D. artesanías (puesto que si bien tiene estabilidad como empleada doméstica, sus ingresos podrían ser mayores fomentando una actividad en la que es bastante creativa).

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is 39 years old, she did not have the opportunity of any schooling, she speaks Spanish and Aymará, is married and has four children in school. Her house is located in the “Barrio Central D. Villa Santa Rosa", District of Yunguyo. Previously for a living, she rented out a tractor in the sowing season for potatoes. She sold the tractor and now she buys and sells cars which she buys at the markets at Ilave and Juliaca and sells en Tacna and with the earnings she can cover the costs of her children’s studies. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Tupac Amaru”, her first loan was S/.300.00 new soles which were spent on buying two pigs and a sheep. With this loan of S/.3,000.00 ($1,075), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a taxi to be sold later to obtain a profit. Being a member of the “Banco Comunal” she learned to be responsible and punctual with her payments, and above all to work. Her dream is that her children study and become professionals and that she will be able to capitalize in the car business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina tiene 39 años D. edad, no pudo estudiar; habla el castellano y el aymará, es casada tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales todos estudian. Su casa esta ubicada en el Barrio Central D. Villa Santa Rosa, del Distrito D. Yunguyo. Anteriormente se dedicaba al servicio D. alquiler D. tractor en época D. sembrado D. papa. Vendió su tractor y se dedicó a la compra y venta D. carros que los adquiere en las Ferias D. Ilave y Juliaca, los mismos que venD. en Tacna, con esta ganancia podía cubrir los gastos D. estudios D. sus hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, su primer crédito fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compró dos chanchos y una oveja. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un taxi el cual será vendido posteriormente para obtener mayor ganancia. Estando en el Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, sobre todo a trabajar. El gran sueño que tiene es que sus hijos estudien, sean profesionales y poderse capitalizarse en el negocio D. carros.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to be sold to obtain a profit.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés is 44 years old. She studied until fourth graD., speaks Aymará and understands Spanish, she is married with ten children, two are married and seven are still in school. Her home is located in “Barrio Miraflores D. Villa Santa Rosa”, District of Yunguyo. For a living she breeds cows and pigs to be sold at the markets in Yunguyo. She has also been making llijllas, blankets, since she was very young. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Túpac Amaru” where her first loan of S/.300.00 new Soles were invested in buying two dozen colored synthetic wool for making the llijllas and she also bought a small pig. With this loan of S/.700.00 new Soles, ($250) to be repaid in 4 payments she will buy four dozen colored wool and two sheep. Her greatest wish is that her children continue studying and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Inés tiene 44 años D. edad, estudió hasta cuarto D. primaria, habla aymará y entienD. el castellano, es casada y tiene diez hijos, D. los cuales dos ya son casados y siete están estudiando. Su domicilio esta ubicada en Barrio Miraflores D. Villa Santa Rosa del Distrito D. Yunguyo. Ella se dedica a la crianza D. vacas y chanchos, que serán vendidos en las ferias D. Yunguyo. También elabora llijllas, frazadas, actividad a la que se dedica desD. muy pequeña. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, inició con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. dos docenas D. lana sintética D. colores para la elaboración D. llijllas y compró también un pequeño chanchito. Con este préstamo D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cuatro docenas D. lana D. color y dos ovejas. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es que sus hijos continúen estudiando y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase wool in large quantity and two sheep.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 55 years old, she did not have the opportunity to study, she speaks Aymará and understands little Spanish, she is married with six children, four are married and two in school. Her home is located in “Barrio Central de Villa Santa Rosa”, District of Yunguyo. For a living she buys and sells cows, sheep, and pigs. She buys at the markets in Huapaca, Chacachaca, and Yunguyo. After raising them they are sold at the same markets. She has been doing this since she was very young. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Túpac Amaru”, and with her first loan of S/.300.00 new Soles she bought three sheep.
