Viviane est à son troisième crédit et s’est toujours montrée crédible. Actuellement, elle n’arrive pas à répondre à la demande de ses clients qui ne cesse de s’accroître, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and 4 damask outfits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is not sufficient for Mary and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and so she is asking for additional capital to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Balikyewunya Women's Group

texts.en:
Mariam Nakazzi has been the chairperson of Balikyewunya women's group in Gayaza for six and a half years. She is single with six children and she cares for her sister who is in a tailoring school in Gayaza. Of her children, two are out of school and managing their own families while four are studying.

Mariam's business is selling used clothing including bed sheets, curtains and nets. She has done this for 15 years. She transacts her business by moving from one busy location to another to daily markets around her home area. She buys her stock in bales from Kampala once every week and business is good. People like secondhand clothes because they are unique and long lasting unlike new clothes. From one bale, on average Mariam makes a profit of $50 and sometimes more depending on the quality of the products. Mariam intends to use the loan to buy more bed sheets, curtains and nets for sale. Her dream is to one day open up an outlet in the trading centre so that she can sell from one place while she hires someone else to do the walking around with other stock. She believes this will increase her income, hence more profits.

Mariam will share this loan with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets, curtains and nets for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. business is selling cosmetics. She is married, and her husband works the University of Cape Coast. However, her husband's income is not sufficient for the needs of the family, which includes three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she would like to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a hard-working mother of two, resident of Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a shop selling soft drinks and freshly prepared juice and snacks in Lumo Market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is a businesswoman of Balikuddembe women's group in Lugazi. She is into the business of buying sacks of dry maize from all surrounding villages then taking them to the grain milling factory to make flour. After that, she sells the flour to shops at double price.

Josephine is married with nine children, seven of them still in school. She also looks after four grandchildren. Her husband is a farmer and together they would like to see their children grow into responsible citizens.

Josephine says the loans have been so helpful for the last five years that she has been with Pearl Microfinance. She has been able to educate her children and take care of her home as well as paying her workers on time (she has people who help her in her business).

Now she needs a loan to help her with buying more sacks of maize for her business. This time she is taking a small loan because of her health (she had an accident) and would not want to leave a lot of money with her workers; but she says with the next cycle, God willing, she will be able to take her usual amount of $1200 and above.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of maize.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is 35-year-old father of two, resident of Vituka area in Dar Es Salaam. He is a tailor and runs a tailoring shop. He has two sewing machines and one assistant. He wants to buy a new electronic machine and expand his business. He is in need of a loan to help him do this..

loans.use: Buy an electronic sewing machine

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi O., who is married and has three children, sells smoked fish. Unfortunaely, her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for the family. She wants additional capital to expand her business to meet the high demand for her goods and to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Gie Koffy Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young women living in the ecovillage of Loudia Ouolof.  We invest in the business of fishing products, such as dried fish, oysters and other preserved mollusks (smoked, salted), as well as the resale of fruits, depending on the season.  Our work consists in buying from fishers, women who preserve the fishing products, and farmers that sell their products in bulk, in order to resell these products in the big villages.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes qui habitent dans l'écovillage de Loudia Ouolof et qui s'investissent dans le commerce de produits halieutiques comme le poissons sec, les huîtres et autres mollusques transformées( fumés; salés) et aussi dans la revente des fruits selon les saisons. Notre travail consiste à l'achat chez les pêcheurs et les femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques  et aussi chez les agriculteurs qui revendent leur production en gros, pour aller les revendre dans les grandes villes.

loans.use: Buy and Sell Fish and Fruit Products

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Abena and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is asking for additional capital to expand her business and increase profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Fuente De Luz Group

texts.en:
Belkis S. is a 25-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five-year-old son in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small colmado, a store that sells staple foods and accessories, one year ago. She came to Esperanza because she lacked adequate capital to buy enough inventory for the store.  The money from this loan will go towards purchasing oil, rice, and flour to expand her inventory even further.  It is Belkis´ hope to continue to growing her business so that she will be able to help support her son and continue providing him with a good education.  She also said that it is her dream to buy a house for her family one day.

Belkis is the leader of the 10-person micro-bank group, Fuente D. Luz, which means `source of light´.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. 

On behalf of Belkis, the Fuente D. Luz group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, and flour for her store

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. is 43 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, she had a lot of difficulties in life because her husband passed away. In 1999, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in breeding animals. Later, she used the borrowed money to buy waste materials and resell them to wholesalers. This activity helps stabilizing her family economy. Being hardworking, she raised her 2 children on her own. She is currently invest in decorative plants to sell to local people and people from other towns. She wants to borrow 600 USD to buy more materials for her business. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Bích năm nay 43 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm. Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư các dự án phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi sau đó chị vay thêm vốn để đi mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc buôn bán phế liệu đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Là người phụ nữ chăm chỉ, chịu khó chị đã cố gắng làm ăn và nuôi được hai con khôn lớn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang đầu tư vào làm chậu trồng cây cảnh bán cho nhân dân địa phương và các vùng lân cận. Chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu phục vụ sản xuất. Thu nhập : 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy materials for business

loans.name: Konoba

texts.fr:
Konoba F. is married and raising 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Karsia for seven years. She wants to bolster her business by buying sugar, tea, matches, palm oil, smoked fish, Omo (detergent), etc. in the weekly markets and big stores to retail in Karsia. Konoba has transformed her storeroom into a little store where she sells general merchandise. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Konoba F., mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Karsia depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant du sucre, du thé, des allumettes, de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé, de l’Omo etc… au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires et des grandes boutiques pour revendre au détail à Karsia. Konoba a transformé son grenier en une petite boutique ou elle vend ses divers produits. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
purchase and resale of various products

achat et revente de produits divers.

loans.name: Hortencia Pedro

texts.pt:
Hortencia Pedro S. is a native of the province of Manica in the center of Mozambique. She is the mother of 2 daughters who are both adults and married. Right now Hortencia only supports 2 nephews who are 17 and 13 years old. She studied until the 10th grade and is currently attending the 11 grade in night school.

Hortencia moved from Manica with a transfer in the military service before she was married in 1978. She works in the military hospital in the city of Maputo and has a monthly salary of 3,500MT. She is able to save a little by the end of each month.

This is the second loan she has taken through Hluvuku. The first went to legalize her land, and this one is to initiate construction. She intends to pay back the loan before maturity so she can request another loan to continue with her work.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Hortencia Pedro S. é natural da provincia de Manica no centro de Moçambique, mae de duas filhas ambas já maior de idade e casadas, neste momento Dona Hortencia só sustenta dois sobrinhos com idade entre 17 anos e 13 anos. Hortencia estudou até 10ªclasse e neste momento frequenta 11ªclasse curso nocturno. Hortencia mudou se da Provincia de Manica por transferencia do serviço quando militar antes de se casar em 1978. Hostencia é funcionaria do hospital militar da cidade de Maputo. Tem um salario mensal de 3500,00mt e consegue poupar cada fim do mes. Este é o segundo empréstimo para Hortencia na Hluvuku, o primeiro foi para a legalização do terreno e este pretende iniciar com as construções. Assim hortencia pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para continuidade com a sua obra.

loans.use: To buy material to build family home

loans.name: Bocc Diom 1 Group

texts.fr:
With our first loan with Kiva, we were able to buy cattle and sheep, which we raised and fattened, allowing us to resell them in the weekly markets around the village of Mboul.  However, after benefiting from our first loan, we would like a second loan to continue with our business by increasing our capital and buying more cattle and sheep.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Aprés avoir bénéficié d'un premier prêt kiva qui nous a permis d'acheter des bovins et ovins que nous avons élévé en les engraissant, nous avons pu les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires situés aux alentours du village de Mboul. 
Cependant, nous souhaiterions être financés une deuxiéme fois pour pouvoir continuer nos activités en ayant un plus grand capital qui nous nous permettra d'acheter beaucoup de bovins et ovins.

loans.use: Raise cattle and sheep

loans.name: El Eden I Group

texts.en:
Evangelina L. P. (pictured on the far left) is a 33-year-old woman who lives in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She has a small boutique in her home where she sells clothing, shoes, and beauty products. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing hair products, perfume, makeup, and various blouses. Evangelina said that she hopes to continue to grow her business so that she will be able to help support, along with her husband, their three children (ages 15, 7, and 6) and continue providing them with a good education. It is her hoP. to save enough money so that she would be able to go to college one day to study accounting. In her free time, Evangelina enjoys reading, singing, and spending time with her family.

Evangelina is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, El Eden I. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. One of the other women in the group has a small salon, one prepares and sells food in the street, and the others sell clothing.

On behalf of Evangelina, the El Eden I group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy hair products, perfume, makeup, and clothing for her boutique

loans.name: Zene

texts.pt:
Zene A. is 26 years old and native to the province of Gorongosa in the center of Mozambique. He is the father of 2 children. Besides his children he also supports his mother and his brother sending money every month.

He is a student in the 11th grade and attends at night. He came to Maputo in 2003 to fulfill his military service. He is an employee for the Ministry of Defense.

He does not have his own home yet. This is the first loan with Hluvuku and his second one in his life. The first loan was through the International Bank of Mozambique for 18,000MT. He came to know Hluvuku through some colleagues who were already clients. His biggest dream is to have his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Zene A. tem 26 anos de idade é natural de Gorongosa provincia de Sofala no Centro de Moçambique. Pai de 2 filhos. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mae e seu irmao enviando dinheiro mensalmente. Zene A. é estudante frequentando 11ªClasse do curso nocturno. Veio a Maputo em 2003 para comprir os serviço militar sozinho na familia. É funcionario do ministerio da defesa. Ainda não tem casa própria. Este é o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku e segundo na vida, onde o primeiro foi no Banco Internacional de Moçambique no valor de 18000,00mt. Conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que já eram cliente. O maior sonho do senhor Zené é ter sua própria casa.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Isabel Jamisse

texts.pt:
Isabel Jamisse M. is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children with ages of 25, 22, 16, and 12. The oldest is already together with someone and lives in her home. Isabel studied until the 12th grade and stopped going when her husband passed away. She has taken the value she got from her studies and passed it on to her children.

Isabel never moved from the city. She was born and raised in the city of Maputo and has her own home. She is an official of the state and works for the Municipal Council in the city of Maputo.

This is her first loan through Hluvuku which she discovered through some coleagues that were already clients for some time. She intends to pay back the loan before maturity so she can request another loan to refurbish two other homes for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Isabel Jamisse M. Tem 47 anos de idade. É viuva e mae de 4 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 25 anos, o segundo com 22 anos, o terceiro com 16 anos e quarto com 12 anos de idade. O primeiro ja se junto e vive na sua casa. Isabel estudou até 12ªclasse e deixou de continuar quando faleceu o seu marido. Tendo levado os valores que custearia os estudos dela para custear os estudos dos filhos. Isabel nunca mudou se de cidade, nasceu e cresceu na cidade de Maputo e tem casa própria. Isabel é funcionaria do estado e trabalha no conselho municipal da cidade de maputo. Este é o primeiro empréstimo e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que já são clientes a muito tempo. Isabel pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro emprestimo para reabiliatr outras duas casa para os seus filhos.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi H., 47 years old, is the owner of a small general store. She joined the TYM Fund since 1997. After 10 years of membership, her family economy becomes more stable. She has 2 grown-up children. She is owning a general store to assist local people with common merchandises. Since her house is facing the road that links different towns together, her customers are not only from in town but also people from other places. The general store brings her a profit of about 200 USD/month. Besides, her husband also breeds animals. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in her general store. Her total income is approximately 275 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Hồng 47 tuổi hiện đang là chủ của của hàng tạp hoá nhỏ. Chị Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay gia đình chị có một cửa hàng tạp hoá buôn bán các mặt hàng gia dụng phục vụ cho nhân dân trong vùng. Nhà chị nằm ở mặt đường giao thông liên xã do đó khách hàng đến với của hàng của chị không chỉ có nhân dân địa phương mà còn có cả khách hàngcủa các xã lân cận do vậy công việc buôn bán của chị có rất nhiều thuân lợi. Cửa hàng cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài công việc buôn bán chồng chị cũng giúp chị nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng tạp hoá. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Marcelino Valerio

texts.pt:
Marcelino Valerio T. is married and the father of 5 children with ages of 30, 25, 23, 17, and 13. The youngest 3 go to school. Besides his children Marcelino supports both a grandson and a nephew who also live with them in their home.

He went to school until the 4th grade and did not continue becuase of the national liberation war. In 1967 he left Mozambique and went to Tanzania to take refuge from the war. In 1972 he returned to Mozambique to the center of the country as a combatant in the national liberation.

In 1979 he was discharged and came to live in the province of Maputo with his family. Marcelino is a permanent employee in the Military hospital in the city of Maputo.

This is his third loan. He used the money from the first loan to purchase paint for his home and used the second loan to buy a bed and some appliances. Marcelino intends to pay back the loan before maturity so he can request another loan to open a business of raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marcelino Valerio T. é casado maritalmente e pai de 5 filhos com idade entre 30 anos o mais velhos a seguir 25 anos de idade a seguir 23 anos de idade a seguir 17 anos de idade e ultimo com 13 anos os 3 ultimos vão a escola. Para além dos filhos sustenta um neto e um sobrinho que vive com eles na sua casa. Marcelino estudou até 4ªClasse e nao continuou devido a guerra de libertação nacional. Em 1967 saiu de Moçambique para Tanzania refugiando se da guerra e em 1972 voltou para Moçambique concretamente no centro do pais como combatente da libertação nacional. Em 1979 foi desmobilizado e assim veio fixar se na provincia do Maputo com a sua familia. Marcelino é funcionario permanente no hospital Militar da cidade de Maputo. Para Marcelino este é o terceiro emprestimo onde o primeiro usou o dinheiro para compra de Tintas para pintar a sua residencia e o segundo compra uma cama e Alguns electrodomesticos. Marcelino pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para abrir um negocio de criação de frangos.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family house

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Huyền năm nay 48 tuổi. Là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1997 đến nay qua  nhiều vòng vốn chị đều là người sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Khi bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình,  chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ biết cách làm ăn và chăm chỉ kinh tế của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được tăng lên. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 2 con đã khôn lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15 triệu đồng đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ thán

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Suban

texts.pt:
Suban I. is a native of Maputo, married, and the father to a one-year-old son. He has provided for himself for 10 years since he moved out of his parents' home.

He studied until the 12th grade and has been an english professor for 3 years. Besides teaching classes he is a businessman with an establishment and one employee. He keeps the hours of 7:00am through 7:00pm. He taught himself and committed to the business three years ago. His best selling products are cookies. He has a daily income of 600MT.

This is the second loan through Hluvuku and his first loan with Kiva. He used the first loan to purchase merchandise and he will use this loan for the same. With this loan he will grow the volume of his business.

In the future Suban intends to request another loan to open a Teka Way. He will try to maintain the business and expand to permit employing more people.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Suban I. natural de Maputo e casado, pai de um filho com um ano de idade, a dez anos que é responsavel da sua pessoa, isto é, que vive fora da casa dos pais. Suban I. estudou até 12ªclasse e é professor de ingles a 3 anos. Para alem de dar aulas é comerciante com um estabelecimento e um empregado, com um horario das 7:00h as 19;00h. Aprendeu sozinho e a 3 anos que se dedica a este negocio. O produto que tem mais saída é bolachas. tem um rendimento diário de 600,00mt. Este é o segundo empréstimo do Suban na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro usou para compra de mercadoria e este também vai comprar mercadoria. Com emprestimo vai aumentar o volume do negocio. No futuro Suban pretende pedir outro emprestimo para abrir um Teka Way. Tentar manter o negocio actual e desenvolver o mesmo para permitir empregar mais pessoas.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Nelson Moises

texts.pt:
Nelson Moises M. is 30 years old and native to the province of Maputo in the district of Boane. He is single with a 3 year old son. Beyond his family he supports 3 siblings by sending them money or food at the end of every month.

Nelson studied through the 8th grade and did not continue due to the financial situation of his family. He has never moved and has always lived in Boane. He has his own home. Nelson works for Petromoc, a service station in Boane, and he works from 8:00am to midnight 3 days per week.

This is the third loan for Nelson, and the first two were used to purchase construction materials (1st loan=4,200MT, 2nd loan=7,200MT). Likewise, this loan will also be applied to purchase construction materials given that he is building his house in phases. Nelson intends to pay back before maturity because he is also requesting another loan to open a small business for his girlfriend.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Nelson Moises M. tem 30 anos de idade, natural da provincia do Maputo, distrito de Boane, solteiro e pai de um filho com 3 anos de idade. Para além da sua familia sustenta 3 irmao enviando lhes dinheiro ou produtos alimentares no fim de cada més. Nelson estudou até 8ªClasse e não continuou devido a situação financeira da família e nunca mudou se de cidade, sempre viveu em Boane. Tem casa própria. Nelson M. é trabalhador da Petromoc, estação de serviço de Boane com Horiario das 8:H as 0:00h 3 dias por semana. Este é o terceiro empréstimo para Nelson, onde os dois primeiros foram para compra de material de construção ( 1º =4200,00mt, 2º =7200,00mt ). Assim este também vai aplicar o dinheiro na compra de material de construção dado que está fazendo a casa em fase. Nelson pretende pagar antes do tempo dado que vai solicitar outro emprestimo para abrir um pequeno negocio para sua esposa.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Sabes Group

texts.fr:
Within the context of fighting against poverty, under-employment and illegal emigration, SABES is an effective organization within several domains, such as business, fishing, agriculture, and processing fishing products. Every time there is a ceremony (baptisms, marriages, deaths) in Senegal, and particularly in Dakar, there is a need felt by the community to rent chairs and tarps in order to set up a place for their guests. The youth of SABES would like to take out a loan in order to buy chairs and tarps and offer a service to the community that sets up these locations. The goal is to fill the gap left by the effects of the economic difficulties on the main businesses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, le sous-emploi et l'émigration clandestine, Sabes est une structure agissant dans plusieurs domaines tels que le commerce, la pêche, l'agriculture, transformation des produits halieutiques. Vu qu'au Sénégal particulièrement à Dakar, à chaque fois qu'il y a cérémonie (baptêmes, mariages, décès), nous sentons le besoin de la population à louer des chaises et bâches pour mettre en place leurs invités. C'est pourquoi nous jeunes de SABES, souhaitons avoir un financement pour offrir un service de proximité à la population en achetant des chaises et bâches et faire la location de ce matériel dans le but de combler le vide laissé par nos activités principales touchées par les difficultés conjoncturelles.

loans.use: Buy chairs and tarps for the locations

loans.name: Huyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Huyen is a 48 year old woman. As a partner of TYM since 1997, she has been using the loans efficiently. When she first participated in the program, a proportion of the loan was used to invest in a family-based live-stock farm; while her husband used the rest of the loan to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then resell it to manufactures. Thanks to their good entrepreneurship and diligence, the family’s financial situation has improved. At the moment, her 2 children have grown up. She plans to use the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate pig stalls and buy more pigs. The family’s frequent income is about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Huyền năm nay 48 tuổi. Là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997 đến nay qua nhiều vòng vốn chị đều là người sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Khi bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ biết cách làm ăn và chăm chỉ kinh tế của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được tăng lên. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 2 con đã khôn lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Tam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tam is a 40 year old woman. At the moment, she is a construction worker. In 1997, she became TYM member, borrowing money to invest in a family-based live-stock farm. After 10 year working on the project, she is now experienced; the live-stock farm has been expanding and becoming efficient. Before her participation in the TYM program, the family's financial situation was harsh because they did not have money to invest and the main income was from farming only. Now, the situation has improved; her children have grown up. They built a new house and bought more necessary facilities. They plan to expand the size of the farm; therefore, they want to borrow 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy 3 more breeding pigs and more food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Tâm năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị hiện làm nghề thợ xây tại địa phương. Năm 1997 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình, đến nay qua 10 năm thực hiện dự án chăn nuôi chị đã có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm vì thế công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng được mở rộng và có hiệu quả. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn và thu nhập chỉ dựa vào nông nghiệp. Đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn các con của chị đều đã trưởng thành, gia đình chị đã xây được nhà khang trang và mua sắm thêm được các đồ dùng trong gia đình. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch mở rộng quy mô chăn nuôi vì thế chị mong muốn được vay thêm 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 3 con lợn giốn và mua thức ăn phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi.

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thanh is a 44 year old woman. She has been a TYM partner since 2006. At the moment, besides farming, the couple is working on a small business. Everyday, her husband purchases cassava, which she would sell to local customers, from wholesalers. This business brings in a frequent income of 2,000,000 per month. If they can pay the wholesalers money when they purchase the cassava, they can pay less amount of money. Therefore, she wants to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy cassava in large amounts.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Thanh năm nay 44 tuổi. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại ngoài công việc chăn nuôi và làm nông nghiệp cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm thêm công việc buôn bán. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua sắn từ các đại bàn lân cận về chi chị bán tại các chợ phục vụ bà con địa phương, công việc kinh doanh cho thu nhập khoảng 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Nếu có tiền để trả tiền hàng ngay khi mua, anh chị có thể mua được hàng giá rẻ hơn.Vì thế vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn mua sắn về bán phục vụ bà con địa phương

loans.use: retail cassava

loans.name: Lan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lan Thi V. is a 35 year old woman. She has been a TYM partner since 2006. Her husband is a construction worker, whose income is about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Before her participation in TYM program, the family income was mainly from her husband’s income and revenue from farming. Becoming a partner, they have been using the loan to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then reselling it to manufacturers. This business brings in frequent revenue of 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to use a proportion of the next loan of 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand the business and buy some breeding pigs. Family's frequent income is about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Lan năm nay 35 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006.Chồng chị là thợ xây thu nhập khoảng 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu dựa vào lương của chồng và làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị đã bàn với chồng vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc này hiện nay cho thu nhập đều đặn 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán phế liệu chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ. Chị dự định sẽ dùng một phần nhỏ trong số vốn vay tới để mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi.

Thu nhập bình quân3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy back scrap-iron and invest in live-stock farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hang Thi N. has been a TYM partner since 2005. She has 3 small children; therefore at the moment, she stays home to look after them and a family-based live-stock farm. She has been using loans to invest in her farming projects, and thanks to her experiences in farming, these projects have been bringing in revenues of approximately 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per year. Her husband is a bronze-smith worker, whose income is about 1,800,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to use the next loan of 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm and buy more pigs. Family’s frequent income is about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 2005. .Gia đình chị có 3 con còn nhỏ vì thế hiện tại chị đang ở nhà chăn nuôi và chăm sóc con cái.Từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đều vay vốn để đầu tư vào các dự án chăn nuôi. Do có kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi nên các dự án này sau khi kết thúc đều cho thu nhập khoảng 7.000.000/ năm. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi đúc đồng thuê cho các xưởng đúc cho thu nhập 1.800.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine K. was born on April 7, 1973 in COTONOU. Married to Nicéphore KOGBETO, a printer by trade, she is a trained seamstress. She has two children: Ornella (age 13) is in 7th grade, and Mariano (age 8) is in 3rd grade. Besides her sewing business, she has been selling a variety of goods for ten years. Because of her teeming customers, she finds herself compelled to increase her inventory of various goods, and so she is requesting a loan capable of meeting her customers' demands. She is on her fourth loan with our institution and always makes her payments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. Martine est née le 07/04/1973 à COTONOU. Epouse de AKOGBETO Nicéphore imprimeur de son état, elle est couturière de formation. Elle est mère de deux enfants Ornella 13 ans en classe de cinquième et Mariano 8ans en classe de CE2. En dehors de son activité de couture elle vend divers produits et ceci depuis 10 ans. A cause de l’affluence de ses clients, elle se retrouve dans l’obligation d’augmenter son stock de produits divers d’où elle sollicite un crédit pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle est à son quatrième crédit dans notre institution et rembourse toujours bien.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of milk, 5 bags of pasta, 20 bars of soap, and 1 sack of ordinary rice

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba used her first loan of 250,000 CFA francs to set up an area in her house to make fruit and vegetable products. In this area, she makes fruit drinks and jam which she sells in her neighborhood. Her products are used during family ceremonies instead of artificial drinks.
 Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Coumba a installé une petite unité de transformation de fruits et légumes dans la maison familliale.Avec  son unité elle transforme les fruits en boisson ,en  confiture qu'elle vend au niveau du quartier.Ses produits sont utilisés lors des céréménies familliales à la place des boissons chimiques.

Avec ce nouveau credit, elle compte renforcer ses stocks de matieres premieres. Ce pret sera d'un grand apport dans l'amélioration de la  rentabilité de son activité.

Cette mere de famille tres dynamique compte beaucoup sur les financement de Kiva pour développer son activité

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Wilmer G. and I have run a shop selling used clothing for the past 5 years.  I live with my mother and have the support of my two nephews in selling my product.  I have many clients since the clothing I sell is of high quality and I offer good prices.  

Currently, I need to purchase more used clothing to achieve higher sales and with the profits, I hope to finish constructing the bathroom of my home.  This is why I seek a loan in order to move my business and my family forward. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Wilmere G. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que realizo hace 5 años, vivo con mi madre, y tengo el apoyo de 2 sobrinos para vender mi producto, tengo muchos clientes ya que la ropa que vendo es de buena calidad y les doy buen precio. en estos momentos necesito comprar mas ropa usada para tener mas ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga deseo terminar de construir el baño y servicio sanitario de mi casa. por lo que pido ayuda para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr:
Born on June 9, 1976 in Cotonou, Ms. Diane A. is married to Dodji DANSOU, a diesel mechanic, and is the mother of a 12-year-old child. She has been residing in Ménontin, a district in Cotonou, for seven years. A seamstress by training, she has an interest in catering. Five years ago, she discovered her talent in this work and has plenty of customers each day. The quality of her meals is an appealing element. She would now like to buy condiments in bulk to reduce purchasing costs. Ms. Diane A. is on her second loan and does a good job making her payments. She is requesting this loan to achieve this objective and to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 09/06/1976 à Cotonou, dame A. Diane est mariée à DANSOU Dodji mécanicien diéséliste et est mère d’un enfant âgé de 12 ans. Elle réside à Ménontin un quartier de Cotonou depuis 7 ans. Couturière de formation, elle a un goût pour la restauration. Depuis plus de cinq ans, elle s'est trouvée des talents dans cette activité et reçoit plein de clients par jour. La qualité de ses repas est un élément d'attrait pour elle. Elle voudrait désormais acheter les condiments en gros pour réduire les coûts d'achat. Dame A. Diane est à son deuxième crédit et rembourse très bien. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour atteindre cet objectif et pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy a box of tomato paste

loans.name: Marvin Alexis

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Marvin O. and I run a small internet cafe, offering international calling and photocopying services as well.  I’ve run the business for over one year and my clientele is great.  They love the speed of the internet and the clarity of the long-distance phone calls.  My wife helps me attend to the customers while also caring for our children as we run the cafe out of our home.  

Currently, my business is growing and I need to buy more computers and other supplies to attend to our customers better and meet their demands.  This is why I am seeking a loan in order to move forward with my business and my family. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Marvin O. me dedico a prestar el servicio de internet, llamadas al exterior y fotocopiado, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mi clientela es muy buena ya que les gusta la velocidad del internet y que las llamadas telefonicas se escucha bien claro, tengo la ayuda de mi esposa para la atencion de los clientes asi no descuidamos a nuestros hijos ya que ella pasa permanente en la casa y nuesto negocio queda en nuestra casa de habitacion, en estos momentos mi negocio esta creciendo y necesito comprar mas computadoras y otros suministros para poder atender a mis clientes de una mejor forma y poder cubrir con las necesidades de ellos por tal razon estoy solicitando ayuda crediticia para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of two computers and computer supplies

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jose Mario R. and I work in the purchase and sales of household consumer goods, such as dining room and living rooms sets, sofas, chairs, etc.  I purchase the goods from distributors and later sell them to my customers on credit. 

Currently, I have a large order of goods to sell but unfortunately, I don’t have sufficient capital to invest in those goods.  This is why I am seeking a loan to be able to purchase the goods, sell them and generate a decent income since this is my only job and the only source of income to sustain my home and my family. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Jose Mario R. me dedico a la compra-venta de articulos para el hogar como ser comedores, juegos de sala, sillones, sillas, etc, yo compro los articulos a los distribuidores y luego los vendo a mis clientes al credito, en estos momentos tengo un gran pedido de articulos para vender pero lastimosamente no tengo el capital para invertir en dichos articulos, por tal razon necesito una ayuda economica para poder comprar estos articulos y poder venderlos y tener ganancias, este es mi unico trabajo y con esto sustento mi hogar y mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of dining room and living room sets

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Ms. Reine A. was born on June 7, 1972 in Cotonou and in married to Dominique GOUSSI, an auto mechanic. This couple has in their care four children: Chantal (age 18) in 9th grade, Eric (age 13) in 5th grade, Gloria (age 9) in 4th grade, and Joinita (age 3). Ms. Reine A. sells various condiments in one of the municipal marketplaces in Cotonou called AÏDJEDO. She resides in Midombo, a district in Cotonou. She has been doing this work for six years. Thanks to her business, she helps her husband support the family. After her first loan of 60,000 francs CFA in 2007, her business experienced a remarkable improvement, and today she has many customers that she is unable to satisfy entirely, due to a lack of financial means. Also, she wishes to stock up in bulk. She is requesting her third loan to deal with the difficulties that she is experiencing in meeting the expectations of her numerous customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame A. Reine est née le 07/09/1972 à Cotonou et est mariée à GOUSSI Dominique électricien auto. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants que sont Chantal 18ans et en classe de troisième, Eric 13 ans et en classe de CM2, Gloria 9 ans et en classe de CM1 et Joinita 3 ans. Dame A. Reine vend divers condiments dans l’un des marchés de la municipalité de Cotonou du nom d’ AÏDJEDO. Elle réside à Midombo un quartier de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Grâce à cette activité, elle vient en aide à son mari pour les charges de famille. Après son premier crédit de 60000 Fcfa en 2007, son activité a connu une évolution remarquable et aujourd’hui elle a de nombreux clients qu'elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire pleinement faute de moyens financiers. Elle souhaite également faire ses approvisionnements en gros. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés qu'elle éprouve à satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of tomato paste, two baskets of fresh tomatoes, a basket of fresh chili peppers, and other condiments

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery, who is 38 years old, is a hard-working and dedicated woman. Eight years ago she decided to have her own source of income, to which she is very attentive and works arduously. Mery set aside a small space in her home to sell food, offering delicious meals in the afternoons. During the day she takes care of and tends her flock of sheep. Mery accomplishes these activities for the well-being of her three children, who are school-aged and being young children need lots of support and love. The loan that Mery needs is for the purchase of general goods in bulk in order to prepare meal and to feed her sheep. Support Mery's noble casue so she can continue to move forward for the sake of those she loves the most, her children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Mery, con 38 años de edad es una mujer luchadora y muy empeñosa, hace ocho años que decidió tener su propia fuente de ingreso, para ello es que está muy atenta a trabajar arduamente. Mery acondicionó en su casa un pequeño espacio para la venta de comida, ofrece deliciosos platos por las tardes, y por el día ella se dedica al cuidado de su rebaño de ovejas. Estas actividades las realiza Mery por el bienestar de sus tres hijos que están aún en edad escolar y al estar pequeños necesitan mucho de su apoyo y cariño. El préstamo que necesita Mery es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para el preparado de sus platos y de alimento para sus ovejas. Apoya la noble causa de Mery, y a continuar adelante por el bienestar de los seres que más ama, sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the sheep she raises and sells, in addition to the food she also sells to her neighbors.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a family mom who is always looking for opportunities. She does not let anything go by that could provide daily income for her family. She is 35 years old and has three children, two of which are still very young, which is why a few years ago she decided to contribute to the household income. In order to earn money, she works in various faculties and a year ago established a business selling typical hats of Huancayno. These hats are commonly worn by the local people because they live in a very sunny climate, but also by tourists, who take back to their homes a beautiful Huancayno hat as a reminder of their travels. Jessica sells the hats on foot and desires to grow her business. She needs more capital in order to obtain new hats to sell.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Jessica es una madre de familia que siempre está atenta a las oportunidades, no deja pasar ninguna a fin de que pueda conseguir el sustento diario para los suyos. Tiene actualmente 35 años y tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales son todavía pequeños, por ello, años atrás decidió apoyar en la economía de su hogar, por lo cual emprendió múltiples oficios y desde hace un año se ha establecido en el negocio de la venta de sombreros típicos de Huancayo. Estos sombreros son usados comúnmente por las personas de su localidad, porque tienen un clima soleado y también para los turistas que se llevan a sus ciudades de origen un lindo sombrero huancayno como recuerdo. Actualmente, Jessica los vende de manera ambulante y su deseo es poder crecer en este negocio. Ella necesita incrementar su capital para adquirir nuevos sombreros para la venta.

loans.use: Increased business capital to purchase new hats to sell.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
Maria is a very talented woman who always tries to offer her clientele the best finishes and quality in embroidered skirts. These skirts are typical outfits that are used during the customary festivals in the region. Since she was 6 years old, Maria has been dedicated to the art of embroidery. Her story started when she, herself, needed a skirt to participate in one of these festivals. Her curiosity and talent produced her first skirt. It was a well-made skirt and captivated the people who saw it. Since that day she has received various orders for her embroidered skirts.

Today Maria's dream is to continue producing, at a better quantity and quality, her orders, which have increased due to the upcoming Festival in her area. The majority of people come back to her because they know that she is the best. This is also the work of her husband, who occasionally helps her to embroider the skirts, when Maria runs out of supplies. They have 3 children and she is 33 years old, she has so much ahead of her. The loan she is requesting is to purchase supplies of fabric, colored thread, frames, sequins, and beads, which are the necessary materials to make her skirts. Support this small, but growing family business.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer muy talentosa que siempre trata de ofrecer a su clientela lo mejor en acabado y calidad en bordados de fustanes. Estos fustanes son trajes típicos que se utilizan en las fiestas costumbristas de la zona, desde hace 6 años María se dedica a este arte. Su historia comienza cuando ella misma tuvo la necesidad de un fustán para participar en una de estas festividades, su curiosidad y talento produjeron su primer fustán, el cual tenía un fino acabado y terminó cautivando a las demás personas que lo vieron y empezaron ha hacerle varios pedidos. Hoy, el sueño de María es seguir produciendo, a mayor cantidad y calidad, sus pedidos han aumentado debido a que se acerca el tiempo de fiesta en su localidad y la mayoría de personas recurren a ella porque saben que es la mejor. Tal es el trabajo que su esposo también la apoya bordando ocasionalmente algunos de los fustanes, cuando María ya no se da abasto, tienen tres hijos y a sus 33 años, María, tiene mucho por delante. El préstamo que solicita es para abastecerse de telas, hilos de colores, bastidores, lentejuelas y mostacillas, que son los materiales necesarios para el acabado de sus fustanes. Apoya esta pequeña, pero creciente empresa familiar.

loans.use: Supply materials needed to embroider typical skirts of Huancayo, the Festivals are close and her orders have increased but she does not have money for supplies.

loans.name: El Benque Group

texts.es:
We are all merchants and each of us has her own small general store that we run out of our homes.  We have known each other for years and have always worked together.  Now, we feel very secure and very confident because we can take care of our families and also provide supplemental income to help pay the costs of our homes.  It is not easy since the housework never seems to end, but we are happy. 

Juana Francisca V.—I primarily work running my small general store in my home.  I have two children who are in primary school, who also help me run the store in their free time.  Currently, I need to provide more stock for my store in order to offer a greater variety of products to my customers and hopefully earn a higher income in the process. 

Alba Luz V. O.—I have run a small general store in the center of my neighborhood for many years.  Having the store in my home allows me to simultaneously take care of my children and generate income to help with the costs of our home.  I have three student-age children.  I feel very happy to be able to work with this organization since due to the help you have offered me, my business has been able to grow. 

Belki Anabel R. I.—I run a small general store out of my home.  I am a single mother of a three-year old boy, which isn’t easy.  But thanks to the support this organization provides me, I have been able to support my son and grow my business little by little and am experiencing a better standard of living. 

Maria Magdalena C.—I have run a small general store out of my home for many years; my experience running the store has helped me to support my husband in providing for the needs of our family.  One of my children is in secondary school while the rest are still in primary school.  The income from our small store helps to improve our standard of living. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Somos comerciantes cada una cuenta con una pequeña pulperia en nuestra casa de habitacion, tenemos varios años de conocernos  y  siempre hemos trabajado juntas,  ahora nos sentimos muy seguras porque podemos cuidar a nuestra familia y  tambien generar ingresos para  contribuir con los gastos en el hogar, ya  no es facil en vista que trabajo del hogar nunca termina pero estamos contentas.

Juana Francisca V..  Mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitaci'on  tengo 2 hijos los que estan cursando  la educacion primaria,  los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre,   actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio y asi poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos

Alba Luz V.  O..  Cuento con una pequeña pulperia en el centro de mi cumunidad tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de  negocio, el que me permite atender a mis hijos y generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de la familia, tengo 3 hijos los que estan en la escuela en estos momentos me siento muy contenta  de poder trabajar con ustedes ya que con el apoyo que ustedes me brindan he visto como mi negocio ha crecido.

Belki Anabel R. I..  Mi actividad Principal es el comercio cuento con una Pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, soy madre soltera tengo un hijo de 3 años  de edad, no es facil Pero yo con el apoyo que ustedes me brindan he logrado sacar adelante a mi hijo y he visto como mi negocio  va creciendo poco a poco logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida.

Maria Magdalena C..  Soy  comerciante tengo varios años de dedicarme al negocio de pulperia, tengo muchos años de experiencia lo que me permite ayudar a  mi esposo con los gastos de nuestros
hijos, actualmente 1 de ellos esta cursando el 2do año de ciclo comun y  los demas entan en la escuela cursando la Educacion primaria, es importante mensionar que con los ingresos de este negocio hemos mejorado nuestro estilo de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, soups, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, bread, cookies, cold meats, dairy products, salt, etc.

loans.name: Rossy

texts.es:
Rossy is a valiant woman of 32 years and utilizes her young age to the maximum; on caring for her children, in her home, and on her work. A few years ago she started a business selling food, but the timing of high prices and low demand brought failure. A little later, by chance, she was offered two used Billiard tables, which she bought with what little money she had saved. Two years have passed since Rossy made that decision and she rents her tables to pool enthusiasts, who rent them for hours, providing her with the money to sustain her family.

The little corner where Rossy puts the tables has become too small, her customers have to wait until the other players finish their games, or they simply find somewhere else to go. Now she wants to expand, spruce up the environment and purchase two more tables. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting a this loan. Though she failed one, Rossy got back up and keeps pushing forward--help her.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Rossy es una mujer valiente, tiene 32 años y la juventud que posee la utiliza al máximo; en la atención de sus hijos, en su casa y en su trabajo. Hace años atrás inició un negocio de venta de comida, pero el momento de las alzas de alimentos y la poca demanda la llevaron al fracaso. Tiempo después, ocasionalmente, le ofrecieron dos mesas de billar usadas, las que compró con lo poco que le había quedado de dinero, han transcurrido dos años de esa acertada decisión y Rossy viene alquilando sus mesas para que aficionados a este juego se las alquilen por horas y así obtener el dinero para el sustento familiar.El rinconcito donde Rossy puso sus mesas ha quedado chico, los asistentes tienen que esperar a que otros acaben su juego, o simplemente se van a otro lugar. Ahora ella desea ampliar, arreglar el ambiente y comprar dos mesas adicionales, para ello es que está solicitando este préstamo. Si una vez fracasó, Rossy se levantó y ahora sigue adelante, ayúdala.

loans.use: Improve her business environment and purchase two additional Billiard tables.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a responsible and dedicated mother to her children. She is 47 years old, years that are a testament to her long trajectory in the domain of agricultural work. Today she live with three of her four children, who are the source of her strength and constant motivation to get up each morning and go to her fields to cultivate. She brings alfalfa for the cows, promptly directs them back to their stable to milk them, then sell the milk in order to bring home her daily income. This is Eva's daily work routine so that she can sustain the education of her children.

She desires to improve the state of her stable, making it more spacious in order to produce a higher quantity of milk and gain higher income. Eva is asking for a loan so that she can buy planks of calamine for the roof of her stable, so that her cows will be more comfortable and more productive.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva es una madre responsable y dedicada a sus hijos, ella actualmente tiene 47 años, que son testigos de una larga trayectoria en el ámbito de las actividades agrícolas. Hoy vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos que son su fuerza y motivación constante para levantarse cada mañana, ir a sus campos de cultivo, recoger la alfalfa para sus vacas y luego prontamente dirigirse hacia su establo para ordeñar la leche y luego venderla, para así obtener una ganancia diaria para su hogar. Esa es la rutina de trabajo de Eva, así puede sostener la educación de sus hijos. Su deseo es mejorar el estado de su establo, hacerlo más espacioso para poder producir mayor cantidad de leche y obtener mayores ganancias por la misma. Eva solicita el préstamo para poder comprar planchas de calamina para el techo de su establo. Así sus vacas estarán más confortadas y serán más productivas.

loans.use: To acquire calamine planks for the roof of her stable.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is a very hard working man: aged 54, with his work he provides for his elderly mother and other relatives. Jorge is a successful farmer who principally cultivates maize and barley which he takes to sell in the local market. Since his childhood he has undertaken agricultural labour, the inheritance of his parents’ courage and effort. In the future his desire is to continue cultivating his land and he is now preparing for the next harvest. He is therefore asking for help with a loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers. Your help with Jorge’s loan will be important in order that he is able to continue cultivating his land.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador, con sus 54 años y con su trabajo es el sostén de su anciana madre y para los suyos. Jorge es un exitoso agricultor que principalmente cultiva maíz y cebada que lleva a vender en el mercado local. Desde su niñez él se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas como herencia de valor y fuerza de sus padres. En el futuro su deseo es seguir cultivando sus tierras y ahora las prepara para la próxima siembra, él pide su apoyo con un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Tu aporte en el préstamo de Jorge será de mucha importancia para que siga cultivando la tierra.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertlizers for his fields

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, aged 22, is a young mother of a small son aged just 2, who provides both her reason for and strength to continue fighting. Teresa is from the village of Orcotuna, and she has lived there since she was born. Many have left for other towns searching for a better future, but Teresa hasn’t: she believes she can have a bright future and give her son the best of everything in her hometown.

Teresa trusts in her hands and in the land, which is the source of her sustenance. Teresa’s fields produce alfalfa, which is the feed for her livestock, who proviD. milk which she sells in the livestock market. Teresa is very courageous and knows how to control her animals, especially bulls, which she also breeds, raises and then sells in the market. Although she’s only spent one year working in this profession, Teresa is already an expert livestock farmer. The money she is asking for is in order to sow alfalfa on more of her land and to be able to buy the necessary seeds and fertiliser to do this. Teresa believes in the land, and she asks that you believe in her.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa a sus 22 años es una joven madre D. un pequeño D. tal sólo dos años, que es su razón y fuerza para luchar. Teresa es del pueblo D. Orcotuna, y allí vive desD. que nació. Muchos se fueron a otras ciudades buscando un futuro mejor, pero Teresa no, ella cree que pueD. tener un buen futuro y darle lo mejor a su hijo en su propia tierra. Teresa confía en sus manos y en esa tierra fuente D. su sustento. El terreno D. Teresa produce alfalfa, que es el alimento D. su ganado del que extrae la leche, que venD. en la feria ganadera, Teresa es muy valiente y sabe como manejar a sus animales, es especial a los toros, ya que los cría, cuida y también venD. en la feria. A pesar que sólo lleva un año trabajando D. esta manera, Teresa ya es toda una experta ganadera. El dinero que piD., es para sembrar alfalfa en otras áreas D. su terreno, comprar para ello, semillas y abono. Teresa cree en su tierra, y ella te piD. que creas en ella.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilisers in order to plant alfalfa in her fields and continue raising livestock for sale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, since she was very small, has had a great propensity to learn quickly: this has quality has served her well in learning the art of chocolate-making. It all began when she participated in a committee of the State project “A glass of milk” in her region, where she learnt to make chocolate in moulds and it was as a result of this that she decided to set-up this business. This has now been running 3 years and her delicious chocolates sell very quickly, a trend which has increased and encouraged Antonia to continue expanding her market, leading to her delivering her chocolates to some of the schools in her area. But not content with this, Antonia wants to delivers her products to all the schools in the Mantaro Valley. She is working very hard in order to achieve this.

The loan Antonia has requested is in order to buy the necessary ingredients such as: kiwicha (a Peruvian edible plant), coberture chocolate, wooden sticks etc. She is asking for 300 soles, which she promises to repay in the specified time frame and in a responsible manner. Antonia hopes that you will trust in her hard-working and honest character.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Antonia, desde muy niña tuvo gran disposición para aprender rápido, esta cualidad le ha valido para arte de la chocolatería. Todo comenzó cuando participó en un comité del proyecto de estado “El Vaso de Leche” en su región, donde le enseñaron a realizar chocolates en moldes y así es que ella decidió emprender este negocio. Han transcurrido 3 años y sus deliciosos chocolates se venden muy rápido, esta tendencia sigue creciendo, lo que anima a Antonia a seguir trabajando expandiendo su mercado, ella reparte su producto en algunas escuelas de su localidad, pero Antonia no se conforma con ello, quiere repartir a todas las escuelas del Valle del Mantaro, y está trabajando arduamente para lograrlo.

El préstamo solicitado por Antonia es para comprar los insumos necesarios como; kiwicha, cobertura de chocolate, palitos de madera, y otros. El monto que pide es de 300 soles, el cual promete pagar en el plazo indicado de manera responsable. Antonia espera que confíen en su disposición para el trabajo y honradez.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to continue making chocolates and selling them in all the regional schools

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr:
Born on November 9, 1966 in Cotonou in Littoral County, Ms. Bertille A. is married and the mother of two children, who are both in school. Her husband Eustache HOUNDJO is an accountant who lost his job several months ago. Ms. Bertille A. is a seamstress by training and has been residing in the AÏDJEDO district for eleven years. For seven years, she has been selling ready-to-eat meals in a private educational complex in her district. She is also a distributor of various goods, namely damask fabrics, soap, rice, pagne (traditional print cloth), vegetable oil, and other products. This second business activity that, in the beginning, she used to do only during vacation time, has become something daily, since her husband lost his accountant's job. She makes her purchases in the Dantokpa marketplace and also in Lomé in TOGO. As a result of financial difficulties tending to handicap improvements in her businesses, she had come to take on an initial loan of 60,000 francs CFA in 2007. Because of her very fruitful initial experience, she requested and obtained her second loan, which she repaid successfully. She comes now to request a third loan of 150,000 francs CFA for the purposes of meeting her customers' expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 09/11/1966 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral, dame A. Bertille est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Son mari HOUNDJO Eustache est comptable mais ce dernier a perdu son emploi il y a quelques mois. Dame A. Bertille est couturière de formation et réside au quartier AÏDJEDO depuis 11 ans.Elle du repas prêt à manger dans un complexe scolaire privé de de son quartier depuis 7 ans. Elle fait également de la distribution de produits divers à savoir: bassine, savon, riz, pagne, huile végétale et autres produits. Cette deuxième activité qu’elle exerçait au départ seulement pendant les vacances est devenue quotidienne depuis que son mari a perdu son emploi de comptable. Elle fait ses achats au marché Dantokpa et aussi à Lomé au TOGO. Suite à des difficultés financières tendant à handicaper l’évolution de ses activités, elle vint contracter en 2007 un premier crédit de 60.000F CFA. Forte de sa première expérience très fructueuse ; elle a sollicité et obtenu son 2ème prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Elle vient maintenant solliciter un troisième prêt de 150.000 F CFA en vue de satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of FANICO soap, two boxes of BF soap, six large bowls, and a sack of rice (50 kg)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard-working woman who undertakes the hard manual labour of the fields. Year after year she worked as a day-labourer on other people’s lands: often they didn’t recognise the tremendous effort she made with the meagre pay they gave her. Because of this, five years ago Maria decided to dedicate herself entirely to the wholesale retail of carrots: she also sells alfalfa occasionally. Maria’s work consists of going to the cultivation fields at the time of the carrot harvest: after the washing process she selects them, packages them and then sells them wholesale in the wholesale market in Huancayo. In this way Maria is an important economic provider in her household, above all for her three children who are still studying. Maria’s wish is to obtain a loan in order to buy a larger quantity of carrots and thus increase her profits. If previously unkind people have taken advantage of Maria’s neediness, she has now learnt that with continued efforts it is possible to advance her family’s well-being by herself. Your help will be very valuable in her life, and something that she will never forget.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

María es una mujer muy trabajadora dedicada a las duras tareas del campo, año tras año trabajó como peón en otras tierras, muchas veces no compensaba el tremendo esfuerzo que hacía con el pago que le daban. Por ello hace 5 años atrás María decide dedicarse enteramente a la venta de zanahorias al por mayor, también se dedica a la venta de alfalfa de manera ocasional. El trabajo de María consiste en ir a los terrenos de cultivo para la cosecha de zanahoria, luego de un proceso de lavado las selecciona, encostala y así las vende al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de Huancayo. De esta manera María es un sostén importante para la economía de su hogar, sobre todo para sus 3 hijos que están estudiando. El deseo de María es obtener el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de zanahoria y obtener mayores ganancias. Si antiguamente personas desconsideradas se aprovechaban de la necesidad de María, ella ahora ha aprendido que con su esfuerzo y empeño puede sacar adelante a su familia por sí misma, tu apoyo sería muy valioso para su vida, algo que nunca olvidará.

loans.use: Maria needs to buy a larger quantity of carrots during the harvest in order to sell them in her local market

loans.name: Yoly

texts.es:
Yola is a young 26 year old mother, who together with her husband fights to consolidate her family’s well-being. Yoly is the mother of two small children: one aged 7 and the other who is in fact yet to arrive: at the moment she’s still pregnant and she and her husband are waiting with much love for the baby’s arrival. Throughout all this, her husband is a great support in heavy physical tasks: his daily work consists of caring for their stable and their cows, which provide an income from the sale of the milk they produce. Every day, Yoly takes the cows to open spaces full of vegetation in order that they can feed themselves, and then later hers them back to the stable. This couple have suggested building-up a stable with a larger quantity of milk cows of better stock. And thus, the loan that they are asking for is to buy a milk cow from good stock. With a better quality of milk to sell, and with your help, this couple, their son and their future baby will have a better quality of life. Please, help them.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Yoly es una joven madre de familia de 26 años, que junto a su esposo, luchan por consolidar el bienestar de su familia. Yoly es madre de 2 pequeños; uno de 7 años y otro que está por llegar, ya que actualmente, está embarazada, ella y su esposo esperan con mucho amor a su bebe. Mientras tanto su esposo es un gran apoyo en las actividades de mayor esfuerzo físico, su trabajo diario consiste en cuidar de su establo y de sus vacas, las cuales generan ingresos económicos al vender la leche que producen. Cada día, Yoly se lleva a sus vacas a espacios abiertos llenos de vegetación para que se alimenten, y luego las regresa al establo. Esta pareja de esposos se ha propuesto tener un establo con mayor cantidad de vacas lecheras de mejor raza. Y justamente el préstamo que piden es para comprar una vaca lechera de buena raza, que de mejor calidad de leche para la venta, con tu ayuda esta pareja, su hijo y su futuro bebé tendrán una mejor calidad de vida. Apóyalos.

loans.use: To acquire a milk cow from good stock in order to improve the quality of the milk she produces.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Born around 1952 in Cotonou, Ms. Pierrette G. is a widow and the mother of five. Currently, she has responsibility for two children: Rachelle (age 28) who is an apprentice in hairdressing, and Emilienne (age 25) who has an associate's level degree and is lacking work. Since her husband's death, she by herself ensures her family is supported, thanks to the income derived from her business. She sells firewood and makes a fair income. She resides in Abokicodji, a district of Cotonou, and has had this business for over 40 years. She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA in order to have an inventory capable of meeting her customers' expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1952 à Cotonou, dame G. Pierrette est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Actuellement, elle a à sa charge deux enfants Rachelle âgée de 28 ans et apprentie coiffeuse et Emilienne 25 ans et diplômée sans emploi niveau (BAC + 2). Depuis la mort de son mari elle assure seule les charges familiales grâce aux revenus qu'elle tire de son activité. Elle vend du bois de chauffage et en tire un revenu non négligeable. Elle réside à Abokicodji un quartier de Cotonou et exerce cette activité depuis plus de 40 ans. Elle sollicite son cinquième crédit d'un montant de 250 000F CFA afin de pouvoir constituer un stock pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 8 small truck loads of firewood

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo has his own house in the zone of Las Lomas (a poor suburban area of the city of La Paz) with his wife (Placida Quispe, travelling vegetable saleswoman) and their two children. Carmelo is employed in construction work, and does his business by offering his services in private homes (for example; the demolition of a wall, refurbishment, installation of furniture or building, etc.)

Past credits were used for the construction and finishing work of their home (now finished) but there are still a few more details that they would like to take care of. For this reason, Carmelo is asking for the credit in order to demolish the front wall that is old and running the risk of falling down (at present it is not possible for him to do so because he doesn’t have the proper tools nor the sufficient financial resources.) This will be his fifth credit. The socio-economic analysis has determined him to be well-qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo tiene casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas (área suburbana pobre de La Paz) con su esposa (Placida Quispe, vendedora de verduras ambulante) y sus dos hijos. El cliente traba como empleado en construcción, su método consiste en brindar sus servicios en casas particulares (demolición de una pared, refacción, instalación de muebles o empotrado, etc.).

Anteriores créditos le sirvieron para realizar la construcción en obra fina de su vivienda (acabado) pero aún quedan detalles por terminar. Por lo tanto, Carmelo solicita crédito para demoler el muro frontal que por su antigüedad corre el riesgo de caer (él no esta en posibilidades de hacerlo, no tiene las herramientas ni los suficientes recursos financieros). Este será su quinto crédito, el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Demolition of an old front wall (in order to construct a new wall)
